column1: Follow Me on My Journey
I am so excited to share every step of the way with you through my blog &

","A Mandala On A Mission I’ve been called to serve as a health & wellness educator in Indonesia & connect with visionaries interested in changing the world at a non-profit event in Thailand. My desire is build community & learn how to give back to the world purposefully, resourcefully & on a larger scale.
Why Mandala?

I have been so inspired by how art has changed my life in so many countless ways. Picking up a pen again gave me the courage to express myself no matter what the end result was, it allowed me to be a ‘kid’ again when I felt the pressures of the world getting to me & got to me trust in myself and the greatness inside.

It was through coloring & drawing these mandalas that I was reminded of how connected and in need of each other we all are. I used to think that I needed money to survive, but now I know all I need is people and surviving is no longer my goal - it’s thriving. Witnessing the power of this ‘giving and receiving’ first hand has humbled me and continues to amaze me with miracles all around me. This personal experience has shifted my whole view on money, career & life purpose.
I do not have all the answers as to why I’ve been called to serve here & now, but intuition continues to drop undeniable bread crumbs in the direction and I can not ignore.

I humbly ask for your support in sending me to Indonesia to volunteer as a health & wellness educator where I hope to share how art has healed my soul. The funds raised will go towards my airfare, accommodations and send me to the non-profit event called Afest in Thailand where I will be able to train and connect with likeminded visionaries interested in pushing humanity forward.
A More Colorful Future For All

What I am looking forward to most is sharing my smile, educating & loving on the children of Bali in need of touch & inspiration. As a part of my education in wellness, I would like to donate coloring books & coloring tools to the children.  My mission is to offer children a way to express and heal themselves through shape, color & intention.
Want more information on how art can heal?
http://www.bbc.com/news/magazine-21579762
What is a Mandala?

Mandala’s have a couple of different meanings and definitions but to me a mandala is a natural artistic expression of the balance & connectedness of all that exists or has ever existed. Like many other art forms, mandalas have the power to relax the mind & evoke beautiful emotions.
Follow Me on My Journey
I am so excited to share every step of the way with you through my blog & Instagram www.LifeByJazz.com & @LifeByJazz on Instagram.",5.0,4,"1 Campaign
|","Los Angeles, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/mandala-mission-a-more-colorful-future-for-all/pica

A Cold Drop on A Hot Stone
Welcome to our campaign! I am Ravi, this is Sarah, and we are two passionate, highly skilled Registered Nurses heading to Lesvos, Greece to lend a hand to the incoming refugees.

Lesvos is experiencing a humanitarian crisis. People are fleeing their homes to find safe refuge in Europe, and their whole journey is filled with danger. Aid organizations and the Greek government are unable to cope with the 125,000 people arriving monthly.
Local volunteers and tourists have stepped up to help, and we want to be a part of it.

Our friend, who is working on the ground in Lesvos, sent us a message one night and said that a boat just arrived with 10 unconscious children on and that there was a call for anyone who knew CPR to get to the harbour.
We didn't know it was that bad.
As nurses with international aid experience, we knew that we had to go.
---
<div>
100% of your donations will go directly to the refugees.
We are self-funding all personal costs including flights, car rentals, petrol, accommodation and food.

When people land on shore after their long journey, they can be hypothermic, dehydrated, exhausted and scared. With our medical skills, we will urgently be needed on the north coast, providing treatment for hypothermia, dehydration and drownings.
Your funds will go to:
1) Emergency Medical Supplies - Dehyrdration: Dehydration is a killer. We will be buying water, oral rehydration salts, and oral syringes for child refugees as they come off the boats.

2) Emergency Medical Supplies - Hypothermia: Sometimes coming over in dinghies, refugees are exposed to the elements and often travelling at night-time when the wind and rain are ferocious. We will be buying blankets, dry clothing (socks, underwear, trousers, hats, gloves, shoes, sleeping bags, tents) and emergency foil blankets to bring body temperature back to normal.
3) Emergency Medical Supplies - Medical Supplies: Medical needs can be complex and acute. We will be buying medicine, first aid kits, wound dressing packs and simple pain relief.

All supplies, where possible, will be purchased in Greece to support the local economy. An important principle in international humanitarian work is to purchase goods and services locally. This way, the local economy is not undermined, especially with Greece in the midst their own dreadful financial crisis.
We will update this page on a daily basis with how your money was directly used (that day!) and will show it in action with the refugees.
----

We've done this type of work before. 

Both of us have a Diploma in Tropical Nursing from the Liverpool School of Tropical Medicine. Ravi has a Masters in Public Health from the London School of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine while Sarah is almost finished her Masters in Environment and Human Health. 

Sarah was the Lead Medic in Tanzania for an expedition with Raleigh International, as well as working abroad in the Middle East. Most recently, Ravi has worked with Doctors without Borders (MSF) running a refugee camp hospital in South Sudan. He has started 2 different NGO's,  and has been a part of earthquake relief projects in Peru, infrastructure building in Nicaragua and medical education development in Rwanda. He currently teaches at the Liverpool School of Tropical Medicine (LSTM). 
----

We know that international development is difficult and complex. 

There are few, multinational organizations on the ground in Lesvos. It is the groups of hearty volunteers that are coming together which are making a big impact. 

Making a cold drop on a hot stone is better than making no drop at all. 

Anyone can help, and it doesn't have to just be through financial means. Use the Indiegogo share tools and tweet, facebook, or linked in this campaign. 

We will also be updating using @ravijaipaul from Nov. 12-21st as well as at our blog:
https://colddroponahotstone.wordpress.com/

column2:
>
From the bottom of our hearts, thank you. 
Ravi and Sarah
----

If you'd prefer to buy things yourself , and need to know what is currently needed and where to send them, you may find these links helpful:

column1: 1) Lesvos Volunteers: Several teams are working on the north coast of Lesvos. They provide the refugees arriving by boat with dry clothes and shoes, rain ponchos, sleeping bags, food, medical help, information and buses.

2) Eric and Phillipa Kempson: Are a British couple who have lived on Lesvos for many years. They have been helping the refugees since February and have developed a well organized and co-ordinated approach - 

http://www.amazon.co.uk/registry/wishlist/16M4UIKPSEIFM

There are almost 20,000 individual viewers following Lila's story on  bornthisway-french.tumblr.com, if each person gives $1, that would makes around $20,000 for CDH!!
Why donate?

Think of the new clothes you just bought, the groceries, the vacation you just got back from, the cup of coffee you bought on the way to work, each day you spend money on everyday things. What if you took $1 out of your day, and donated it to CDH? Each dollar makes a difference! Be the change, take a CHANCE, maybe your dollar will help give another a CHANCE at life.
<div>
Where is this donation going?
You donation is helping in MANY ways!
Lila's Chance is used to:
<ul>
• Support Lila, and her family. (medical bills and expenses.)
• To put together care packages for CDH babies and families.
• CDH Research at Cincinnati Children's Hospital
What is CDH?

CDH is a life threatening birth defect, around 1600 babies are diagnosed with CDH in one year. The cause of CDH is unknown. 90% of CDH babies have Left-Sided CDH, 10% of babies, including Lila, are Right-Sided.
More information on CDH: http://www.cincinnatichildrens.org/service/f/fetal-care/conditions/cdh/default/
<div>
Meet Lila, to follow her journey, visit http://bornthisway-french.tumblr.com/
<div>

Mission: A person is a person no matter how small

Summary

My name is Luis Enrique and I have been a teacher for 9 years. I work with high school students in a rural community of Northern Nicaragua where there are few resources to support the teaching English process. Unlike many classrooms in other parts of the world, students don't have access to dictionaries in class or a public library where they could study.

Having resources like workbooks, dictionaries or videos will motivate the students during class and give them extra opportunities to practice their English, an important skill for future employment. These resources will not only impact current students but the ones that are to come. 

What We Need

I am looking to raise 500 dollars to buy materals for my  classes. I wiil use the money in the following way:
<ul>
• $180 for dictionaries (30 dictionaries at $6/each)
• $300 for workbooks and videos for the 5 levels of class
• $20 for transport

The Impact

In the community where I work the people there do not have money to buy their own books. Having a classroom set of dictionaries and workbooks with enhance the learning experience and motivate students to participate in class. Not only will the students increase their English abilities, but they will also grow in their love of learning. They will be able to investigate and practice English like they never have before. In the future we are going to have students that are ready to communicate with foreign visitors to our community and our region.

Challenges

Once we have the books in the classroom it will be important to make the students aware of the proper use and care of the materials so that we have them for years to come.

Other Ways You Can Help

Don´t forget to share this project with friends, family or educators that might be willing to donate! Thank you for your support!

Want to Hear from Me Personally? Watch This...
column8:
/>

Hi! My name is Philip Blackett from Memphis, TN.  In my short life, I've been blessed to get accepted into numerous colleges (including the Ivy League), worked and interned on Wall Street and at a number of Fortune 100 companies and non-profits and recently got accepted into my dream business school: Harvard Business School!


Now, I want to pay it forward and share with our young people how they can get ACCEPTED into their dream schools and get HIRED into their dream jobs and internships too by teaching them how to ACE their interviews.
column9:
>""To Whom MUCH is Given, MUCH is Required"" 

Why do I want to Help our Young People?

I recognize that I didn't achieve my dreams on my own.

Someone helped me out.  Actually a LOT of people helped me out.

Especially this person...

My grandmother saw potential in me before many others did.  I share more about her impact on me when you watch the video above.  An elementary school teacher by trade, she believed in me and the beauty of my dreams before I could.  She worked with me when others would have given up.


My biggest joy in life was making her proud and watching her smile.  When she passed away in 2011 from a really tough battle with pancreatic cancer, I made a commitment to invest in young people the way my grandmother did in me.

How did this Interviewing get started?

While I was working on Wall Street after graduating from the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill, I wanted to share with other college students some best practices to help them when they interviewed for summer internships and full-time jobs after they graduated.

        ""If you get, GIVE.  If you learn, TEACH.""  -- Maya Angelou (1928-2014)

One day, I combined all the best tips and strategies I learned over many years into one presentation and called it the ""3 B's to Ace Your Interview"" workshop.

I first did this workshop at my alma mater for a couple audiences and got great feedback.  However, it was only until I got an email from one of the students telling me that he successfully got a summer internship after applying my advanced interviewing principles...that was when I started thinking ""there may be something more to this...""


Listen to What Others Had to Say...
column14:
schema=youtube"" width=""580"">

Fast forward 3 years later...I just got into my dream business school, and I wanted to help my friends get into business school too.  I did personalized mock interviews for a number of them and got great feedback again.

Once I started hearing some of my friends ACING their business school interviews afterwards (a few of them now joining me this fall at Harvard), that was when I knew I needed to bring this to the masses to help THOUSANDS of young people ACE their interviews to get into their dream schools and get hired into their dream jobs and internships too.

Afterwards, I started creating my offerings to help young people ace their interviews and founded a mission-driven startup: Magnetic Interviewing, LLC

Practically, everything is in place but I need YOUR support to help me reach over 12,000 young people to share my best practices and help them ACE their upcoming interviews this year, so they can get ACCEPTED into their dream schools (both college &
column15:
graduate school) and get HIRED into their dream jobs and internships.


Imagine the type of impact we can have on the lives of 12,000 young people nationwide by helping them get accepted into college or graduate school, get hired at their dream job or internship, get off unemployment or even become independent enough to move out of their parents' house once and for all...

That's what WE can do together with your support of this campaign!

What We Need The Money For?

By helping us raise at least $50,000, you will help us afford the following:

column1: <li>
Web infrastructure to best attract &
Customer relationship management to manage &
<b>Social Media Marketing &amp
column2: Advertising to get the word out nationwide

column1: <li>
Other operating expenses to keep the lights on &
column2:
our business running

What if WE raise MORE than $50,000?

Raising $50,000 will help position us to start serving the 12,000 young people to help them ACE their interviews.  If we raise MORE than $50,000, we will be able to build more intensive grassroots &
column3: multimedia marketing campaigns in specific target markets to build relationships with the right partners to help us serve beyond 12,000 young people in the long term.  Listed below are our ""Stretch Goals"", along with the specific target market we can better serve if we reach a certain funding level:

<li>

<span style=""color: rgb(0, 0, 0)
column4: >The Impact that WE can Have Together

column1:
This campaign will help us address two major issues among our youth:

Access to Higher Education
• Over 17.4 million students are enrolled in college
• Yet, college admissions is more competitive than ever before (2013 stats)
<li>
Acceptance rates at the top 50 U.S. business schools are lower also
• Because getting accepted (even with a scholarship) is so ultra-competitive, the interview has become even more important now
Youth Unemployment

• In the USA, youth unemployment was 13.2% in May 2014 (overall: 6.3%) 
  • Youth make up 40% of the world's unemployed with 12.6% global UE rate
  • Youth Unemployment has become South Africa's most critical challenge
• Youth Unemployment is not only a problem in the USA and South Africa, but also in Australia, Great Britain, Italy, China and other countries

• With more Baby Boomers retiring each year, replacing them in the job market has become even more competitive globally - putting more emphasis on the interview to help one differentiate from the competition

    • The Bottom Line

    Even if our young people have all the necessary education and skills to perform well, because there is a limited supply of available jobs, competition is so intense and cutthroat, and they have to figure out a better way to differentiate themselves so they have a better chance to get the job.  This also applies to higher education, where our students are competing with their counterparts from all around the world for spots at the same institution.  To get accepted into your dream school, you have to stand out from the crowd.  

    In 2014, one of the best ways to stand out from the crowd, whether you're applying to go to school or to get a job, is to ACE your interview.  There's not much discussion about how to ACE your interview vs. how to craft your resume or how to study for the SAT / ACT / GMAT.  Through Magnetic Interviewing, I created something that I wished I had when I was applying to schools, scholarships, internships and jobs.  It is the culmination of years of trial-and-error, much research, and best practices learned from others.  I want to be able to provide this to at least 12,000 young people over the next 12 months and grow that number this time next year.  

    However, I cannot do this on my own.  I am asking for your support - whether by selecting a perk on the RIGHT side of THIS page, coupled with a financial contribution, or by sharing this campaign with others who may be interested.  

    Other Ways YOU Can Help

    We appreciate ALL contributions - whether $1 or $6,000.  However, if you are not in a position to contribute financially, YOU can still help us out:

• Please SHARE this website on social media with those you know (friends, family, work colleagues, etc.) who would be interested in education, job / career preparation, and the future of our young people (Millennials)

• Please SHARE this website if you know someone who has a son or daughter with an interview coming up soon or if you know of a friend or mentee who is preparing to apply to college or graduate school this fall.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools on this page or refer people to Help12K.com
• If you're on Facebook and need a sample post to use (feel free to edit to your liking), try one of these (copy &

FAQ

Why Indiegogo?  Why fund this project with crowdfunding?
column5:
>This campaign is about our young people.  Before we consider any angel, seed or venture capital funding, we believe that the first line of support should come from our community of young people and those who believe in the future of our young people.  

Can you describe to me what Magnetic Interviewing is?

Magnetic Interviewing, LLC is a for-profit social enterprise that focuses on helping young people ace their interviews so they can get accepted into their dream schools and get hired at their dream jobs and internships.
column6:
> 

Why help 12,000 young people?  How will you help them?

When this social enterprise was created, I had a vision of having a significant impact in the lives of MANY young people.  Success to me, in our first 12 months of operation, is to help at least 12,000 young people ACE their interviews so they can get ACCEPTED into their dream schools and / or get HIRED for their dream jobs and internships.  That comes out to about 1,000 young people per month on average.  

This is a goal that, with your support, we can achieve in our first 12 months not only through our online offerings but also through collaborating with local high schools, community colleges, colleges &
column7: universities, graduate schools, career centers, college &amp
column8:
career guidance counselors, complimentary businesses and non-profit organizations.  YOUR support will help us achieve OUR mission.

Which interviews have YOU aced using the principles and strategies behind Magnetic Interviewing? 

From using the best practices and strategies within Magnetic Interviewing, I have received acceptance and job offers from such places as:

column1: • Harvard University (with Navy ROTC scholarship)
• University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill (Morehead-Cain scholarship)
• Yale University
• Brown University
• University of Pennsylvania
• University of California - Los Angeles (UCLA)
• Goldman Sachs
• One Economy Corporation
• Citigroup
• Harvard Business School
• The Wharton School (University of Pennsylvania MBA program)
In full disclosure, to prevent any potential confusion, this campaign and Magnetic Interviewing are not affiliated, endorsed or supported by any of the above institutions, companies or organizations.
column2: >Why not wait until after you complete business school to start this?
column3: >With me being in school for two years, our upcoming high school juniors and seniors are at risk of not having the opportunity to learn these strategies and best practices to help increase their chances of acing their interviews to get into their dream schools.  That's two years worth of thousands of college students who would not potentially have access to this information before they apply to fall / summer internships and part-time / full-time jobs during school and after graduation.
column4: >Our young professionals looking to go back to school or applying to their next job would be better off if they had this available to them in 2014 vs. 2016.  The information is ready to be shared with those young people willing to invest in themselves and their careers to get what they want.  Two years' deferral represents two years' of missed opportunities for thousands of young people. We don't want to risk that.

column1: ","Want to Hear from Me Personally? Watch This...The 1-Minute Introduction Hi! My name is Philip Blackett from Memphis, TN.  In my short life, I've been blessed to get accepted into numerous colleges (including the Ivy League), worked and interned on Wall Street and at a number of Fortune 100 companies and non-profits and recently got accepted into my dream business school: Harvard Business School!Now, I want to pay it forward and share with our young people how they can get ACCEPTED into their dream schools and get HIRED into their dream jobs and internships too by teaching them how to ACE their interviews.""To Whom MUCH is Given, MUCH is Required"" Why do I want to Help our Young People?I recognize that I didn't achieve my dreams on my own.Someone helped me out.  Actually a LOT of people helped me out.Especially this person...My grandmother saw potential in me before many others did.  I share more about her impact on me when you watch the video above.  An elementary school teacher by trade, she believed in me and the beauty of my dreams before I could.  She worked with me when others would have given up.My biggest joy in life was making her proud and watching her smile.  When she passed away in 2011 from a really tough battle with pancreatic cancer, I made a commitment to invest in young people the way my grandmother did in me.How did this Interviewing get started?While I was working on Wall Street after graduating from the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill, I wanted to share with other college students some best practices to help them when they interviewed for summer internships and full-time jobs after they graduated.        ""If you get, GIVE.  If you learn, TEACH.""  -- Maya Angelou (1928-2014)One day, I combined all the best tips and strategies I learned over many years into one presentation and called it the ""3 B's to Ace Your Interview"" workshop.I first did this workshop at my alma mater for a couple audiences and got great feedback.  However, it was only until I got an email from one of the students telling me that he successfully got a summer internship after applying my advanced interviewing principles...that was when I started thinking ""there may be something more to this...""Listen to What Others Had to Say...Fast forward 3 years later...I just got into my dream business school, and I wanted to help my friends get into business school too.  I did personalized mock interviews for a number of them and got great feedback again.Once I started hearing some of my friends ACING their business school interviews afterwards (a few of them now joining me this fall at Harvard), that was when I knew I needed to bring this to the masses to help THOUSANDS of young people ACE their interviews to get into their dream schools and get hired into their dream jobs and internships too.Afterwards, I started creating my offerings to help young people ace their interviews and founded a mission-driven startup: Magnetic Interviewing, LLCPractically, everything is in place but I need YOUR support to help me reach over 12,000 young people to share my best practices and help them ACE their upcoming interviews this year, so they can get ACCEPTED into their dream schools (both college & graduate school) and get HIRED into their dream jobs and internships.Imagine the type of impact we can have on the lives of 12,000 young people nationwide by helping them get accepted into college or graduate school, get hired at their dream job or internship, get off unemployment or even become independent enough to move out of their parents' house once and for all...That's what WE can do together with your support of this campaign! What We Need The Money For? By helping us raise at least $50,000, you will help us afford the following:
Web infrastructure to best attract & serve 12,000+ young people
Customer relationship management to manage & grow our business
Social Media Marketing & Advertising to get the word out nationwide

Other operating expenses to keep the lights on & our business running What if WE raise MORE than $50,000?Raising $50,000 will help position us to start serving the 12,000 young people to help them ACE their interviews.  If we raise MORE than $50,000, we will be able to build more intensive grassroots & multimedia marketing campaigns in specific target markets to build relationships with the right partners to help us serve beyond 12,000 young people in the long term.  Listed below are our ""Stretch Goals"", along with the specific target market we can better serve if we reach a certain funding level:
$60,000 = Boston / Cambridge, MA
$75,000 = Memphis, TN
$100,000 = Research Triangle Park (Raleigh, Durham, & Chapel Hill, NC)
$120,000 = Atlanta, New York City or Charlotte, NC
$150,000 = Austin, Dallas, Houston and San Antonio, TX
The Impact that WE can Have Together
This campaign will help us address two major issues among our youth:Access to Higher Education
Over 17.4 million students are enrolled in college
Yet, college admissions is more competitive than ever before (2013 stats)
Acceptance rates at the top 50 U.S. business schools are lower also
Because getting accepted (even with a scholarship) is so ultra-competitive, the interview has become even more important now
Youth Unemployment

In the USA, youth unemployment was 13.2% in May 2014 (overall: 6.3%)  Youth make up 40% of the world's unemployed with 12.6% global UE rate Youth Unemployment has become South Africa's most critical challenge
Youth Unemployment is not only a problem in the USA and South Africa, but also in Australia, Great Britain, Italy, China and other countries

With more Baby Boomers retiring each year, replacing them in the job market has become even more competitive globally - putting more emphasis on the interview to help one differentiate from the competition   The Bottom Line Even if our young people have all the necessary education and skills to perform well, because there is a limited supply of available jobs, competition is so intense and cutthroat, and they have to figure out a better way to differentiate themselves so they have a better chance to get the job.  This also applies to higher education, where our students are competing with their counterparts from all around the world for spots at the same institution.  To get accepted into your dream school, you have to stand out from the crowd.  In 2014, one of the best ways to stand out from the crowd, whether you're applying to go to school or to get a job, is to ACE your interview.  There's not much discussion about how to ACE your interview vs. how to craft your resume or how to study for the SAT / ACT / GMAT.  Through Magnetic Interviewing, I created something that I wished I had when I was applying to schools, scholarships, internships and jobs.  It is the culmination of years of trial-and-error, much research, and best practices learned from others.  I want to be able to provide this to at least 12,000 young people over the next 12 months and grow that number this time next year.  However, I cannot do this on my own.  I am asking for your support - whether by selecting a perk on the RIGHT side of THIS page, coupled with a financial contribution, or by sharing this campaign with others who may be interested.     Other Ways YOU Can Help We appreciate ALL contributions - whether $1 or $6,000.  However, if you are not in a position to contribute financially, YOU can still help us out:

Please SHARE this website on social media with those you know (friends, family, work colleagues, etc.) who would be interested in education, job / career preparation, and the future of our young people (Millennials)

Please SHARE this website if you know someone who has a son or daughter with an interview coming up soon or if you know of a friend or mentee who is preparing to apply to college or graduate school this fall. Use the Indiegogo share tools on this page or refer people to Help12K.com
If you're on Facebook and need a sample post to use (feel free to edit to your liking), try one of these (copy & paste):

Let's Help Them Secure a Better Future by Helping Them ACE Their Interviews: www.Help12K.comI just supported an Indiegogo campaign to help 12,000 of our young people ACE their interviews to get ACCEPTED into their dream schools and get HIRED into their dream jobs and internships.  Check out the campaign here: www.Help12K.com

If you're on Twitter and need a sample tweet to use (feel free to edit to your liking), try one of these also (copy & paste): Let's Give 12,000 #Millennials the Gift of a Better #Interview.  Check out & SUPPORT this cool @Indiegogo campaign: www.Help12K.comI just supported this @Indiegogo campaign to #Help12K #Millennials to ACE their #Interviews.  Check it out here: www.Help12K.com  Thank you so much for supporting this campaign & spreading the word!! :)""If you're not making someone else's life BETTER, then you're wasting your time.  YOUR life will become better by making other lives better."" -- Will SmithFAQWhy Indiegogo?  Why fund this project with crowdfunding?This campaign is about our young people.  Before we consider any angel, seed or venture capital funding, we believe that the first line of support should come from our community of young people and those who believe in the future of our young people.  Can you describe to me what Magnetic Interviewing is?Magnetic Interviewing, LLC is a for-profit social enterprise that focuses on helping young people ace their interviews so they can get accepted into their dream schools and get hired at their dream jobs and internships. Why help 12,000 young people? Die ""Grüne Liebe"" in Köln-Ehrenfeld: eine Saftbar kämpft gegen die Lebensmittelverschwendung

Unsere Idee: wir möchten eine Saft-, Suppen und Smoothiebar eröffnen. Es soll Obst und Gemüse verwendet werden, das sonst unnötigerweise in der Mülltonne gelandet wäre.

Wir sprechen nicht von Gammelgemüse, sondern von zu krummen Gurken, zu kleinen Kartoffeln, zu verzwirbelten Karotten. Also Obst und Gemüse, das völlig ohne Not aus logistischen, normierungs- oder firmenpolitischen Gründen in der Tonne landet. Mit diesen Produzenten wollen wir sprechen und diese astreinen Lebensmittel vor der Entsorgung bewahren.

Wir wollen die Welt hier ein kleines bisschen besser machen - Tu gutes und trink gutes!

Warum machen wir crowdfunding? Wir möchten nicht dass ihr uns die Kücheneinrichtung bezahlt. Euer kleiner Beitrag zu diesem Projekt ist vielmehr ein:

Wir sind dabei, wir finden die nachhaltige Idee gut! Es ist euer ""Ja"" zu unserem grunsätzlichen Gedanken, euer ""Ja"" zu: wir wollen von Anfang an bei diesem Projekt dabei sein. Und es ist euer ""Nein"" zur Lebensmittelverschwendung.
Drei Fälle von Lebensmittelverschwendung, die uns besonders wütend gemacht haben

1. ""Der Paprika - Dreierpack"". Paprikas werden vom Produzenten in Dreierpacks und Folie gesteckt. Diese landen palettenweise beim Großhändler. Wenn auch nur eine der drei Paprikas seiner Meinung nach nicht in Ordnung ist, wird der ganze Pack entsorgt. Das sortieren wäre angeblich zu aufwendig... Wir haben letzte Woche 12 Paletten (!) dieser Packs gesehen - sie alle landen komplett im Müll, obwohl 2/3 davon einwandfreie Ware ist.... Wahnsinn.

2. ""Krumme Gurken"". Gurken wachsen nunmal nicht gerade, sie sind meistens krumm. Nur: die kriegt der Bauer nicht an den Supermarkt verkauft, er muss sie entsorgen. Besonders zynisch: ein Marktleiter hat uns unter der Hand erklärt, dass das Entsorgen billiger sei, als der logistische Aufwand zusätzlich krumme Gurken zu transportieren und sie im Supermarkt anzubieten.

3. ""Einzelbananen"". Bananen kommt staudenweise aus Südamerika zum Großhandel, werden dort bündelweise für Supermärkte vorsortiert und abgepackt. Wenn an den Bündeln halblose einzelne Bananen hängen mögen das viele Supermärkte nicht so sehr - diese sogenannten ""Einzelbananen"" werden dann abgemacht - und finden oft den Weg in die Mülltonne... Man fasst es nicht.

Und jetzt kommen wir mit unserem Konzept: Wir sind die Anlaufstelle für Bauern aus der Region. Für Großmärkte in Köln. Wir sind die Retter von Obst und Gemüse, das ohne Not in der Tonne landen würde. Die Retter der zu krummen Möhren. Der zu kleinen Kartoffeln. 

Tu gutes und trink gutes!

Wer sind wir? Wir sind die TV-Produktion Vitamedia aus Köln. Wir haben vor 2 Jahren eine TV-Dokumentation mit Christan Rach und Ilse Aigner zum Thema Lebensmittelverschwendung produziert. Seitdem hat uns dieses Thema verfolgt. Nach langen Gesprächen mit Aigner folgt nun unser erstes Start up.

Wie geht es weiter? Der Laden ist seit heute, Montag den 12.Januar fertig gebaut. Diese Woche werden Saft- und Suppenrezepte ausprobiert. In spätestens 10 Tagen werden wir eröffnen.

Unsere Bitte: Spread the word! Unterstützt unseren Gedanken!

Short Summary

I am a sophomore at the Macaulay Honors College at Brooklyn College. Recently, I learned about the organization called Students Helping Honduras (SHH) from a friend of mine. He went on a service trip with SHH over the summer, and now I would like to go on that same trip during the Winter session (December 27, 2014-January 3, 2015). For eight days, fellow members of the SHH University of Michigan Chapter will work together to build a school for Honduran youth in a small village.

What We Need &
column2:
What You Get

In order to travel with SHH, students are asked to raise the funds necessary to pay for the flights to and from Honduras. I will be flying from New York City to San Pedro Sula. The cost of the roundtrip flight currently is approximately $933. All of the money raised through this campaign will be put towards the cost of the flights. If additional funds are raised, I will donate them to the organization Students Helping Honduras, or to one of its college student-run chapters in the United States.

column1: All those who donate to my fundraising campaign will receive a personal thank you letter from me. Funders will also receive updates on my experience in Honduras, as well as a reflection on my experience upon my return. If and when you choose to donate, please email your name and mailing / email address to my email address below so that I may keep you updated. Your personal information will not be shared with anyone.
ej0241@bcmail.brooklyn.cuny.edu

The Impact

While there, I will assist in the construction of a school for children and orphaned youth, and in the process provide an opportunity for Honduran children to escape gang life. I will teach English, and among other things, brush up on my Spanish.

Though this trip only lasts for 8 days, I hope to gain a greater sense of what it means to help others in very different circumstances than what I have seen at home, while also gaining valuable experience that will build on my already growing interest in public policy, human rights advocacy, education policy and reform, and history.
Risks &

While I have volunteered with food pantries, soup kitchens, and other non-profit groups that seek to empower the lives of the less fortunate, I lack the knowledge of what others experience on a daily basis in a developing country such as Honduras, where gang violence, drug trafficking, and other tremendous hardships have driven scores of children and young adults from their homes in recent years. Nor am I able to gage how best to assist those who are struggling to stay alive, fed, and protected in countries like Honduras.

I have also researched what sorts of things I might bear witness to while in the Honduran countryside. While gang violence and drug trafficking are major issues that exist in the country, the work that I hope to be doing while there is not near where these problems are most severe.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you chose not to contribute, other ways you can get involved include:
<ul>

• visiting the Students Helping Honduras website to learn more about the work of this incredible organization and about the positive impact that it has had on the youth of Honduras and college students in the United States: http://ceciskids.org
• watch the video at the top of this campaign page (if you haven't already), which was produced by the organization Students Helping Honduras, to learn about the organization's mission and goals.
• visit the Facebook page of the University of Michigan SHH Chapter: https://www.facebook.com/SHHUMich
• staying up to date on news related to youth, education, culture, and politics in Latin America.

<h4><span style=""font-weight: normal
Jeg har en drøm. Jeg hopper ud fra vippen, og satser alt på, at den bliver min virkelighed. - Et skridt af gangen, men jeg har brug for din hjælp.

Alt der skal til for at jeg kan få min uddannelse, er 21.551. mennesker der alle har lyst til at donere 1$ til min kampagne, svarende til knap 5.50 danske kroner. Lykkes det, får jeg mit livs mulighed, og en fremtid indenfor scenekunsten.
Lidt om Mig:

Mit navn er Laila Faris. Jeg er 23 år gammel, og bor i Aalborg- Danmark. Jeg er født og opvokset i Danmark, hos en dansk plejefamilie. Mine rødder er halv Libanesisk og halv irakisk, hvilket sammen med min danske attitude, og tilgang til livet bliver til: MIG.

<li><i style=""letter-spacing: 0px

column2: >Fyldt med energi, Nysgerrighed og lysten til at lære.

column1: Jeg har arbejdet hårdt og målrettet i mange år, for at kunne få min drømmeuddannelse, en uddannelse hvor jeg kan lave det jeg brænder aller mest for
column2: skuespillerfaget. Endelig har jeg fået chancen, indenfor det filmiske univers: Jeg er blevet optaget på en af verdens mest anerkendte filmskoler, beliggende i New York

column5: >Hvad jeg har brug for - og hvad jeg kan gi igen:

column1: Efter jeg blev optaget på NYFA, gennemgik jeg yderligere en audition, for at opnå et schollarship. Jeg kom igennem, og har fået bevilliget ialt 13000 $ (Et a' 8000 $ og et a' 5000$) til at kunne betale en del af min uddannelse med.

Da det er dyrt at tage en uddannelse i udlandet, har jeg søgt SU styrelsen, men de har valgt at give mig et afslag, så nu står jeg med en adgangsbillet til min drømmeuddannelse i hånden, et tilskud fra USA, og har taget et lån i banken. På samme tid arbejder jeg alt hvad jeg kan for at lægge penge fra, men jeg mangler stadig lidt hjælp fra en ven, eller to..
<ul>
• Ialt har jeg brug for: $21.551 for at nå mit mål.
• Pengene vil gå direkte til at betale min uddannelse, og de udgifter der er forbundet hertil. (Tuition, Visum, etc.)
• Hvis 21.551 mennesker donere $1 hver, kommer jeg i mål. For hver $ jeg modtager giver jeg til gengæld et kæmpe stort Shoutout: ""TAK""
<ul>

• Penge er min udfordring lige nu. Jeg er kommet igennem nåleøjet, og har opnået optagelse på skolen. Jeg har lykkes med at få to store scholarships fra USA, og jeg arbejder hårdt som selvstændig frisør, for at tjene penge til at kunne bo og leve i udlandet i et år.
• Min plan er at arbejde hård, og sparre alt hvad jeg kan, for at få det her til at lykkes. Jeg tager alle de ekstra jobs der kommer min vej, og jeg holder hovedet højt.
• Risikoen er, at jeg ikke får samlet nok penge ind, og derfor må udskyde min uddannelse med et halvt år.
<div><span style=""font-size: 24px
<div>
<span style=""font-size: 24px
<ul>

• Nogen har måske ikke muligheden for at hjælpe økonomisk, men ved at gøre opmærksom på min kampange hjælper du mere end du tror. Jeg sætter utrolig meget pris på alt den hjælp jeg kan få, og takker alle der hjælper, ved enten at donere, eller gøre opmærksom på min kampange. TAK!
• Husk at du kan bruge indigogos ""Share tools"", for at dele med dit netværk.

All the above - Now in English:

I have a dream and I am reaching for it to be my reality but i need your help.
All it takes is for 21.551 people to donate $1 .00 each  and I will have the opportunity of a lifetime - and  a future within the Arts.
About me:

My name is Laila Faris. I am 23 years old and live in Aalborg , Denmark. I'm born and raised in Denmark with a Danish foster family. My roots are half Lebanese and half Iraqi, with a Danish attitude..

column2: >I've worked my best to achieve an education within acting and finally I have  the chance to fullfill my life long dream of an education within acting for films at the New York Film Academy.

column1: I have been accepted at the New York Film Academy and I have already received  2 scholarships from NYFA based on my external audition in the total combined amount of $13,000.

Coming from Denmark I need to have funds in my acount for VISA purposes. Additionally I need to pay  the remainder of my tuition. - SU have turned down the education here in Denmark, so I need a little help from a friend.
<ul>
• I need exactely $ 21,551  to reach my goal.
• The money will go directly towards my education at The New York Film Academy.
• If 21.551 people give one dollar each then I will have reached my goal - and for each dollar I get - I will give the world a big shoutout ""THANKS""

• Money is my obstacle. I have applied and been accepted. Through an external audition I have been granted a scholarship for part of my education.  I am currently working hard as a hairdresser to make enough money for my living expenses while I am studying the U.S.  
  • My plan is to work hard and save all that I can to make my dream into my reality. I take all the extra jobs that I can and I am keeping my spirit high.
Other Ways You Can Help

• Some of you might not be able to help financially but by making others aware of my campaign you are helping. It is very much appreciated and I thank all that are helping by either donating directly to or sharing my campaign. Thanks!
  • Remember you can use the Indiegogo share tools to get it out to your network.
<div>

Photo: Julie Montauk Photography 
Video Teaser design and production: Julie Montauk Photography
","NYFA - Min Drøm, Min Fremtid.
Nu på Dansk:
Jeg har en drøm. Jeg hopper ud fra vippen, og satser alt på, at den bliver min virkelighed. - Et skridt af gangen, men jeg har brug for din hjælp.

Alt der skal til for at jeg kan få min uddannelse, er 21.551. mennesker der alle har lyst til at donere 1$ til min kampagne, svarende til knap 5.50 danske kroner. Lykkes det, får jeg mit livs mulighed, og en fremtid indenfor scenekunsten.
Lidt om Mig:

Mit navn er Laila Faris. Jeg er 23 år gammel, og bor i Aalborg- Danmark. Jeg er født og opvokset i Danmark, hos en dansk plejefamilie. Mine rødder er halv Libanesisk og halv irakisk, hvilket sammen med min danske attitude, og tilgang til livet bliver til: MIG.
Jeg er:
Danser
Skuespiller
En ildflue
En ballerina
En prinsesse
En porcelænsfigur
En løve
En arbejder af hjertet
Fyldt med energi, Nysgerrighed og lysten til at lære.
Jeg har arbejdet hårdt og målrettet i mange år, for at kunne få min drømmeuddannelse, en uddannelse hvor jeg kan lave det jeg brænder aller mest for
column2: skuespillerfaget. Endelig har jeg fået chancen, indenfor det filmiske univers: Jeg er blevet optaget på en af verdens mest anerkendte filmskoler, beliggende i New York

column1: Hvad jeg har brug for - og hvad jeg kan gi igen:

Efter jeg blev optaget på NYFA, gennemgik jeg yderligere en audition, for at opnå et schollarship. Jeg kom igennem, og har fået bevilliget ialt 13000 $ (Et a' 8000 $ og et a' 5000$) til at kunne betale en del af min uddannelse med.

Da det er dyrt at tage en uddannelse i udlandet, har jeg søgt SU styrelsen, men de har valgt at give mig et afslag, så nu står jeg med en adgangsbillet til min drømmeuddannelse i hånden, et tilskud fra USA, og har taget et lån i banken. På samme tid arbejder jeg alt hvad jeg kan for at lægge penge fra, men jeg mangler stadig lidt hjælp fra en ven, eller to..
Ialt har jeg brug for: $21.551 for at nå mit mål.
Pengene vil gå direkte til at betale min uddannelse, og de udgifter der er forbundet hertil. (Tuition, Visum, etc.)
Hvis 21.551 mennesker donere $1 hver, kommer jeg i mål. For hver $ jeg modtager giver jeg til gengæld et kæmpe stort Shoutout: ""TAK""
Risiko og udfordringer

Penge er min udfordring lige nu. Jeg er kommet igennem nåleøjet, og har opnået optagelse på skolen. Jeg har lykkes med at få to store scholarships fra USA, og jeg arbejder hårdt som selvstændig frisør, for at tjene penge til at kunne bo og leve i udlandet i et år.
Min plan er at arbejde hård, og sparre alt hvad jeg kan, for at få det her til at lykkes. Jeg tager alle de ekstra jobs der kommer min vej, og jeg holder hovedet højt.
Risikoen er, at jeg ikke får samlet nok penge ind, og derfor må udskyde min uddannelse med et halvt år.
Andre måder du kan hjælpe på:

Nogen har måske ikke muligheden for at hjælpe økonomisk, men ved at gøre opmærksom på min kampange hjælper du mere end du tror. Jeg sætter utrolig meget pris på alt den hjælp jeg kan få, og takker alle der hjælper, ved enten at donere, eller gøre opmærksom på min kampange. TAK!
Husk at du kan bruge indigogos ""Share tools"", for at dele med dit netværk.
All the above - Now in English: I have a dream and I am reaching for it to be my reality but i need your help.
All it takes is for 21.551 people to donate $1 .00 each  and I will have the opportunity of a lifetime - and  a future within the Arts.
About me:

My name is Laila Faris. I am 23 years old and live in Aalborg , Denmark. I'm born and raised in Denmark with a Danish foster family. My roots are half Lebanese and half Iraqi, with a Danish attitude..
I am:
a dancer
an actress
a firefly
a ballerina
a princess
a porcelain figure
a lion
a worker by heart
and everything in between.
I've worked my best to achieve an education within acting and finally I have  the chance to fullfill my life long dream of an education within acting for films at the New York Film Academy.
What I Need & What You Get
I have been accepted at the New York Film Academy and I have already received  2 scholarships from NYFA based on my external audition in the total combined amount of $13,000.

Coming from Denmark I need to have funds in my acount for VISA purposes. Additionally I need to pay  the remainder of my tuition. - SU have turned down the education here in Denmark, so I need a little help from a friend.
I need exactely $ 21,551  to reach my goal.
The money will go directly towards my education at The New York Film Academy.
If 21.551 people give one dollar each then I will have reached my goal - and for each dollar I get - I will give the world a big shoutout ""THANKS""
Risks & Challenges

Money is my obstacle. I have applied and been accepted. Through an external audition I have been granted a scholarship for part of my education.  I am currently working hard as a hairdresser to make enough money for my living expenses while I am studying the U.S.   My plan is to work hard and save all that I can to make my dream into my reality. I take all the extra jobs that I can and I am keeping my spirit high.
Other Ways You Can Help

Some of you might not be able to help financially but by making others aware of my campaign you are helping. It is very much appreciated and I thank all that are helping by either donating directly to or sharing my campaign. Thanks! Remember you can use the Indiegogo share tools to get it out to your network.

Short Summary

Hi! My name is Ivana Borojevic and I go by the name of chef Eva Bee (www.evabee.com). Ever since I was little it's been my dream to be the cook version of Bill Nye the Science Guy? Why? Because I want everyone to know how great cooking for health is and all the fun and wonder of where food comes from.

For this reason, the Ballymaloe is the only
cooking school for me to attend since they are they only cooking school in the world on its own organic farm! I'm thirsty to learn their Forgotten
Skills so that I can preserve and pass this knowledge down to the
youth of today in innovative ways. It is my goal to educate
through media and live demonstration so much so that people get excited

to learn about cooking for themselves – without even realizing it!

This means every dollar you contribute will go towards your own knowledge of cooking better, cheaper and healthier.

What We Need &
The 12 week Certificate program is €10,695. With this in
mind and the additional cost of traveling to Ireland, I would be

incredibly grateful for the opportunity to receive the money to cover living expenses and additional tuition fees including the remainder of my balance, knives, uniforms and course material. 

In return:
• Ever wonder how something's made? Let me know which meal or dish and I'll make your very own video cooking lessons!

• Advertise on Eva Bee's Jamboree from January to August 2014. Buying a monthly spot gets you your business logo, trademark and contact information at the end of our episode on Cable television all throughout Ottawa, Ontario each time it airs! Eva Bee's Jamboree airs 12 times per month - that ends up being $10/sec. On cable? Amazing!
The Impact

Check out some things I'll be learning at the Ballymaloe! (http://www.cookingisfun.ie/certificate-cookery-...).

Not only will I be with one of the most famous chefs in the world, Darina Allen (who has her own cooking shows, cookbooks and is a member of Slow Food Ireland), but I will also gain a deeper understanding of food that is not only healthy for you but healthy for the environment.

It's my dream to take my culinary knowledge to adapt any traditional recipe to suit
the tastes and needs of anyone with a dietary restriction so that everyone can enjoy food again!

Going to this school will give me the knowledge to offer my skills in a broader and even tastier way.

Other Ways You Can Help

If healthy, local food is something you care passionately about, please spread the word about my campaign by copy and pasting the link and sending out mass emails or facebook statuses.

<h4>We
have been teaching English to about 20 men in the prison closest to
us since mid September.  The prison is known as CERESSO 5.  We are
volunteer teachers and that's how we like it.  This class is an
opportunity for the folks inside to get a few hours of engaging
activity and it is an opportunity for us to support incarcerated
people without being paid by the prison system.
people we work with are largely from Chiapas and many speak
indigenous languages, therefore english is their third or fourth
language.  Most engage in sports, take other classes and have jobs.
However, many communicate feeling confined, lonely and bored.
<h4><span style=""font-size: 15px
column6: >In our classes everyone laughs a lot. We are a dynamic teaching team, with instruments and singing, movement learning, and real life examples.
column8: >As teachers interested in developing radical
column12: > curriculum, these classes offer us a unique set of criteria to teach ESL.  At the same time we are people who believe that the prison system is wrong, and teaching as volunteers gives us a better understanding of the systems of
column18: >The success of this campaign will be an opportunity for us to focus more of our time on volunteer teaching.   Ideally we will expand our classes to the section of the prison for women and begin to have our friend and band mate Wendy as a third member of the teaching team.

column1:
of the participants in our class have spent time in the United States.  Many speak indigenous languages of Chiapas, including Tsotsil and Tzeltal.

We have made friends with many genuine, caring men in CERESS 5 and they are very thankful for our
classes.
PERKS- Our Students Are Great Craftsman

Many people in our class at CERESS 5 are very skilled at making all sorts of things.

Some of the perks are easier to ship to you than others.  One student makes incredible hand-carved garden scenes on headboards and dressers, but they are beyond our scope for shipping. 

We will be offering the following handmade goods as Perks:

WOVEN BAGS-large and small, HAMMOCKS-1 or 2 person, BRACELETS, COFFEE -grown by student's family, KEY CHAINS, PONCHOS and more. . 

Our perks will be delivered in three ways, depending on your location and availability.   

Please see the bottom for shipping details.
<div>
What We Need
The $$$ goes to: (please see perks
for concrete examples)
We need money for materials.
<ul>
a week can pay for everyone in our classes getting up to three work
sheets. We usually create lessons and then go to a photocopy place to make copies for
all the students.
<li>We
create class material because there aren't any in the classroom of the
school nor books for all the students.  We pay to photo copy the lessons that we create.
<li>Depending
on donations we can either continue to copy lessons that we make, buy a single book
and copy lessons from that book, or buy books for everyone who comes to the class! The last option would allow us more time to develop creative ways to teach the content.
• We want to supply people with notebooks and pens.  With a pen and paper, you can articulate almost anything. What a power!
We need money for transportation.
<ul>
• Using public transportation we ride in a ""colectivo"" four times a week, forty-five minutes each way.  For two people this means eight fares a week.
• We spend more on getting to CERESS 5 than any other expense.
<li>
We each spend as much on the
transportation to and from the classes as we do on  fruits and veggies each week.
We'd love to offer English classes to a wider range of people here in San Cristobal de Las Casas.  If you help us exceed our goal  ...we can offer classes for free!
<ul>
<li>
If we reach our goal and raise +$300 more we will be able to offer free classes for the public of San Cristobal de Las Casas.
<li>We meet people ALL the time who want to learn English for all sorts of
reasons.
<li>
We are teachers with strong opinions about the history of
language learning, specifically the violent ways in which English has been imposed.  Nonetheless, we believe in
providing opportunities for individual learning so that people can advance themselves economically.  Meanwhile, we struggle
for every lesson to create pathways beyond capitalism and colonization.
This project is a beginning of our
work in supporting incarcerated people directly.  Your donations matter in
a very material way for our students, and they help us become better teachers
for the future.
About Tony and Jayme
<blockquote>
We met in June 2012.  We had both
finished with college a few years apart in Massaucusetts and both had
connections to California.  Tony studied sustainable food systems and
critical education at UMass Amherst, and had been actively involved in
the Northampton Food Not bombs serves since 2007. Jaymes went to
Hampshire College and learned about radical justice, family history and
varieties of dance and movement. We became quite inseparable.
Our
similar passions as teachers and radicals led to understanding and
influencing each others goals.  We discussed equity,  justice, and
prison abolition among other things.
We both believe in working
in support of incarcerated people and their families without supporting
and/or being paid by the institutions of incarceration.
<blockquote>
!!!Lots of stuff happened since then!!! We lived in
Oakland CA together, and back to Northampton MA, and then...
We decided to move to San Cristobal de Las Casas,
because our neice, Sol Jade, was born here last March.
Now that we are here we play in a band, Flame N Peach (Llama y Durazno), hang out with a
super fun baby, help build a house out of adobe bricks and rammed earth tires,
and support Sol's parents.
We play shows at bars and at art galleries.  We
would both like to take Spanish classes with the Centro de Lenguas school in 2014 and are currently translating old songs into Spanish and writing new songs in Spanish.
Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word about our campaign using Facebook, Twitter, Email, tell your friends at parties or print out our small flyer to hand to strangers in the street.  The share tools on this web site make it pretty easy to spread the word about this project so please take a moment and tell a friend or 5.
Here is an article about the women section of CERESS 5.
Shipping Possibilities :
All Perks will be shipped between December 10th and 15th from New York City or Northampton Ma.

If you would like the maximum amount of your donation possible to go toward English Classes and you live in either New York City, Northampton MA or West Brookfield MA you can pick up your Perks from Tony between December 10 and 15.  Please include your email in the shipping details area and you will be contacted about the possibility of pickups!
","We
have been teaching English to about 20 men in the prison closest to
us since mid September.  The prison is known as CERESSO 5.  We are
volunteer teachers and that's how we like it.  This class is an
opportunity for the folks inside to get a few hours of engaging
activity and it is an opportunity for us to support incarcerated
people without being paid by the prison system.
The
people we work with are largely from Chiapas and many speak
indigenous languages, therefore english is their third or fourth
language.  Most engage in sports, take other classes and have jobs.
However, many communicate feeling confined, lonely and bored.

In our classes everyone laughs a lot. We are a dynamic teaching team, with instruments and singing, movement learning, and real life examples.  As teachers interested in developing radical emancipatory curriculum, these classes offer us a unique set of criteria to teach ESL.  At the same time we are people who believe that the prison system is wrong, and teaching as volunteers gives us a better understanding of the systems of incarceration. The success of this campaign will be an opportunity for us to focus more of our time on volunteer teaching.   Ideally we will expand our classes to the section of the prison for women and begin to have our friend and band mate Wendy as a third member of the teaching team.  Some

of the participants in our class have spent time in the United States.  Many speak indigenous languages of Chiapas, including Tsotsil and Tzeltal.We have made friends with many genuine, caring men in CERESS 5 and they are very thankful for our
classes.

Short Summary

Green  Partnership to Strengthen Communities (GPSC) is a distribution mechanism, through five established provincial “Hubs” in Cambodia where local NGO partners have fostered stores to make available solar devices in remote areas that are electrically under-served and unaffordable
column2: providing the incentive for initiating community off-grid electrical systems. (search >
column3:
greenpsc.org)

GPSC's five partner NGO's provides oversight and incubation services during
start-up: services such a securing seed-money, implementing business systems, and negotiations with quality certified solar supply producers in Cambodia and world-wide. The local “Hubs”, stores, make the devices available, provide technical
education and assistance in securing financings, and helps to secure potential subsidy for low income residents, and product and systems services to customers. 

GPSC Organization Development Office (ODO) actively supports the incubation
path toward self-sufficient local ""Hubs"".  Their  social benefits includes increased employment opportunity, poverty alleviation through reducing the costs of maintaining households and small businesses, improvement in children educational successes, and better medical assistance facilities.

This solicitation is in support of this ODO of GPSC. It is strategically located in the United States, thereby extending dramatically these remote ""Hubs"" capacity
to reach international organizations, federal government grantees, private
sector donors, and investors interested in participation.  The local NGO's serve as the communication conduit with the GPSC/ODO identifying product preferences, business systems problems, and material and funding needs during their enterprises incubation period. 

The staff at ODO in the U.S. are five volunteer professionals who are expatriate Khmers and with an advisor with fifteen years development experience in Viet Nam and Cambodia as well as twelve years with the Executive Office of the President regarding the war on poverty with leadership responsibilities for program development for U.S. energy independence. 

What We Need &
column4:
What You Get

$300,000 is needed to maximize the impact of these distribution networks in
remote areas during their start-up and incubation path.The services of the GPSC's U.S. based ODO extends dramatically the capacity of these remotely located Cambodian ""Hub's"" to reach product suppliers world-wide,
international organizations, governments, and private sector donors and investors. 

As the current five local NGO assisted solar “Hubs” become self-sufficient, the Green Partnership to Strengthen Communities will expand services to other provinces. This creates the necessary accelerated and exponential growth in the use of off-grid power resource
column5:
Cambodia's contribution to the international off-grid lighting movement. 

The World Bank has identified Cambodia as  the ""focus"" for funding in S.E. Asia. GPSC/ODO is applying lessons learned and technical services provided during the past five years of the World Bank's successful ""Lighting Africa"" program to their recently inaugurated ""Lighting Asia"" initiatives.  GPSC in Cambodia could potentially grow to become the primary distributors in S.E. Asia for the full range of off-grid products. 

As donors, you will receive information about these distribution networks progress toward becoming self-sufficient, profitable, and no longer in need of ODO assistance. As donors, you will receive information that could be essential to your decisions in determining the future direction of your investment portfolio in this emerging industry.

The Impact

Information abounds (search >
column7:
) which, since the beginning of this millennium, has led to international organizations and some governments to recognize and organize to address the critical global need for off-grid
lighting to abate global warming, and to accelerate the environmental and social
benefits this new industry provides. 

Concurrent to these universal benefits, training and support for small
business start-ups in off-grid lighting engage issues of poverty
abatement, female empowerment, and the blessings and advantages of
lighting for remote households, business enterprises, education
facilities, medical clinics, and an improved environment are achieved. 

Global warming abatement, children's education opportunity, small
enterprise and merchants productivity, and low income household cost
alleviation are among the social problems confronted. 

Simple, but significant, examples includes specific success stories: (1) Ethiopia's report that school dropouts were magnificently reduced after three years of participation in the ""Lighting Africa"" program.   (2) The government of India reports that merchants in many remote areas are now routinely open one additional hours a day due to the use of off-grid lighting. In a few years, evaluations of the Lighting Cambodia campaign will have similar simple but significant anecdotes proving successes of off-grid lighting and solar power generation in S.E.Asia.

Why Iceland?

This tiny and amazing island between the North Atlantic and the Arctic Ocean is a pioneer in renewable energy systems! According to the The Independent Icelandic Energy Portal, ""In total, approximately 86% of Iceland’s consumption of primary energy comes from renewable sources."" This makes Iceland the world’s largest green electric-energy producer per capita! 


Future Impact

Out of this experience,  I will gain a deeper understanding of the world's most advanced renewable energy systems in the fields of hydroelectricity, geothermal, wind power and biofuels. This industry exposure will be essential to my future career as I refine my passion for the renewable energy industry and solving our planet's energy crisis. 

Through this program, I will also be making key connections with faculty from the Iceland School of Energy at Reykjavik University that will provide me with professional networking tools within the green-energy industry. After my
column8: > lecture sessions from industry leaders and faculty from the Iceland School of Energy Master’s Program, I will be able to approach my course-work with dynamic real-world applications from this educational program!
column10: >Your financial support will go to the tuition fee for the Renewable Energy and Sustainability educational program hosted by The GreenProgram in Iceland August 3-12, 2015. The program tuition fee will include:

","Who Am I?My name is Océane and I'm a Electrical Engineering student at Florida Atlantic University in Boca Raton, FL. A hippie at heart, I can't wait to be a part of the green energy wave that is snowballing in the Electrical Engineering field and our global society! Currently an Engineering Intern at BlueNRGY in Ft.Lauderdale, FL, I am also the IEEE (Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers) Region 3 Student Rep and a IEEE Power and Energy Society Scholar. I'm also looking forward to walking across the TEDx stage in Boca Raton, FL March 26th!Why Iceland?This tiny and amazing island between the North Atlantic and the Arctic Ocean is a pioneer in renewable energy systems! According to the The Independent Icelandic Energy Portal, ""In total, approximately 86% of Iceland’s consumption of primary energy comes from renewable sources."" This makes Iceland the world’s largest green electric-energy producer per capita! Future ImpactOut of this experience,  I will gain a deeper understanding of the world's most advanced renewable energy systems in the fields of hydroelectricity, geothermal, wind power and biofuels. This industry exposure will be essential to my future career as I refine my passion for the renewable energy industry and solving our planet's energy crisis. Through this program, I will also be making key connections with faculty from the Iceland School of Energy at Reykjavik University that will provide me with professional networking tools within the green-energy industry. After my lecture sessions from industry leaders and faculty from the Iceland School of Energy Master’s Program, I will be able to approach my course-work with dynamic real-world applications from this educational program!Where Will Your Monies Go?Your financial support will go to the tuition fee for the Renewable Energy and Sustainability educational program hosted by The GreenProgram in Iceland August 3-12, 2015. The program tuition fee will include:

column1: 5 lectures from industry leaders and faculty from the Iceland School of Energy Master’s Program
Exclusive access to world leading hydroelectric, biofuel, geothermal and wind energy facilities
3 ECTS or 1.5 US academic credits transferable from Reykjavik University’s School of Science and Engineering
Capstone Project facilitation and panel.
Icelandic adventure excursions (super jeeping, glacier walks, caving, glacier snorkeling, hot springs, Golden Circle tour, and more!)
Pre-program renewable energy overview online module
Automatic advancement in Iceland School of Energy at Reykjavik University’s Master’s Program application process
Access to directors at renewable energy companies
All breakfasts, lunches, dinners with local cuisine (*We accommodate vegetarian diets)
Lodging in various locations throughout the program
All in-country transportation
2,000,000ISK of in-country medical insurance
Post-program letters of recommendation
Exclusive membership to the GREEN Alumni Network
Sounds pretty groovy right? If you'd like to read more into the program, here's a link to the website! *Video Creds go out to Michael Brown!*",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

My name is Emily, and I'm a birth geek.

When I was three years old, my mother gave birth to my sister at home (an HBAC, for those of you in the know), with me in the room watching.  When I hit adolescence and was determined to be as contrary as possible, I'd often say that it had traumatized me, but in truth it changed me for the better.  For years before I became a mother, I was fascinated by the process of childbirth, but it wasn't until I got pregnant that it occurred to me: I could actually work with expecting and new mothers as a career.

So!  Having recently left my office job, I'm looking to start this new career by training to be a doula.  What's a doula, you ask?  I'll let Wikipedia explain: a doula is ""a nonmedical person who assists a woman before, during, or after childbirth, as well as her partner and/or family, by providing physical assistance, and emotional support.""  We were lucky to have a wonderful doula for the birth of our daughter, and I'd like to be able to do the same thing for others now.  

Why Doulas?

Women who labor in an unsupportive environment, without someone to advocate for them, often have negative and even traumatic birth experiences. Unlike a nurse or a doctor, whose shift may change during a labor, a doula's only responsibility is the laboring woman. This support can make a world of difference for the mother, baby and birth partner. Studies have shown that the presence of a doula can lead to shorter labors with fewer complications, as well as a 34% decrease in the risk of being dissatisfied with the birth experience.
column2:
>In short, more satisfied mamas means happier mamas, and happier mamas means happier babies!

Want to Help?

I am hoping to attend a three-day doula training this April.  The workshop fee is $500 but I'm looking to raise $800 to also cover the fees associated with applying for certification, as well as transportation and any other associated costs.  Any funds I don't use for those purposes will be donated to the Breast Cancer Coalition of Rochester.  

I'm so excited to be starting this new journey, and even more excited to get to share it with you.  Every bit of support helps, so whether or not you can lend support financially, please share this with a friend!

Thanks for joining me in realizing my goal!

","Event Details:
Venue         : Rackham Amphitheater (4th floor), University of Michigan, Ann ArborDate            : April 4, 2015 (Saturday)Time           : 10.00 am - 4.30 pm
Theme       : Rediscovering Malaysia, Redefining Identities
Visit our website and RSVP here.
Introduction:

The first MSF was held on March 15, 2014. It was opened to all Michigan students and also Malaysian students based in other universities across the United States. We invited academics from various universities in the United States to discuss on the national education system, the economic policies of 1Malaysia and the political landscape after the 13th General Election. After receiving overwhelmingly positive feedbacks from participants, speakers and sponsors, it will be a great honor for MiMSA to be given another opportunity in organizing the Malaysian Studies Forum 2015, this time with the theme Rediscovering Malaysia, Redefining Identities.
Overview:
Embracing the identity as a
multi-racial country since its independence from the British in 1957, Malaysia
has managed to impressively retain its racial and religious harmony, almost
without interruption. Nevertheless, for the nation to enjoy economic and social
prosperity in many years to come, it has to currently address some of its most
pressing problems.
Through the University and College
University Act, Malaysian students in local universities are restrained from
participating in politically affiliated events. At the same time, Malaysia
adopts Common Law from the British but also recognizes the subordinate,
states-based Sharia Law, which is enforced by the respective state Islamic
authorities. In recent years, these agencies have displayed a rising
assertiveness in complying Muslims with the states’ Islamic enactments, hence
creating confusion among Malaysians on the scope of power entitled to them by
the Constitution of Malaysia.
Avoiding from falling deeper into
the middle income trap, Malaysia is actively pursuing policies to position
itself to be a high income nation by 2020
column2: however, this comes at the expense

column1: of arranging some national priorities that should be pursued sooner rather than
later. At the global stage, while Malaysia currently becomes a non-permanent
member of the UN Security Council, soon there will be discussions on whether
Malaysia should continue to pursue more prominent role in the international
stage.
Together, these issues reflect
the need for Malaysia to reexamine its national identity, redefine its
priorities and reevaluate its past policies. It is the intention of us, the MSF
2015 working committee, to bring a more focused discussion that will shed light
on Malaysia’s recent developments.",1.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Ann Arbor, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/malaysian-studies-forum-2015/pica

Filmmaking is a new industry in Jordan, and there aren’t
enough educational institutions teaching this discipline. The RFC has been playing a major role in searching
for and training talents that would be capable of narrating/expressing
Jordanian stories, in addition to granting these talented filmmakers hands on
experience that would enable them to work on any international film production.
The filmmakers’ community is increasing in Jordan and the need for funding has become
more pressing for them to realize their projects. Subsequently, the RFC has
designed a new program - the Educational Feature Film (EFF) program - that
gives emerging Jordanian filmmakers a chance to tell their stories, under the
supervision of mentors.
The EFF is
structured as a workshop, whereby the RFC brings in experienced professionals
that work with filmmakers in the phases of production, cinematography, editing and
scriptwriting. The program is open to Jordanian writers or writers/directors,
regardless of their country of residence. It started in 2010 and helped produce
five films (see below).<span>  It was suspended
in 2013 due to shortage of funding.
<ul>
<li>
<span style=""color: rgb(0, 0, 0)
Jordanian talented filmmakers – working on their first feature-length
movie - with the opportunity to further develop their skills and enable
them to bring their project to life.
<li>
<b style=""background-color: initial
local directors a chance to produce their first feature film that will
enhance their chances for any future project that would require
international funding.
<li>
<b style=""background-color: initial
local talents and stories that will be representing Jordan in festivals
all around the world.
<li>
<b style=""background-color: initial
column3: > and promote new talents in various

column1: fields of filmmaking.
<li>
<b style=""background-color: initial
column3: > an appreciation for the filmmaking industry as a powerful tool for  aesthetic expression

column1: and cultural understanding.
<div>
<div>
Five feature films were shot in Jordan between (2010-2012) harvesting more then 8 international film awards, these films are:
<ul>
<li>
<span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
column2: >TRANSIT CITIES by
column3: >Mohamed Hushki.
column7: >The film was awarded the FIPRESCI prize and the

column1: Jury Special Prize at Dubai International Film Festival in 2010
won the 1st prize in the Dialogue of Cultures International Film Festival in
New York in 2010
<li>
<span style=""background-color: initial
column2: >THE LAST FRIDAY by Yahya Abdullah.
column3: > The film won 4 prizes at San Sebastian Cinema in
