column1: prize at Dubai International Film Festival in 2011
International Film Festival Forum in 2012
<li>
WHEN MONALIZA SMILED by Fadi Haddad. The film won 2 awards at Oran Arab Film Festival in Algeria 2013, Best Actress and Journalists Award
column2: it also won Best Feature Film Award at The International Film Festival of Kashmir, India 2014

column1: <li>
A 7 HOUR DIFFERENCE by Deema Amr. The film won Best International Feature at Manhattan Film Festival 2012
column2: Special Jury Award at Malmo Arab Film Festival 2012
column3: it also won 2 awards at Tenerife International Film Festival 2012, Best Actress and Best Cinematography.

column1: <li>
LINE OF SIGHT by Aseel Mansour. The film was screened at the Dubai International Film
Festival 2012, and participated in Muhr Arab Features Competition.
<ul>
Through your generous support in
bringing a new cycle of the EFF back to life, you will help create a major
impact by:
<ul>
<li>Giving
birth to a new local content that will reflect our culture, challenges and
stories.
<li>Helping
local filmmakers create show reels and portfolios that will help them embark
in their professional aspiring careers.
<li>Creating
a new pool of job opportunities for the local filmmakers, as each film
project ends up providing jobs for some 80 people.
<li>Supporting
the film industry in Jordan, as all these film projects provide filmmakers
with experiences that can only be gained on the field.
<li>Spreading
the cinema culture.
<li>Building the capacities of
filmmakers by providing them with a professional filmmaking experience.
<div>

The below chart shows a budget breakdown for the films produced through the EFF. At the beginning of the new EFF round and once we achieve our target, we will share actual budgets with our contributors.
The Royal Film Commission-Jordan (RFC)
was established in 2003. The RFC is a governmental organization that enjoys
administrative and financial autonomy. It is managed by a Board of Commissioners,
presided by His Royal Highness Prince Ali Bin Al-Hussein.
In addition to being a member of the
Association of Film Commissioners International, the RFC has played a
pioneering role in developing the film industry in Jordan. It provides wide-ranging
production services to local, regional and international films shot completely
or partially in Jordan. The RFC offers several training opportunities. It has
established various films centers that cater for beginners and professionals
alike. These opportunities encourage creativity, promote freedom of expression,
and enable filmmakers to tell their stories using the international cinema
language. This is achieved through
numerous workshops, seminars and discussion sessions on various aspects related
to filmmaking. “Rawi” is a highly-acclaimed annual screenwriting lab, open to
filmmakers from the region. Last but not least, the RFC organizes regular
screenings all year round in Amman and the rest of the country.
For this new round of the EFF, we are aiming to create three
feature films. Each film project requires a modest budget of 100,000 USD.<span>  We welcome your help and support making this

happen.

We appreciate all kinds of assistance: monetary contribution, in-kind
assistance or simply word of mouth support. You can use the built-in sharing
tools provided by the website. Together we can make it happen.

Thank you for your help!

scriptwriting. The program is open to Jordanian writers or writers/directors,
regardless of their country of residence. It started in 2010 and helped produce
five films (see below).  It was suspended
in 2013 due to shortage of funding.
Provide
Jordanian talented filmmakers – working on their first feature-length
movie - with the opportunity to further develop their skills and enable
them to bring their project to life.
Give
local directors a chance to produce their first feature film that will
enhance their chances for any future project that would require
international funding.
Showcase
local talents and stories that will be representing Jordan in festivals
all around the world.
Trigger and promote new talents in various
fields of filmmaking.
Foster an appreciation for the filmmaking industry as a powerful tool for  aesthetic expression
and cultural understanding.
Five feature films were shot in Jordan between (2010-2012) harvesting more then 8 international film awards, these films are:
TRANSIT CITIES by Mohamed Hushki. The film was awarded the FIPRESCI prize and the
Jury Special Prize at Dubai International Film Festival in 2010
won the 1st prize in the Dialogue of Cultures International Film Festival in
New York in 2010
THE LAST FRIDAY by Yahya Abdullah. The film won 4 prizes at San Sebastian Cinema in
Motion Film Festival
column2: It also won Best Actor, Best Composer and the Jury

column1: prize at Dubai International Film Festival in 2011
International Film Festival Forum in 2012
WHEN MONALIZA SMILED by Fadi Haddad. The film won 2 awards at Oran Arab Film Festival in Algeria 2013, Best Actress and Journalists Award
column2: it also won Best Feature Film Award at The International Film Festival of Kashmir, India 2014

column1: A 7 HOUR DIFFERENCE by Deema Amr. The film won Best International Feature at Manhattan Film Festival 2012
column2: Special Jury Award at Malmo Arab Film Festival 2012
column3: it also won 2 awards at Tenerife International Film Festival 2012, Best Actress and Best Cinematography.

column1: LINE OF SIGHT by Aseel Mansour. The film was screened at the Dubai International Film
Festival 2012, and participated in Muhr Arab Features Competition.
Through your generous support in
bringing a new cycle of the EFF back to life, you will help create a major
impact by:
Giving
birth to a new local content that will reflect our culture, challenges and
stories.
Helping
local filmmakers create show reels and portfolios that will help them embark
in their professional aspiring careers.
Creating
a new pool of job opportunities for the local filmmakers, as each film
project ends up providing jobs for some 80 people.
Supporting
the film industry in Jordan, as all these film projects provide filmmakers
with experiences that can only be gained on the field.
Spreading
the cinema culture.
Building the capacities of
filmmakers by providing them with a professional filmmaking experience.

The below chart shows a budget breakdown for the films produced through the EFF. At the beginning of the new EFF round and once we achieve our target, we will share actual budgets with our contributors.
The Royal Film Commission-Jordan (RFC)
was established in 2003. The RFC is a governmental organization that enjoys
administrative and financial autonomy. It is managed by a Board of Commissioners,
presided by His Royal Highness Prince Ali Bin Al-Hussein.
In addition to being a member of the
Association of Film Commissioners International, the RFC has played a
pioneering role in developing the film industry in Jordan. It provides wide-ranging
production services to local, regional and international films shot completely
or partially in Jordan. The RFC offers several training opportunities. It has
established various films centers that cater for beginners and professionals
alike. These opportunities encourage creativity, promote freedom of expression,
and enable filmmakers to tell their stories using the international cinema
language. This is achieved through
numerous workshops, seminars and discussion sessions on various aspects related
to filmmaking. “Rawi” is a highly-acclaimed annual screenwriting lab, open to
filmmakers from the region. Last but not least, the RFC organizes regular
screenings all year round in Amman and the rest of the country.
For this new round of the EFF, we are aiming to create three
feature films. Each film project requires a modest budget of 100,000 USD.  We welcome your help and support making this
happen.We appreciate all kinds of assistance: monetary contribution, in-kind
assistance or simply word of mouth support. You can use the built-in sharing
tools provided by the website. Together we can make it happen.
Thank you for your help!",12.0,0,"2 Campaigns
|","Amman, Jordan",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/educational-feature-film-program/pica

column2:

column1: Feed it directly into the Canadian Press Wire Network to get our message inside the newsroom editorial systems of media ACROSS Canada.

Allies for BC Public Education has a plan to use Marketwired's services to do just this for only $500!
We are ready, willing, and able to launch this next week right before the BC Court of Appeal hearing on October 14 (less than 6 working days away!). All we are missing is the financial umph!

That's where you come in! All we need is $20 from 25 Allies to make this happen!

Help us protect BC Public Education by making a contribution today.

Round 2: Vancouver 24 hrs ad set to run Tuesday Oct 7, 2014

Celebrating the Next Generation of Khmer Dancers and Musicians

Each December, Khmer Arts presents a performance by students of our youth training program, which has over 60 students. This is a chance for our parents, families, and communities to come together and witness the growth of our budding artists. This year, our annual showing will take place on December 24, 2017 at the bucolic Khmer Arts Theater located in Prek Hor, Cambodia.

 

Little Gesture, Big Impact

We are looking for 20 good people who can donate $50 each, to raise a total of $1000. Your support gives young people an opportunity to train with Cambodia's leading dancers and musicians. Under their tutelage, the youth learn traditional and new choreographies and songs, and gain the skills and knowledge necessary to carry our beautiful yet vulnerable art form into the future. In short you are helping young people lead rich and empowered lives, and joining us in our work to push Cambodia to new heights!

 

Who We Are

Khmer Arts is a 501(c)3 non-profit organization dedicated to fostering the vitality of Cambodian dance and music across borders. A natural extension of the work of our founding artistic director, Sophiline Cheam Shapiro, we see ourselves as a nexus of arts and culture in a transnational community that is endowed with wonderful traditions and that is looking for ways of using those traditions to improve its quality of life. Through our numerous programs, we seek to create a continuum of recruitment, training, research, outreach, creation and performance that develops accomplished artists, compelling works of art and diverse, informed audiences.

For more information: www.khmerarts.org

As stated in the aforementioned links, a blind women had her backpack stolen by a thief which contained a great deal of personal belongings at a local establishment in Toronto. The items stolen included money for a month's worth of groceries, her cell phone, dance shoes amongst other valuables. Let's chip in and help her out with any short-term + item replacement costs! Check the articles out, collectively we'll find a way to get the money to her! Chalk one up for your karmic slate and donate! Let's showcase that the residents of Toronto and cities abroad are finer individuals than those who steal from someone who is unable to adequately defend themselves!

Well we have started our campaign. If you have any queries, suggestions or just want to say ""Hi"" email us at info@fanbook.com.au
Note: in most cases you will receive your Perks within 2 days.
About POLITALK
Politalk allows real people to make real comments to our elected leaders of our nations, our states, our cities and our local community.
Politalk creates transparency so there is nowhere to hide when people are looking for change or accountability.
Politalk is more than just about politics or should we say government politics.
It's about you, family comunity,health, education, taxes, homelessness, starvation, the environment, endangered species, stupid wars...the list goes on.
Politalk creates platforms for people to congrigate and use the power of numbers for a cause, to benefit and make positive change for that cause.

Everyone has something they are passionate about. Be it their own personal development or seeking a cure for their best friends cancer, saving the whales, saving starving people, improving communities etc.
What is your passion?
What we want to do
We want to create a global specific community that can come together with other like minded people to champion the cause(s) they care about.
If you think of the world as a wall. We want to build this wall, as big as we can, one brick at a time, one person at a time, but with multiple causes addressed all of the time.

By becoming a contributor, you are automatically a member of a community that cares. And by being a member of this community you will be in the company of like minded people who will help you, guide you and accelerate your cause.
Our initial countries are USA, UK, Australia and Canada. This is a massive task by itself, but we will add further countries - one brick at atime.
Please feel free to suggest your country.
What your conbribution means to us
Your contributions go to fund the parts that just have to be paid for
column2: such as programming, production, data input-HUGE-management and promtion. As simple as that.

column1: If we fall short of our target we carry on, just slower.
If we achieve our target we are up and happening asap.
If we exceed our target, we are on the way to make the world a better place immediately.
What your contribution means to you

By being a contributor, you are automatically part of this community, which means you can make comment, engage and cause an effect on any issue which can range from addressing your local government on why garbage trucks are waking me up at 4.00am in the morning, to why more funding is not spent on education, to why are we fighting a war that has nothing to do with us, to saving the wales, feeding the homeless and starving. That's got to be a good feeling..
Have a look at our perks to see where you would like to be.
You elected them. Or did you?

Tell them what you want and at the same time there will be others who want what you want. With an open POLITALK forum, they cannot hide or put it in the ""I'll address this in 3 months basket"". It is just there for all to see.
Is there anything you want to say to them?
Sexy Stuff
If we exceed our target, we will implement one of our campaigns that is all about celebrity and their causes.
It works like this.
Most major celebrities champion causes, be it human rights, cancer, the environment, hurricane/cyclone devistation etc etc.

We can promote these causes, with celebrity endorsement, as a contest to have dinner with them. People donate to the cause, six are winners. It is ""Real people meeting unreal people and finding out that they are real people"". This will be filmed and sold as a show. 100% of donations go to the cause/charity and proceeds from the show go towards the making the next show.
As a contributor you are automatically - on a pro rata basis, in other words the higher the contribution the more chance you have to win a seat at the table - included in the draw.
We have spoken with many major celebrities and the answer has always been ""when?""
Who would you like to meet?
Create awareness on POLITALK
<div>
Reality
Did you know...
There are only 600 Black Rhino's in Kenya. At least one Rhino in Africa is killed every day. Just for their horns. Do the math. This has to stop.
What do Rhino's have to do with politics. Not a lot apparently.
Create awareness on POLITALK
vs
How about a nice new shiny balistic missile - one use only - or saving the lives of 100+ starving men, women and children.
It's all about the way our governments spend your money. There should be something in there about priorities. Don't you think??
Create awareness on POLITALK
<div>
VS
What price for a Panda?                                                   a tigger (Tiger) ??
They could all be gone soon...forever.
Create awareness on POLITALK
VS
column2: >
>It is really tough when your lock yourself out of your car.

column1: He even had the matching purple shirt to match the car.
Notice the diference between ""haves"" and ""have nots""
Yes, the sleeping man is dry and comfortable.
Choice?
Create awareness on POLITALK

There are many more examples that can be shown. If you think about gun control, AIDS, cancer, why your power bill is so high or why your credit rating sucks. These are all things that impact our lives.  Why is it that my child has down syndrome when we have always wanted children, but the nieghbours down the street have 5 billion strong and healthy idiot children with parents who just don't care.
Life is what you make of it. As best you can. And for others.
It's getting hot in here. It must be global warming??
Maybe you have an opinion on that?
Have a look at our test site at www.politalk.com.au
Get on board and lets make a difference.
Note 1: All perks are provided to us via our parent company Fanbook PTY LTD
Note 2: We cannot include any celebrity perks at this time as we are in the middle of negotiating. Having said that all contributors automatically go into the draw.
Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:
<ul>
• Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
• Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Hello out there!

I am Coral and I have a super cute bestie named Kelly. Many years ago Kelly and I moved from Chicago to New York City to hit it big and become amazing New Yorkers with that special midwest charm. Kinda worked but we both ended up back in Chicago. Upon my departure I was given a gift certificate for American Airlines which helped fund one of my first trips back to Chicago and have yet to forget that great gift giving.

When Kelly announced she was accepting Yale's generous offer to let her go to their school I thought to myself, ""Gosh wouldn't it be great if we could get Kelly back to Chicago a lot of times so we didn't miss her as much."" As panic set in about her pending departure I began researching effective and non-creepy ways to let her friends and family come together and give whatever amount they wanted to the Bring Kelly Back Project. Your donation will go toward a surprise gift certificate for an airline company to fly Kelly to see her friends and family. It's that easy!

So here's your chance! $500 was the minimum goal I could set but I figured, what the hell let's give it a try! If you would rather buy her a cute vintage tea set she will then have to pack, break, and unpack, by all means go ahead. But if you prefer to sacrifice a silly whiskey drink you would be buying her on a night of many whiskey drinks and see her again soon, throw a couple bucks in the pot and email me your name and message to include in her card!

If you are a stranger and reading this, just know Kelly is a one of a kind lady embarking on a long journey at Yale as a Dramaturgy Graduate student. What is dramaturgy you ask? Look it up because it's awesome and my description will do it no justice. Not only is she smart and ambitious, but she is also a master rapper (Rap name is MC Run-On), a messy eater, a fast reader, very quick, and probably one of the funniest people ever. Thank you!!!
<div>
<div>

0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""> <h3>
Hello Family, Friends and Supporters!

As a few of your may know, I began teaching after school computer to 3rd, 4th and 5th graders. The kids have been very excited to attend the classes, however we have an unexpected obstacle. The computers that we are using are out of date, out of warranty discarded school computers and they have proven less than reliable as a teaching tool. I have been working on turning this dream into a reality for many years, and with a small contribution for this very necessary equipment, we can make this dream into a reality.

The classes so far have been a great success. With very minimal advertising I have already filled up my first four courses and have been asked to offer a class at another school. The current goal is to offer computer classes to 5 new schools by September 2016. The ratio of teacher to student is 1:12. My classes are focused on everyday computer skills that kids don’t get the time to learn in class.  It may seem that “kids know it all” when it comes to computers, but they are just getting the necessary computer education during their school day.

Each day I see the children faces light up when they learn something “cool” or when they say “OH! that's how you do it.” At the same time the children can easily lose focus when there is a computer issue which can’t be resolved because of subpar technology.

I am so excited to have such a great start to this program, and with your support  I can make these classes a reality with modern computer software and hardware.  It is so rewarding to hear how many supporters I have. 

I  thank you for your support.

My classes are focused on everyday computer skills that kids don’t get the time to learn in class.  It may seem that “kids know it all” when it comes to computers, but they are just getting the necessary computer education during their school day.

Each day I see the children faces light up when they learn something “cool” or when they say “OH! that's how you do it.” At the same time the children can easily lose focus when there is a computer issue which can’t be resolved because of subpar technology.

I am so excited to have such a great start to this program, and with your support  I can make these classes a reality with modern computer software and hardware.  It is so rewarding to hear how many supporters I have. I  thank you for your support.",0.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","San Diego, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/computer-education-for-kids--3/pica

The Main Details:
(Highlighted and Underlined words are links, click for more information!)
My name is Malachi Phelps and i'm nothing if not an artist.
<ul>
• I'm from Aberdeen, WA
• Have always wanted to spread messages of encouragement and growth through media and animation
• My goal is to obtain an Masters in Fine Arts (Digital Technology and Culture) from the Pullman Washington State University campus
• I totally killed it applying for scholarships, but the one thing I need help with is transportation. This is where you come in!
Let's Talk Specifics:
Here's a general breakdown of the travel mileage and expenses that will go into transporting
column2: oe=5916ED82"" rel=""noopener nofollow"">my physical self, my computer,
column3: oe=591C9197"" rel=""noopener nofollow"">my rabbit, a bed set, and a mannequin from Aberdeen (western state border) to Pullman (eastern state border)!

column1: <ul>

<li>U-Haul is fairly inexpensive as far as transportation trailers cost, but that isn't to say that it's going to be cheap. <u><a href=""https://scontent.fsnc1-1.fna.fbcdn.net/v/t1.0-9/16265605_1763477193677797_2204270624695742942_n.jpg?oh=6ac687bf04b15267cf64127addf2129f&amp
column2: oe=59084911"" rel=""noopener nofollow"">Here is a screenshot of an estimate I calculated, inputting my distance from Aberdeen to Pullman into their price predictor. Renting a U-Haul will cost an estimated $530, on top of the gas money that isn't added to that price.

column1: • Gas went down from $5 to $2.50 over the last decade and I am definitely NOT complaining, however I do have to do a bit of guesswork to estimate how much gas will cost, given that the size of trailer I plan to rent gets about 12 highway miles to the gallon. Let's see, 400 (miles) divided by 12 (miles per gallon) is about 33 (gallons of gas required for the trip). If 33 times 2.50 (dollars per gallon) is the correct equation here, then gas is going to cost about $85.
<li>

This site charges a 5% fee, it's understandable given that the hosts who are upkeeping the servers have mouths to feed themselves. A 5% chunk of my total requested funds is about $30. Compared to the total I'm racking up in hypothetical U-Haul fees, this isn't that much to ask.
What Donating Means to Me:

This degree means so much to me, not only because being an animator and storyboard artist has always been my dream job, but also because this career will support my financial goals to provide jobs for the impoverished people of my hometown, and to help support my community by giving back.

With this degree I can engage directly in the media that the next generation of Americans (and who knows, maybe even internationally!) will grow up with. Surely you remember watching cartoons or playing video games as a child, being exposed to the lessons you learned about life and interpersonal relationships, courage, creativity, and all sorts of impossible situations and realities that otherwise would have gone unbeknownst to you. The television and media platforms of today are unlocked windows of imagination and endless exploration. I plan to take full advantage of the opportunities granted by my degree to encourage thoughtfulness and consideration to people of all ages. Cartoons mean so much to me, it's how I plan to subtly promote peace in the world.
Donating Isn't the Only Way to Show Support:
Donating is obviously the goal of this whole shabang, however it is not the sole way in which to help me get where i'm going, both literally and figuratively.
<ul>

• Sharing is caring. Please take time to share this campaign on your social media platform. Even if you can't donate yourself (which is entirely fine, I'm in no position to judge), then maybe someone in your friends list is able to instead. Who knows, life is unpredictable!
<li>

Check out my art and order a commission, suggest my work to a friend, or even just follow me on my Facebook. Self-promotion is my main source of revenue, and it's sometimes hard to effectively spread the word when you're only one person.

Again, thank you so much for considering making a donation, or even for reading through all of this. It really does mean a lot to me knowing that there's the potential for me to have access to this level of education.

The absolutely first technical trade school of its kind, West Coast Customs Academy's mission is to motivate, train and provide students with technical skills relative to the automotive aftermarket trades. The Academy will offer a comprehensive 48-week program featuring a curriculum format comprised of six trade level instructional segments including Auto Body, Upholstery, Fabrication, Wheels and Tires, Electronics, and Wrap and Tint. The rigorous program, slated to commence early 2017, will provide students with both in-depth classroom time taught by leaders in the customization industry and hands-on training and project work at the world-famous West Coast Customs.

Q: Why aren’t you paying for this yourself?
A: Great question! The purpose of this campaign is to raise money from people who believe in West Coast Customs and the craft of building custom vehicles. We want to raise the money from dedicated fans and industry professionals who believe in our mission which makes it authentic to who we are and what West Coast Customs Academy stands for.
column2:
>Q: When will West Coast Customs Academy open?
A: Classes will commence early 2017. An exact date is TBA and will be announced in the update section of the campaign.
column3: >Q: How much will tuition be?
column4:
>A: $40,000 per year.

Q: How can you enroll?
A: Once the campaign has concluded there will be an enrollment page on the West Coast Customs Academy website.

The rigorous program provides students with both in-depth classroom time taught by leaders in the customization industry and hands-on training and project work.

column1: <b><i>Group &amp

Q: What if I can't make the tour or have to cancel my trip? 
A:  You can reschedule up to 1 year after the campaign has concluded. 


Founder Brick At Entrance

Q: How many characters can be on the brick? 
A: Up to 45 characters.

Q: What are the parameters of what I can put on my brick?
A: No profanity, inappropriate slang, insulting or discriminatory content, content construed to incite violence, material that West Coast Customs wishes not to place on property, content that
column2: >violates another party’s trademark or intellectual property rights (may include words, phrases, celebrity names, professional sports teams, and even certain color combinations when used with particular words or geographic designations).
column3: >Brick submissions must adhere to West Coast Customs guidelines, and West Coast Customs reserves the right to reject any submitted text.

column1: Lunch / Dinner For 2 With Ryan

Q: Where will we eat?
A: Lunch / Dinner will be at one of Ryan's favorite restaurants in the Los Angeles area.

Q: What if I can't make the lunch/dinner or have to cancel my trip? 
A: You can reschedule up to 1 year after the campaign has concluded.

CEO Of WCC For A Day
Q: What will being CEO for a day be like? 
A: You will shadow Ryan for the day, learning the ins and outs of the vehicle customization business. You will be part of current work-in-progress builds, sit in on staff meetings, meet the fans, have lunch with Ryan and be privy to West Coast Customs future plans.

Q: What if I can't make the scheduled day or have to cancel my trip? 
A: You can reschedule for up to 1 year after the campaign has concluded.

A:
column3:

Housing is not included in scholarship fees.

column1: One Of A Kind Prototype Build

Q: What does the one of a kind prototype build entail and is there a dollar amount it can't exceed?
A: You will work with Ryan and the award-winning West Coast Customs design team to create a fully original car body, interior and more. The base vehicle price cannot exceed $250,000.

If your question isn’t answered here, contact us at
wcca@westcoastcustoms.com
We will respond as promptly as we can.

Summary

Nearly 4 million of the 6.5 million children in the US who have disabilities are performing below grade level for reading and math. The adults who work with these children are increasingly overwhelmed by outdated systems, time-consuming tasks, and redundancy in the data being collected. Kidhoo changes this by providing a secure HIPAA compliant app to help the team view the goals &
column2: supports for a one or more children in seconds, record, share, &amp

column1: <ul>

• We are parents, teachers, and therapists of children that have had a special need (e.g. speech therapy) or an IEP plan for our children. We have set out to make it easier for us all to view, record and share relevant information about what's working or not working for a child so we can tailor the care and instruction to help children reach their goals.
• We are raising money to complete product development activities that can help us get ready for our existing customer in the fall and bring on new ones into our private beta program.

• By helping contribute to this campaign, you will get access to the application and be part of changing how Individualized Education Plans (IEPs) are created and managed which could potentially benefit the adults who support the 6.5 million children in the US who have disabilities.
<h3>What We Need &amp
What we need:
<ul>
• Moral Support :) Ok Fine. We need money too.
<li>The money you contribute to this campaign will go towards:<ul>
• Coding 4 new features requested by our existing Beta Users.
<li>Marketing / Ads for promoting the application on social channels and traditional paper based campaigns in magazines &amp
column2: blogs to improve outcomes for children with disabilities and helping teams work better together.

column1: • For your contributions, we will be providing access codes for # of children. If one person pays the others get it for free. So buy for a single child or an entire school.
The Impact
Big picture... numbers numbers numbers:
<ul>
<li>6.5 million children in US have a disability and are supported through the IDEA program which allows them to get the right to a fair education.<ul>
• 4 million of these children are not at their grade level for reading and math
• 2.5 million won't graduate college without the right support from adults in their lives

• The lack of visibility has caused this issue to propel into courts, where Districts across the US have spent $90M annually on litigation costs where services have been inadequate or inconsistently provided. Kidhoo can alleviate that by providing visibility across team members which leads to discussions that can build cooperative teams.
• There is potential for this app to be used in Elder care, and in other countries.
<h3>Risks &amp
We started the company back in 2014, and have since:
<ul>
• Been faced with issues on security - which we addressed by following HIPAA regulations.

• Developer availability. We are relying on some awesome coders, but things happen and we want to be sure that it is transparent. Our plan is to continue with the current set of developers and document the code as much as possible to ensure transition (should it be needed) is easier and faster.
Other Ways You Can Help
Send out shout outs to us and follow us on:
<ul>
<li>Twitter &amp
• Share the link to this campaign on your Facebook, blog, or otherwise to help us reach our goal.

And that's it... loads to read... we will upload the video of the current beta app or you can visit our site http://www.kidhoo.co (note: it is not a .com)

","Summary

Nearly 4 million of the 6.5 million children in the US who have disabilities are performing below grade level for reading and math. The adults who work with these children are increasingly overwhelmed by outdated systems, time-consuming tasks, and redundancy in the data being collected. Kidhoo changes this by providing a secure HIPAA compliant app to help the team view the goals & supports for a one or more children in seconds, record, share, & discuss progress enabling teamwork & consistency.

We are parents, teachers, and therapists of children that have had a special need (e.g. speech therapy) or an IEP plan for our children. We have set out to make it easier for us all to view, record and share relevant information about what's working or not working for a child so we can tailor the care and instruction to help children reach their goals.
We are raising money to complete product development activities that can help us get ready for our existing customer in the fall and bring on new ones into our private beta program.

By helping contribute to this campaign, you will get access to the application and be part of changing how Individualized Education Plans (IEPs) are created and managed which could potentially benefit the adults who support the 6.5 million children in the US who have disabilities.
What We Need & What You Get
What we need:
Moral Support :) Ok Fine. We need money too.
The money you contribute to this campaign will go towards:
Coding 4 new features requested by our existing Beta Users.

Marketing / Ads for promoting the application on social channels and traditional paper based campaigns in magazines & blogs to improve outcomes for children with disabilities and helping teams work better together.
For your contributions, we will be providing access codes for # of children. If one person pays the others get it for free. So buy for a single child or an entire school.
The Impact
Big picture... numbers numbers numbers:
6.5 million children in US have a disability and are supported through the IDEA program which allows them to get the right to a fair education.
4 million of these children are not at their grade level for reading and math
2.5 million won't graduate college without the right support from adults in their lives

The lack of visibility has caused this issue to propel into courts, where Districts across the US have spent $90M annually on litigation costs where services have been inadequate or inconsistently provided. Kidhoo can alleviate that by providing visibility across team members which leads to discussions that can build cooperative teams.
There is potential for this app to be used in Elder care, and in other countries.
Risks & Challenges
We started the company back in 2014, and have since:
Been faced with issues on security - which we addressed by following HIPAA regulations.

Developer availability. We are relying on some awesome coders, but things happen and we want to be sure that it is transparent. Our plan is to continue with the current set of developers and document the code as much as possible to ensure transition (should it be needed) is easier and faster.
Other Ways You Can Help
Send out shout outs to us and follow us on:
Twitter & Facebook: @KidhooCo
Share the link to this campaign on your Facebook, blog, or otherwise to help us reach our goal.
And that's it... loads to read... we will upload the video of the current beta app or you can visit our site http://www.kidhoo.co (note: it is not a .com)",0.0,0,"2 Campaigns
|","New York City, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/kidhoo/pica

The concept of AirSchool has developed over the last five years.  In order to bring solutions to families, children, and teachers to introduce and encourage the revolutionary technology that is available and to future proof children's education.
Future Proof Education

AirSchool is an environment where children are LEARNERS and not just students.  With children directing their own learning experiences, their inner geniuses will be awakened.  This is the future of education.  We are all born to be great, we just have to find where our greatness lies.
Core Values of AirSchool
<ol>
• Being emotionally strong and prepared
• Understand coding and embrace critical thinking
• Being able to bring ideas into reality and understand money and monetization
• Be the commander of your digital use in responsible and effective ways
The 5 Fundamentals
<ol>
• Emotional Engine
• Coding and Critical Thinking
• Biz for Kids
• Financial Education
• Digital Citizenship

After completing the first stage, setting up the curriculums and site development that we had bootstrapped, we are now in need of your support to produce the courses in high quality and to accelerate the platform to the next stage.

Your contribution is important to the delivery of content to the families, children, and teachers who have been waiting for this program in order to deliver high quality and future proof education at affordable prices.
We are looking to raise $100,000 to develop the 5 fundamental courses in high quality at a professional level and also to develop further our platform to involve membership driven content.
Marketing and promoting the new ways of learning will be funded with the money raised.
Your contribution will be rewarded with special perks like AirSchool branded beanies, t-shirts, newest trending EDC spinner, and subscriptions to our content.

If we come short of the funding goal, our direction and commitment will not veer.  We will still bring this platform to its highest potential.  Willing to impact on the future of education for millions of children.

As we are aware, the current education system is out of date and instead of trying to change the system but rather enhance it.  However, changing the way we learn and by taking lead, we know the education system will be inspired enough to make appropriate changes of their own.
We must admit, our future will rely more and more on technology.

Our biggest challenge is being able to reach as many people as possible, ensuring that this will be a ""movement"" and not a ""moment"".  Making digital education affordable to as many people as possible.  Eventually, making our platform into an open source platform.
Over the last 5 years, we had great results with our live workshops.

Just in case at this moment you are not ready to provide with financial support, you can still give us amazing support by sharing our idea through your social network.  Help us to raise awareness too future proof your children's education.

<h2 style=""text-align: center
Scarica subito l'anteprima PDF per farti un'idea del corso da uno dei mirror: Dropbox – Mega – Scribd

Ciao, sono Stefano Novelli, amministratore del portale Inforge.net . Da anni la mia passione sono Sicurezza Informatica e Ethical Hacking, ho pubblicato alcuni ebook sull'argomento e in passato ho collaborato alla stesura di alcuni articoli su Hacker Journal (nota rivista ormai defunta).
Ho sempre trovato affascinante il mondo della Sicurezza Informatica e degli Hackers che in passato (e ancora oggi) hanno rivoluzionato il modo in cui oggi vediamo con i nostri occhi l'Informatica
column2: tuttavia ho avuto difficoltà negli ultimi anni a trovare documenti in lingua italiana esaustivi, spesso trattati con poca sufficienza da persone non adatte a farlo. Gli unici che valgono la pena di essere citati, sono libri altamente tecnici e costosi.

column1: Seguendo la filosofia del software libero e dell'etica White Hat ho così deciso di avviare in passato un corso chiamato Hacklog, che raccoglie con video facilmente assimilabili da chiunque il meraviglioso mondo che gira attorno al mondo della Sicurezza Informatica e dell'Hacking Etico.
Nel 2015 abbiamo arrestato la pubblicazione dell'Hacklog, studiando un nuovo modo di approcciare l'argomento, sviluppando un nuovo format e migliorando tutta la strumentazione a nostra disposizione.

Nel nuovo format sono necessari diversi strumenti, alcuni dei quali già recuperati (come un buon microfono, un mixer audio, una scheda video adeguata e tutto il software necessario), tuttavia abbiamo ancora bisogno di acquistare materiale adatto per toccare livelli mai visti prima!
Con i fondi ottenuti acquisteremo:
<ul>
• Source di elementi video per migliorare la spiegazione dei nostri corsi
• Componenti Hardware che utilizzeremo per l'autocostruzione di portali di anonimato, chiavette USB per i test di Data Shredding e strumenti di test generali (ad es. lettori, hard disk etc...)
• Pubblicità sui social network dove sponsorizzeremo il progetto

Se per qualche malaugurato motivo non riuscissimo a raggiungere il goal prefissato non sarà comunque un problema: il progetto non verrà abbandonato e cercheremo di completarlo virtualizzando gli argomenti che non riusciremo ad affrontare in reale.
Il rilascio di tutte le puntate è previsto per Gennaio 2017 (leggi note in fondo).

Abbiamo pensato per te alcune opzioni che possono ripagare il tuo impegno economico. Tieni presente che a tutte le opzioni presenti abbiamo dedicato sempre una piccola percentuale da destinare al progetto, così da non farlo diventare un mero lavoro d'ufficio!
In base all'opzione che sceglierai potrai ottenere:
<ul>
• Un ringraziamento alla fine dei video che pubblicheremo e sul book (sia digitale che cartaceo) tra i credits dei donatori
• Una copia cartacea del libro in bianco e nero, con copertina a colori flessibile e in formato A5 (o simile)
• Tutti i donatori otterranno un link in privato delle puntate in anteprima non appena verranno caricate di volta in volta!**
*Per problemi di formattazione e di spazio solo i primi 50 acquirenti del book riceveranno il titolo di donatori.
**La seguente soluzione è stata momentaneamente bloccata per motivi di gestione. Stiamo cercando di risolvere, ci scusiamo per il disagio.

Per garantire la sicurezza dell'investimento, il progetto viene distribuito da Inforge.net, portale che da anni ricopre un ruolo importante nel settore della Sicurezza Informatica e Ethical Hacking. Abbiamo collaborato - e lo stiamo ancora facendo - con diverse aziende del settore, a dimostrazione della serietà di quanto ci impegnamo ad offrire.

Nella vecchia serie Hacklog abbiamo raggiunto un totale di circa 500.000 visualizzazioni, un numero impressionante se consideriamo che è un argomento fortemente di nicchia. Questo purtroppo non ci ha permesso di riutilizzare i fondi guadagnati dalle pubblicità in quanto nettamente inferiore agli investimenti.

Nel nostro caso, l'Hacklog non è un progetto costruito ad-hoc per essere virale (come noti Youtubers che urlano e strillano!) ma una serie di video che non hanno lo scopo di intrattenere ma di informare.

Se deciderai di contribuire al progetto, scriverai un piccolo pezzo di storia nelle pagine di Inforge.net e, chi lo sa, magari anche della sub-cultura hacker in Italia! In ogni caso, il tuo contributo non sarà dimenticato =)
Se sei arrivato qui vuol dire che conosci l'Hacklog ma prima di arrivarci quanti tutorial completamente inutili ti sarai sorbito? Tanti, immagino.

Quello che vogliamo fare è alzare l'asticella dell'informazione sulla Sicurezza oggi, confrontandoci di petto contro pseudo-insegnanti nella rete che parlano di Visual Basic 6.0 o di SQL Injection e non sono neanche in grado di nascondere il loro IP! Ecco il motivo per cui parte dei fondi saranno destinati alla pubblicità nei social, che verranno sapientemente utilizzati per fare marketing concentrato, cercando di puntare anche alle riviste e siti web più importanti del settore.

Questo non deve significare rendere difficile lo studio anzi! I corsi che abbiamo fatto in passato sono si professionali ma anche facili da apprendere e adatti ad ogni livello di istruzione, che sia un esperto programmatore o un esordiente alle prime armi.
Sono perfettamente consapevole che non tutti possono contribuire al progetto. Ciò non significa che sei una persona inutile, tutt'altro!
Puoi aiutarci a far crescere questo progetto in diversi modi:
<ul>
• Aiutandoci a verificare gli errori presenti nell'Anteprima dell'Hacklog: Volume 1, segnalandoci gli errori grammaticali o migliorandone e ampliandone i contenuti
• Condividere questa campagna nel tuo profilo social!

• Ringraziare gli autori, i collaboratori e i donatori che potrai incontrare negli eventi dedicati alla Sicurezza Informatica e all'Hacking (li riconoscerai, sono quei tipi strani che girano con la maglietta di Inforge!)
Per il momento è tutto, su vediamo cosa riusciamo a fare!

* La licenza di rilascio potrebbe cambiare ma rimarrà comunque copyleft gratuita. I tempi di spedizione potrebbero subire ritardi nel caso in cui non si riuscisse a sviluppare in tempo il progetto. I tempi sono approssimativi e sono indicati in buona fede ma potrebbero non rispecchiare l'arco temporale corretto.
","Visto su:

Short Summary

Kevin Folta, Chair of the Department of Horticulture at the University of Florida, has been attacked for communicating solid science that is politically controversial. Dr. Folta is a champion for farmers large and small and for the needs of hungry people around the world. As a public employee, he has made it his work to be of service to mankind. His outreach efforts include visiting thousands of students all over ranging from grade school to grad school every year. All of his work is public record and can be accessed freely.
Unfortunately, Monsanto donated $25,000 in support of his work through the University he works for. This was unfortunate because anti-GMO activists around the country used this fact to try to prove that there is a conspiracy by Monsanto to manipulate science. To that end, Dr. Folta was smeared in press and on social media. In order to eliminate the distraction which could have caused his work to suffer further, the grant which was initially to be used for his science education and outreach efforts was reallocated to the campus food bank.
When public scientists are attacked for political gain, we all lose. Let's stand up for science and replace the money that should have gone to benefit the budding next generation of scientists.
What We Need &
column2:
What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

We need to raise $25,000 to replace the funds lost.

column1:
The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:
<ul>

• As a a public scientist, Dr. Folta's work is done in service to the whole community. The next generation of scientists need mentors like Dr. Folta to pass on their knowledge, wisdom and ethics. Your donation will play an important role in molding the next generation of scientists who will work to solve the world's big problems
• When our public scientists and educators are bullied for teaching science correctly, we need to stand up and support them. Your donation will help make a powerful statement.
• Please share this campaign far and wide! This campaign is about grassroots support, so the more backers, the better.

What is Solon Soap

We are a high school class of passionate chemistry students. Our school is striving to personalize each students learning experience, which is why our class has chose to personally design and produce a variety of soaps. Along the way we will learn the processes of saponification and the science of smells. Through your donation we will be able to take what we have learned about chemistry and soap and apply it to the real world by planning, producing, and marketing our soaps. We need your help to take our educational experience to the next step. Your donation will not only help our class, but it will benefit the future students of Montpelier for years to come. 

What We Need &
column2:
What You Get

We have moved onto the production phase of our operation but your contribution will help us cover some of the costs we have already incurred. In addition to helping us create amazing soap this year, your donation will help us scale up our operation for future students. We will be able to purchase more soap molds, curing equipment, packaging and shipping materials, and a greater array of ingredients so that we can have more artistic freedom when creating our handmade soaps. Our goal is not to make money in this endeavor but to allow us the funds to enhance our curriculum and allow for greater creativity for years to come. We hope you get as excited as we are about handmade soap that is based in sound chemistry.

column1:
What Happens If We Don't Meet Our Goal

Our backers will still get their soap shipped to them in the same timeline. However, our production in future years will be scaled back and our ability to make the creative and innovative soap we have come to love and share with you may be limited.
Solon Soap

We have moved past the testing phase of our operation and are now on to creating beautiful end products. Below you will find descriptions of a variety of soaps we are offering this year. The photos you see are of the test batches, so the final product may look slightly different. The soap we are offering this year will be a combination of round (roughly 3"" x 1"") and rectangular bars (roughly 3"" x 2.5"" x 1"") in a variety of scents, colors, and designs. We can't wait to share our soap with you!

","What is Solon Soap

We are a high school class of passionate chemistry students. Our school is striving to personalize each students learning experience, which is why our class has chose to personally design and produce a variety of soaps. Along the way we will learn the processes of saponification and the science of smells. Through your donation we will be able to take what we have learned about chemistry and soap and apply it to the real world by planning, producing, and marketing our soaps. We need your help to take our educational experience to the next step. Your donation will not only help our class, but it will benefit the future students of Montpelier for years to come.    What We Need & What You Get We have moved onto the production phase of our operation but your contribution will help us cover some of the costs we have already incurred. In addition to helping us create amazing soap this year, your donation will help us scale up our operation for future students. We will be able to purchase more soap molds, curing equipment, packaging and shipping materials, and a greater array of ingredients so that we can have more artistic freedom when creating our handmade soaps. Our goal is not to make money in this endeavor but to allow us the funds to enhance our curriculum and allow for greater creativity for years to come. We hope you get as excited as we are about handmade soap that is based in sound chemistry.

What Happens If We Don't Meet Our Goal Our backers will still get their soap shipped to them in the same timeline. However, our production in future years will be scaled back and our ability to make the creative and innovative soap we have come to love and share with you may be limited.
Solon Soap

We have moved past the testing phase of our operation and are now on to creating beautiful end products. Below you will find descriptions of a variety of soaps we are offering this year. The photos you see are of the test batches, so the final product may look slightly different. The soap we are offering this year will be a combination of round (roughly 3"" x 1"") and rectangular bars (roughly 3"" x 2.5"" x 1"") in a variety of scents, colors, and designs. We can't wait to share our soap with you!
Circle of Life

This locally made body soap creates a rich lather and is soft. This tan, great smelling rounded bar is just what you need after a long day. It is made out of coconut, palm, and olive oils with a slight scent of milk and honey and has a natural exfoliant of oatmeal.”
Watermelon
The pleasant scent and appearance of fresh watermelon captivates the users, with a hint of poppy seed. This soap will have you coming back for more, who doesn't love watermelon?
Rose Bomb

This locally made soap is perfect for people who just really like the way roses smell. Colored with a light pink to accompany the fragrance, this soap uses a bubbly lather to gently moisturize the skin. This soap uses a luscious blend of olive oil, tallow, coconut oils, and rose oil to achieve this near perfect balance of creamy lather and conditioning properties.
Cocoa Butter Kisses

Cocoa Butter Kisses is a gluten free, low carb vanilla scented soap that guarantees soft, clean hands and an even cleaner conscience knowing that you're buying homemade soap straight from the source. We made this using organic cocoa butter, coconut oil, and olive oil. We designed this soap to have a rich and creamy lather that spreads easily and doesn't leave a residue like other name brand soaps. This soap was made locally in Montpelier, Vermont by the students of Montpelier High School.
Lilac Rose Exfoliating  Soap

Our Lilac Rose Exfoliating Soap smells refreshing, as if you’re standing in a field full of flowers on a warm summer day. Lilac Rose Exfoliating Soap leaves your hands feeling rejuvenated and moisturized with subtle hints of Lilac and Rose. Our soap also has another special feature as well, beautiful poppy seeds. The poppy seeds lightly exfoliate your hands and stimulate blood flow thus making your hands happier and healthier. Our refined formula filled with golden oils, Rose & Lilac, and beautiful poppy seeds work together and create the perfect floral bar.
Chockermint
Chocolate mixed with subtle tones of peppermint, to add a feeling of rejuvenation and relaxation to your day. A strong rich flavor, like a cup of hot cocoa on a cold winter eve.
Feugo De Limon
Feugo De Limon (Lemon Fire) has a cool red color and a strong and amazing lemon smell that stays on your hands after you use it.
Super Style Soap

People call this “the innovative new soap of the 21st century” and “it's a soap straight from heaven's bakery”. Although it was not made with dough it still gives off the scent of a fresh bakery. Not only does it smell pleasant, it feels moisturizing and conditioning. You will not be disappointed. Do not idle when thinking about buying, because you may never have the chance to experience this life changing soap again.
Lilac Meadow

Everyone wants a little sweetness in their life, so for those of you who enjoy the springtime season, you will enjoy a very sweet and springy soap scent. Our soap will leave your skin extra moisturized, so there’s no need to worry about dryness. Our team used four different oils, these oils have reacted with each other to create an extremely bubbly, cleansing, and moisturizing soap
column2: for those of us who like to be bubbly in life.

column1: White Ocean Rain

Made from scratch in our very own MHS building, introducing White Ocean Rain. This soap includes coconut exfoliants that add a texture and exotic feeling while you use it. White Ocean Rain is also capable of forming suds that help clean with ease while you use it. The smell isn’t just appealing, but also makes you smell amazing after each use.Cinnamon Bun

This swirled natural cinnamon bun soap smells like the real thing! Infused with real cinnamon this soap leaves your hands feeling soft and moisturized. Cinnamon bun soap will leave your hands smelling like an actual cinnamon bun without the sticky mess. For those of us who like the sweeter things in life, buy Cinnamon Bun soap!
SheyKa Soap

Want to go on a tropical vacation in your own home? No problem. SheyKa soap is what you need. With a watermelon and pineapple sent, it will take you straight to the Caribbean. Also, having a coconut exfoliant will make your experience even more tropical.
Warm Vanilla & Chocolate Swirl Soap

Our soap is a dual‐sided vegan bar. The rich brown top of the soap smells of chocolate with coffee grounds and coarse sugar for exfoliation. The bottoms is a natural white color that smells of warm vanilla with a few gold flakes to make the soap pop.  For best results, gently rub the exfoliant on your skin to remove dead skin and create a soft surface. Then, rub the conditioning vanilla side onto your skin to moisturize and condition your hands.
Salted Chocolate Strawberry

Olive, coconut, and palm oils combine with the scents of chocolate and strawberry to create a soap that smells good enough to eat and leaves skin feeling soft and clean. A sprinkle of sea salt exfoliates and invigorates the skin while oils soothe and moisturize.",14.0,0,"1 Campaign

Almost a year ago, while discussing the upcoming live podcast at ConVolution 2015, host Kendra and listener Rhawnie volunteered to wear fur bikinis for our reading of Tarnsman Of Gor.  There was much rejoicing.
column5: >Then Ed had to open his big fucking mouth and toss out the idea of ALL OF US wearing fur bikinis during the show. Not ones to let a challenge go unanswered, Matt and Tyler joined the ranks of the furkini volunteers. Since it was his suggestion, Ed also opted in.
column9: >Luckily, there was a holdout.
column13:
>Dan, pillar of decency and good taste, flat out refused to wear a fur bikini...unless there was some money involved.

 So we leave it in your hands, good people. If we can raise $1250 before the show starts at midnight on Oct 3rd, the entire cast will don furkinis and pose for photos with anyone at the show who wants one.

All funds will be donated to Action Against Hunger USA, a global organization committed to ending world hunger.

column2: >Give Boots to those who give Gaza HOPE
column3:
>#EMGAZA8

Biography

EMGAZA team was founded to help Gaza’s disabilities due to the ongoing Israeli blocked and immense humanitarian situation.

We started our humanitarian activities since two years ago, It mainly based on the Gaza Strip delivering medicines, medical equipment, and life-saving materials. We focused on the national clinics, hospitals and NGOs.  We've made 7 missions and all of them met its targets. 

EMGAZA Team consists of 25 volunteers who dedicated their life for Palestine and humanitarian work. They are Pharmacists, doctors, and logisticians. 

EMGAZA's Strategy

BDS

We as a team of EMGAZA adopt BDS (Boycott, Divestment, and Sanction) philosophy by boycotting the Israeli goods and buying instead made in Palestine products. We did/do buy medicines from the Palestinian medical factories – West Bank.

ECONOMY 

By buying the Palestinian products (Medicines),  we will refresh some drug store’s  business as well as improve the Palestinian economy since its affected by Israeli siege and International Aids.

INDEPENDENT

We as a team don’t follow nor endorse any political party. We believe in Palestine and all Palestinians.

To see EMGAZA Ex-Missions click on the link below.
column13:
>Give boots to those who give life HOPE

As Israel’s blockade on Gaza enters its ninth year, warnings about the increasingly dire conditions in Gaza grow louder. The impact of nine years blockade, as well as war, left Gazans with no hope nor life. 

Israel’s siege impacts every aspect of life in Gaza. An entire generation of children suffers from malnutrition-related deficiencies such as stunted growth and anemia — in addition to the psychological trauma incurred as a result of Israel’s military attacks on the Gaza Strip. Most Of Gazan families fled their homes to live in caravans which in fact are not suitable for living. 

Most of these families are in need for the most basic materials such as clothes, food, blankets, medicines, heaters, shoes ....etc.

We choose these areas to focus on families who lost their homes in the last war and live in caravans/tents.

Shout Out: 

Brothers and sisters, Gaza appreciates any effort that can ease life's hardships. Let's gather efforts and be with Gaza's kids. They deserve better life as your kids do. 

If you can't afford we do understand, then please share and shout out our appeal among your beloved ones. 

We believe in you, we believe in the people's power. 

EMGAZA Manager 

Dr.Hani.Siliman.Salamah

Peace Women

Do you often hear good
news stories about Israel?  About the
people who live there, their lives, their choices, their dreams?  I suppose not, because the news you hear
through the general media is mainly about the violence in this part of the
world!
I know, the situation in Israel is
complicated and confusing
column2: each group has its own story. Like Israel’s

column1: Independence Day. For the Jewish population it is a day of joy and happiness,
marked by parties and festivity. For the Arab inhabitants it is one of the
darkest days in their history. Nevertheless, it is possible to spend this day
together, as I witnessed in one of the mixed Hand in Hand schools, where Arab
and Jewish kids learn together and where each class has an Arab as well as a
Jewish teacher.
column4: '>As a journalist who moved to Israel eight

column1: years ago, I discovered a different Israel. For years I have interviewed Jewish,
Arab (Christian as well as Muslim), Druze, Bedouin and Palestinian women. My conclusion: there is much more that unites us
than divides us.
If you do not know me, let me introduce
myself. I have been writing for most of my life,  only in a professional capacity
in the past eight years since I moved to Israel. On a freelance basis, I write
for European newspapers and magazines, mainly human interest stories, because
that hardly gets any attention in the general media.  Israel feels like my homeland. My family always
had a stronger connection than with Holland, and most of our holidays, since I
was very young, were spent here.  I know
the country very well, even better since I moved here.  I write about my life in a weekly blog, and,
together with Esther Voet, director of the Center for Information and
Documentation on Israel, I wrote HotspOTs Israel 2014/2015 (available in eBook
and hard copy), in which we showcased Israel as a hip, hot and trendy country.
On to Peace Women. I want the world to see
what I saw and still see and to be part of it as well.  To feel the joy and positive energies that
these women radiate in their work, not only through words but in photographs as
well.  These women have created initiative’s
that come from their hearts, regardless of their background, religion, color or
history.  That is why I decided to write Peace
Women, a book containing their stories to show the world how these women work together on various levels. In my opinion they are
the real peacemakers in the Middle
East.  Along with the book, there will be
a website, a lively place where all these women can meet and talk and exchange
ideas.
My dream?  To show what is going on in Israel’s everyday
life, beneath the layers of politics, to bring out the personal stories of
caring and cooperation! Once the world knows about them it will, I believe,
begin to change the world and to create a different view of the Middle East. Peace
on a small scale can make a big difference.
column7:
Etty from The Jewish-Arab Center for Peace at Givat Haviva)

The book, which will be available as an eBook

column1: as well as a hardcopy, will be a compilation of the Peace Women’s stories,
pictures, and quotes. It includes interviews with, among others:
·
Sarab Abu-Rabia-Queder, the
first Bedouin woman to graduate from university in Israel, who is very much
involved in the Jewish-Arab school in the south
column3: Sarah Blum, an international law specialist

column1: and member of YaLa Young Leaders Facebook page, where more than 400,000 Arab
and Jewish youngsters meet
founder and former chief curator of the Museum of Bedouin Culture at the Joe
Alon Center for Regional Studies
column5: >(Orna Goren, founder and former chief curator of the Museum of Bedouin Culture at the Joe Alon Center for Regional Studies)

column1: ·
Women from organizations like
Save a Child’s Heart (SACH), Wolfson Medical Center, Holon
Organization)
Circus
column2: The Jewish-Arab Center for Peace at Givat Haviva
column3: Hand in Hand: Center for Jewish-Arab

column1: Education
column4: Sindyanna of Galilee.

column1: &amp
column2:
Yael from WIZO (Women’s International Zionist Organization))

By donating you make their work visible,

column1: allowing the world to see what is really happening here.
To realize my Peace Women dream I need € 30,000.
It is a lot of money, I know, we need this amount for: our publisher, photography,
lay-out, website/platform and translations into English, Hebrew and Arabic. The
diverse audience we hope to reach is what makes this project so unique.
Since the idea for Peace Women came to me
about three years ago, I have often been told that I am naïve and unrealistic.
The more it was said, the more I became convinced that I am on the right track.
Peace Women will be the start of a new process, where optimism and respect for
each other will change the world forever by learning about each other, by
learning and working with each other, by realizing that we cannot live without each
other. Each of these women deserves the Nobel Peace Prize for their courage in
creating a different tomorrow. Join me through your donation, so that we can
bring their stories to the world!
Because I value all donations, not matter the
amount, I will thank each and every one of you on the website. From €50 and more, you'll be the first to receive a copy of the e-book.  There will also be a special acknowledgements page in the
book. If you give €1.000 or more, I would like to offer you a few
possibilities.  Either, when you are in
Israel, I will show you around and introduce you to one of these wonderful
projects, or I can deliver a speech about my book, either via Skype or
‘live’.
Some helpful instructions for funding: You’d like to contribute? Great! Find that big pink button on the
right that says CONTRIBUTE NOW - click it! Below ""How much would you like
to contribute?"", you enter the amount you wish to donate. (The default
amount is €100, but that is just a suggestion from Indiegogo
course, free to donate as much as you like). Enter your email address and click
CONTINUE TO PAYMENT. Click GO TO PAYPAL - don't worry, on PayPal’s site you can
pay with your credit card or PayPal account. If you have a PayPal account, log in
and proceed as usual. If you want to pay with your credit card you click below
on ""Pay with a credit or debit card"". Fill out the required details
et voila! Thank you for your donation!
I would like to introduce you to the
people who help me:
Marijn Schrieken (project manager):
column4: '>I believe that peace is universal, it is

column1: within us.  Peace Women shows us how you
can implement peace in your life, that even in one of the world’s most
complicated regions it is possible to live together, despite the differences in
cultural background, religion, or race. If they can do it, we all can!
Marieke
Timp (freelance photographer): When Joanne asked me
to travel around Israel and take portrait pictures of these amazing women being
interviewed about the work they do, I did not hesitate. The interviews were
conducted in different languages and environments. We went to schools, senior
citizen homes, private homes, out in the olive fields, and more. Women of all
ages and backgrounds, all working for the same purpose, “a peaceful life living
together”. At first I did not understand most of what was said in the
interviews, as they speak mainly Hebrew and Arabic, but the emotions words that
were being spoken with their eyes and hands made me understand.
Cathelijne van de Bercken (graphic
designer): What I love about Peace Women is the
colorful cooperation between women with completely different cultural
backgrounds and religions. Their wonderful work results in peace. As a graphic
designer, I think it is a beautiful challenge to translate this palette of
colorful stories into a visual representation in the form of the design of the
book.
Noortje Giladie-Grootscholten (web
designer): I am part of Peace Women because I
believe that peace in the Middle East (or anywhere for that matter) will only
exist when we can live and let live
column2: when we respect, accept, and open up

column1: we realize that things like looks, religion, and our background really do not
make us more or less (human). The stories told by the Peace Women are a
beautiful illustration of exactly that!
David Israëls (strategic advisor): Peace Women shows us that ethnicity and religion are not barriers
to living with each other: a whole new view of the reality!
","Peace WomenDo you often hear good
news stories about Israel?  About the
people who live there, their lives, their choices, their dreams?  I suppose not, because the news you hear
through the general media is mainly about the violence in this part of the
world!
I know, the situation in Israel is
complicated and confusing
column2: each group has its own story. Like Israel’s

column1: Independence Day. For the Jewish population it is a day of joy and happiness,
marked by parties and festivity. For the Arab inhabitants it is one of the
darkest days in their history. Nevertheless, it is possible to spend this day
together, as I witnessed in one of the mixed Hand in Hand schools, where Arab
and Jewish kids learn together and where each class has an Arab as well as a
Jewish teacher.As a journalist who moved to Israel eight
years ago, I discovered a different Israel. For years I have interviewed Jewish,
Arab (Christian as well as Muslim), Druze, Bedouin and Palestinian women. My conclusion: there is much more that unites us
than divides us.(Joanne Nihom)
If you do not know me, let me introduce
myself. I have been writing for most of my life,  only in a professional capacity
in the past eight years since I moved to Israel. On a freelance basis, I write
for European newspapers and magazines, mainly human interest stories, because
that hardly gets any attention in the general media.  Israel feels like my homeland. My family always
had a stronger connection than with Holland, and most of our holidays, since I
was very young, were spent here.  I know
the country very well, even better since I moved here.  I write about my life in a weekly blog, and,
together with Esther Voet, director of the Center for Information and
Documentation on Israel, I wrote HotspOTs Israel 2014/2015 (available in eBook
and hard copy), in which we showcased Israel as a hip, hot and trendy country.
On to Peace Women. I want the world to see
what I saw and still see and to be part of it as well.  To feel the joy and positive energies that
these women radiate in their work, not only through words but in photographs as
well.  These women have created initiative’s
that come from their hearts, regardless of their background, religion, color or
history.  That is why I decided to write Peace
Women, a book containing their stories to show the world how these women work together on various levels. In my opinion they are
the real peacemakers in the Middle
East.  Along with the book, there will be
a website, a lively place where all these women can meet and talk and exchange
ideas.
My dream?  To show what is going on in Israel’s everyday
life, beneath the layers of politics, to bring out the personal stories of
caring and cooperation! Once the world knows about them it will, I believe,
begin to change the world and to create a different view of the Middle East. Peace
on a small scale can make a big difference.  (Fauzia & Etty from The Jewish-Arab Center for Peace at Givat Haviva)The book, which will be available as an eBook
as well as a hardcopy, will be a compilation of the Peace Women’s stories,
pictures, and quotes. It includes interviews with, among others:
Sarab Abu-Rabia-Queder, the
first Bedouin woman to graduate from university in Israel, who is very much
involved in the Jewish-Arab school in the south
column3: Sarah Blum, an international law specialist

column1: and member of YaLa Young Leaders Facebook page, where more than 400,000 Arab
and Jewish youngsters meet
founder and former chief curator of the Museum of Bedouin Culture at the Joe
Alon Center for Regional Studies
column2: (Orna Goren, founder and former chief curator of the Museum of Bedouin Culture at the Joe Alon Center for Regional Studies)

column1: Women from organizations like
Save a Child’s Heart (SACH), Wolfson Medical Center, Holon
Organization)
Circus
column2: The Jewish-Arab Center for Peace at Givat Haviva
column3: Hand in Hand: Center for Jewish-Arab

column1: Education
& Yael from WIZO (Women’s International Zionist Organization))By donating you make their work visible,
allowing the world to see what is really happening here.
To realize my Peace Women dream I need € 30,000.
It is a lot of money, I know, we need this amount for: our publisher, photography,
lay-out, website/platform and translations into English, Hebrew and Arabic. The
diverse audience we hope to reach is what makes this project so unique.
Since the idea for Peace Women came to me
about three years ago, I have often been told that I am naïve and unrealistic.
The more it was said, the more I became convinced that I am on the right track.
Peace Women will be the start of a new process, where optimism and respect for
each other will change the world forever by learning about each other, by
learning and working with each other, by realizing that we cannot live without each
other. Each of these women deserves the Nobel Peace Prize for their courage in
creating a different tomorrow. Join me through your donation, so that we can
bring their stories to the world!
Because I value all donations, not matter the
amount, I will thank each and every one of you on the website. From €50 and more, you'll be the first to receive a copy of the e-book.  There will also be a special acknowledgements page in the
book. If you give €1.000 or more, I would like to offer you a few
possibilities.  Either, when you are in
Israel, I will show you around and introduce you to one of these wonderful
projects, or I can deliver a speech about my book, either via Skype or
‘live’.
Some helpful instructions for funding: You’d like to contribute? Great! Find that big pink button on the
right that says CONTRIBUTE NOW - click it! Below ""How much would you like
to contribute?"", you enter the amount you wish to donate. (The default
amount is €100, but that is just a suggestion from Indiegogo
course, free to donate as much as you like). Enter your email address and click
CONTINUE TO PAYMENT. Click GO TO PAYPAL - don't worry, on PayPal’s site you can
pay with your credit card or PayPal account. If you have a PayPal account, log in
and proceed as usual. If you want to pay with your credit card you click below
on ""Pay with a credit or debit card"". Fill out the required details
et voila! Thank you for your donation!
I would like to introduce you to the
people who help me:
Marijn Schrieken (project manager):I believe that peace is universal, it is
within us.  Peace Women shows us how you
can implement peace in your life, that even in one of the world’s most
complicated regions it is possible to live together, despite the differences in
cultural background, religion, or race. If they can do it, we all can!
Marieke
Timp (freelance photographer): When Joanne asked me
to travel around Israel and take portrait pictures of these amazing women being
interviewed about the work they do, I did not hesitate. The interviews were
conducted in different languages and environments. We went to schools, senior
citizen homes, private homes, out in the olive fields, and more. Women of all
ages and backgrounds, all working for the same purpose, “a peaceful life living
together”. At first I did not understand most of what was said in the
interviews, as they speak mainly Hebrew and Arabic, but the emotions words that
were being spoken with their eyes and hands made me understand.
Cathelijne van de Bercken (graphic
designer): What I love about Peace Women is the
colorful cooperation between women with completely different cultural
backgrounds and religions. Their wonderful work results in peace. As a graphic
designer, I think it is a beautiful challenge to translate this palette of
colorful stories into a visual representation in the form of the design of the
book.
Noortje Giladie-Grootscholten (web
designer): I am part of Peace Women because I
believe that peace in the Middle East (or anywhere for that matter) will only
exist when we can live and let live

I will be helping the researchers of Operation Wallacea in the forest of Calakamul and the reefs of Akumal in Mexico to gather data and apply for funding to protect these rich and important areas of land from deforestation and hunting. I need your help to fulfill my dream of travelling to Mexico to help save the forests and reefs! 

I'm planning to join Operation Wallacea's research project in the summer of 2015 to help measure crucial data in order to preserve the Calakamul forest's biodiversity and ensure that the water waste from Akumal's growing population won't harm the reefs and aquatic species living in the area. 

In order to get there I need to raise at least £2400 to cover the project and travel costs. To raise these funds, I will be doing various activities and events throughout the coming year to help reach this goal. Any donation, however small, will be greatly appreciated!
