Background

AVEC
International is non- governmental organisation and a charitable Organisation.
With its head office in Kampala, St. Apollo Kivebulaya Church of Uganda,

Kitebi, Lubaga Division.                                                                          

It
was started in April 2013 by a group of Social Workers with a defined social
work principle of restoring the social functioning and seeks to improve the

quality of life and wellbeing of individuals, groups and communities.                             

Our Mission: is to wholly
transform the lives of elderly people and vulnerable children in societies in,

but not limited to Uganda.                                             

Our Vision: To improve the
quality of life of elderly people and vulnerable children by providing
integrated family care and community based services to enable them become self

reliant and productive members of society both economically and socially.                                                                                                           

Our core values are:-                                                                                                     i)

Team work                                                                                                                 ii) Transparency: and

iii) Accountability

 iv)

Integrity

  • We are dealing with the vulnerable elderly and children aiming at uplifting there status this is because we have identified  gaps that exist and need to be filled,we are therefore working towards transforming the lives of these groups for them to become self reliant and boost their self esteem in their respective communities.The  Campaign is important to us, because our senior citizens (elderly) have lost hope and we work towards restoring what has been lost and for the children, they are the future generation when they get a good foundation they will make a better tomorrow for themselves and the community at large.
  • The contributors will help us reach 33%of the targeted number as per now.

what we need.

we need USD 25000 for this financial year and this is to cater for the following
• Basic needs
• Children scholarships
• Scholastic materials
• Trainings
• Water and Sanitation
• Health education and services
• environmental conservation

If we fail to attain the goal, the funds will go to basic needs and scholastic materials (minus the administrative costs of indiegogo)

The Impact
• The elderly and children will gain self esteem.
• There will be an improved standard of living.
• There will more productivity and self reliance.
• You can check us out on our facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/AvecInternational?hc_l...

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can’t contribute, it doesn’t mean you can’t help:
<ul>
• Please get the word out about our campaign.
• Retweet fundraising and support posts on twitter @avecinternation
• Check out our twitter page: www.twitter.com/AVECinternation
• Like our facebook page: www.facebook.com/AvecInternational
• Visit our website: www.avecinternational.wix.com/avec

Thanks for taking the time to checkout and support the work we've been doing.

Thinking green

HELP US BUILD A HYDROPONIC FARM IN AN URBAN CLASSROOM TO TEACH GRADE SCHOOL KIDS ABOUT ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE.
The PS 199 Science Center is a 1571 square-foot greenhouse
classroom in a public school in New York City, implementing a hands-on, project-based science curriculum that connects urban agriculture
to large science concepts.  It would dramatically enhance the school’s hands-on approach to environmental education
by providing students with an understanding of pressing environmental
problems and the tools to find creative solutions to them.

Why is the PS 199 Science Center vital?

Bridging the gap between the city and the farm, students will stand at the leading-edge of science and innovation: growing food with their own hands and tangibly learning about nutrition, water resource management, efficient land use, climate change, biodiversity, conservation, pollution, waste management and sustainable development.

This innovative way of learning science is particularly effective for exploring modern-day issues of global concern. Water resource management, climate change, biodiversity, conservation, contamination, pollution, waste management, efficient land/rooftop use, food production and nutrition are topics covered within the classroom.

Our students today live with the reality of unsustainable urban population growth. Understanding the relationships between culture, the environment, and sustainable development is a key component of their education.

What We Need &
PS 199 Science Center would include solar panels, hydroponic and aquaponic
growing systems, a rainwater catchment system, composting, and weather
stations.  <span> This urban
farm and environmental science laboratory will encourage our children to
embrace science by providing lessons in science and sustainability,
organic growing, responsible agriculture, and the vital connection between

plant growth, health and nutrition.

We have raised at least 50% construction funding to date and we are currently raising a minimum of $20,000 for the architectural and engineering design phase which includes drawings and the technical systems outlined above. If we are unable to raise sufficient funds to construct the science center, donations received will be used to support the science curriculum at PS 199.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute at this time, we could still use your help:
• Tell your friends and colleagues about the PS 199 Science Center by sharing our campaign on social media or email. You can use the Indiegogo share tools and links to help.
• Introduce us to people who are interested in greenhouses, vegetables, or STEM education.
• Please help get the word out about our campaign and make some noise for our Science Center and STEM!

The ""Will Be"" Sculpture Project

This fantastic project was born from artist Bridget Beck, who wants to give back to her native north Rapid City community.  Bridget is gifting the sculpture, which was created in collaboration with teens from Rapid City and Los Angeles, to the Rapid City Parks Department to be placed at the newly constructed Willow Park in North Rapid City. The project and the park are a creation by the youth of Rapid City.  Their experiences in creating this project gives them a sense of self-confidence, positive self-esteem and community involvement.  Click here to listen to a story on South Dakota Public Radio to learn more about this project, and hear from the kids themselves!

We are seeking $1,000 for transportation and installation costs for the sculpture from UCLA to Rapid City (Bridget has already raised part of the transportation costs), along with $1,000 to be gifted for projects with Rapid City youth in collaboration with ProjectRespect.Org which provides summer workshops with low-income youth to help promote healthy relationships and positive self esteem.  Click on the above highlighted links to learn more about the sculpture project, Willow Park and ProjectRespect! 

Thank you for your  contribution to this amazing project!

column12:
>Introductions!

My name is Natalia Jackson and as an educator, I build whole child curriculum for individual students, to get them closer to their long term goal. After teaching in the NYC public school system for many years and overseas, I have strongly grown to feel that I will make more of a difference using my talents in a specialized way.

Over the span of my 14 year career, I found in my research that students in different settings learn different things, even if they are using the same materials. This is due to the manner of how they are taught to use them. Early childhood education is essential to future success and I feel that it is important to expose children to ways of using materials that deliberately promote critical thinking, logic and organizational skills as early as possible. Via recommendations and word of mouth, I began working with one child and over the course of 4 terms I've helped 15 children. 

I am so thrilled and my dream is to one day direct the entire early childhood public school system - with the goal to make every student, potentially competitive enough to have a chance at the best schools in the city. 

Of course that is a lofty dream, and right now I have a lot of work to do!

The magnitude of your contribution would expose more children to ways of exercising their critical thinking, logic practice and executive function. I am in the process of securing 2 schools in a collaborative partnership, as a visiting curriculum consultant. I will work with children, who it seems would best benefit from the additional stimulation, in small groups. 

Early Prep Plus, with more marketing and abundant materials can serve a more diverse population. In time, more great teachers can get involved and learn the curriculum to follow through with this movement.  You can be a huge part of promoting academic excellence in diverse settings.

All children with support and guidance can achieve so much! I can help them with your support.


What We Need &
column16: >Early Prep Plus needs approximately $40,000 to carry on for the next 2 school years.
column19: >This campaign is just for $19,950 with the hope of going over!
column22: >This is the amount that you can have such an integral part in building!
column25: >Rather than asking for 3 years for covering expenses as most start ups do, I'm asking for funds for specific needs!

• Books, supplies, media subscriptions annual: *$3000
• Professional development. Staying abreast of current and cutting edge education programs (1 to 2 classes annual): *$4550
<li>Fees accrued from Paypal &amp
• Other day to day expenditures that go with running a freelance business are proudly all my own. This is a wonderful adventure!

• As a perk, you can choose to have your name or company name posted on the Early Prep Plus site as an appreciated supporter, receive artwork, have an assessment performed on a new student, get a shout out on Facebook and/or enjoy some Starbucks coffee!
• And It's Also My Birthday Wish!!!!
• Thank you!!
• (* Approximate)

The Impact

Ages 3 - 9 are the crucial years for so much opportunity! 

Every moment of their day counts. You can make a difference in making sure that precious time in a student's life is constructive, productive and enjoyed!

New York City's Education system is extremely competitive. Your contribution helps lessen the gap between opportunity and achievement for diverse groups of children. 

  • The program has grown from one child to 15 children, all working with me individually in

the space of four terms. This coming school year, with the addition of small groups, I forecast consistent and significant expansion. Students lessons and strong parental involvement combined with the sharing of ideas within communities can be extremely powerful in shifting and growing the likelihood of excellence.

  • Some
students focus on logic skills specifically for school admissions. Other
students work on honing skills they already possess and on specified academic
subjects to excel and to keep themselves challenged. All of my academic
students are now working on at least a full year ahead of their grade level. The students
working on school admissions have qualified for top tier schools, both public
and private - scoring an average thus far of 97% on admissions standardized tests.
• Opportunity
and exposure for developing young citizens are the main motivators behind

this program. A consulting component and presence in lower income public schools could really help diversify well performing and specialized schools in the city. It will also provide exposure and inspiration to schools, which may not be using all of their resources. You would be a huge part of this transformation!

• Your contribution will help provide materials to develop specific and precise academic behaviors and abilities in a diverse population of students. It will provide scholarship opportunities for middle and lower income students, provide additional assessments to develop top quality individualized lesson planning and, as always, an on-site environment that is stimulating, welcoming and productive.

•  All children have so much potential! Developing an environment where the parents and schools support the students to stretch the limits of their personal ability is key to creating a culture of excellence and achievement in any setting. You would be a part of such a specific, wonderful and forward reaching movement. Thank you!!
Other Ways You Can Help
• Get the word out about this campaign and the push towards academic excellence!
• Share and promote as much as you can!
• And don't forget, we ALWAYS welcome more books, supplies and of course STUDENTS!!

Thank you!!

students work on honing skills they already possess and on specified academic
subjects to excel and to keep themselves challenged. All of my academic
students are now working on at least a full year ahead of their grade level. The students
working on school admissions have qualified for top tier schools, both public
and private - scoring an average thus far of 97% on admissions standardized tests.
Opportunity
and exposure for developing young citizens are the main motivators behind

this program. A consulting component and presence in lower income public schools could really help diversify well performing and specialized schools in the city. It will also provide exposure and inspiration to schools, which may not be using all of their resources. You would be a huge part of this transformation!

Your contribution will help provide materials to develop specific and precise academic behaviors and abilities in a diverse population of students. It will provide scholarship opportunities for middle and lower income students, provide additional assessments to develop top quality individualized lesson planning and, as always, an on-site environment that is stimulating, welcoming and productive.

All children have so much potential! Developing an environment where the parents and schools support the students to stretch the limits of their personal ability is key to creating a culture of excellence and achievement in any setting. You would be a part of such a specific, wonderful and forward reaching movement. Thank you!!
Other Ways You Can Help
Get the word out about this campaign and the push towards academic excellence!
Share and promote as much as you can!
And don't forget, we ALWAYS welcome more books, supplies and of course STUDENTS!!
Thank you!!",3.0,0,"3 Campaigns
|","NY, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/early-prep-plus-goes-to-the-student-contribute-because-your-gift-really-counts/pica
0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""><div>
My Campaign

My name is Christian Kettenbeil, and I have been making ""movies"" since I was 10 years old. I started out playing with my parents old camcorder, and soon earned enough money to get my own. Since then, my interest and love for anything having to do with film has skyrocketed, and I'm sure that is what I want to do in life.

Now that I am 17, college is looming on the horizon, and this summer is an extremely important time for me to make decisions, and start planning for when I graduate. I have had my heart set on USC's School of Cinematic Arts for a while now, and finally decided that this year I would plan my visit to really get a feel of what I can expect from life as a USC student. There is only one problem that is stopping me from achieving this dream, and that is: I have no money to make my visit.

Living more than 2000 miles away from my destination makes my visit more costly than most, and I need help funding it. Just a few months ago my Dad became unemployed for the second time in 2 years, and right around the same time, he was diagnosed with Colon Cancer, and now his medical bills are starting to pile up. My mother works almost everyday of the week to try and cover the expenses that are involved with just keeping a roof over my family's heads, and my college education is at the bottom of the list for things they are able to spend money on right now.
The start of my dream, and possibly my whole career, depends on if I can raise enough money to fund my visit in August, and you can help me :)
<div>
What do I need this money for? And what am I doing to earn it?

If you travel you know how expensive things can get, and it seems as though the expenses never end. I'm in that situation. I have figured out the total for the essentials for my visit, which includes my round-trip flight, my stay in Los Angeles, and a car for my stay. I have researched the cheapest means of travel, and came to the harsh realization that I'm going to need at least $2500 to cover all of my expenses, and thats why I turned to fundraising as a means of reaching my goal.

I currently work at least 24 hours a week at my normal job, and complete side jobs in order to save some money for my visit. In addition to my online fundraising, I am going to be doing many can and bottle drives throughout my area to raise a little bit more money. I am also a straight 'A' student, and excell in the classroom. I'm relying on my grades to help me pay for college, in the form of scholarships. I am willing to do whatever it takes so that I can make my dream of attending USC a reality, and I'm hoping you can help me achieve that :)
<div>
The Impact

By donating money to my campaign you are helping me take the firsts steps to what will be the rest of my life. This trip is just the beginning and with this my dream of becoming a director can become a reality. In helping me, you will be paving the pathway for my future
column2: my aspirations and my possible career will become obtainable thanks to you. :)

column1: <div>
You're unable to donate money, but you can still help :)
I know many people have been facing financial hardships in recent years, and I completely understand if you are unable to donate money. But you can still help me for FREE :)
Here are some ways you can help me out:
<ul>
<li>
Facebook: Post this campaign, and promote it
<li>
Twitter: Tweet about my campaign, and get it trending
<li>
Email: Send an email out to all of your friends, and let them know about my campaign
<li>
Youtube: Make a video about my campaign, and I'll post it on this page
<li>
Word of Mouth: Tell everyone you know about my cause, maybe they'll keep it going

0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""><div>

Hello, my name is Trevor W Goodchild aka Syllable, a teacher from Austin, Texas, currently attending the University of Texas for a Geography degree.  I also am a conscious hip hop artist called Syllable, and use hip hop as a vehicle of positive social change.
Campaign:

My Geography degree is being defunded 2 semesters short of graduation, and i would love to not have to work at McDonalds with thousands in loan i can't pay back without a degree, so please help me raise the money to pay for a degree that will help me protect biodiversity, promote sustainability and do real work to make the world a better place.
<div>
Break it down for folks in more detail:
<div>

After making it off the streets as a homeless youth, against all odds into the Unversity of Texas, due to a new law in 2011 the Consolidated Appropriations Act, it is ironic now my future is threatened.  Pell Grant funding was cut from 18 to 12 semesters due to the Consolidated Appropriations Act, now my pell grant is 0, and I've reached the lifetime limit for unsubsidized and subsidized loans.  This means i am out of funding to complete the 120 hours of in residency hours UT requires for graduation.  This puts a chink into the whole plan for my life, career, music, and altruistic pursuits.

I am $15000 short of graduation.  Tuition is $5000 for a College of Liberal Arts major, textbooks at least $300 if not more, and living expenses of $900 rent, $100 electric bills, $50 phone bills.  Each semester is 5 months long.  Thats $10,000 just for living expenses, but i am teaching at AISD to alleviate this, though the pay is low for a teacher in Texas that is substitute teaching.  $20,000 (living expenses plus $5k for 2 semesters tuition) would cover it all, but i am only aiming for $15,000 because, honestly, it's hard for me to believe any of this will work, but i'm keeping my fingers crossed praying for a miracle.

I am a conscious hip hop artist and have done benefits for poets in jail, The Off Center with Rude Mechanicals, shows raising money to train seeing eye dogs for blind people, and rapped at Austin Community College's 36th anniversery.  Hip hop with a message like the Roots, similar to Bob Dylan, if he rapped lol, i educate and mobilize listeners to vote in local elections, recycle, take care of our kids better and make the world a better place through thoughtful participation in local communities everywhere.

Having had such a hardknock life, my heart opens extra big for anyone going thru adversity and by supporting me getting a degree you are helping countless people that i will help through my journey to live, love, and be the most compassionate human being possible with everything i do.

If i don't reach my goal, the money that i raise will go towards a vocational training, in a trade school, or apprentice under a master at a certain craft in order to have a skill that will put food on the table for my family, and secure a stable future.
<div>
The Impact

I have used my time on Earth to volunteer teaching children to juggle, speaking at City Hall on behalf of unarmed minorities shot and killed by Austin Police Department (Jessie Owens, Daniel Rocha, Sophia King, Nathaniel Sanders Jr etc), Human Rights Commission, State Capital and so on. I have also volunteered at Casa Marianella, a homeless shelter for immigrants, cleaning, electrical, donations, folding dresses with bullet holes and blood stains from crossing the Texas-Mexico border. Real life stuff that isn't a media blitz but human beings hurting and benefiting from any help I'm glad to give.  I've been super involved in Austin's community to improve the conditions we live in and quality of life for the kids the improverished, and anyone going thru hard times like life has a soundtrack listening to When Doves Cry.

I am working class, below the poverty line, but i have a huge vision on how I will use a Geography degree to build a better world through traveling for geographic jobs, networking with nonprofits to connect resources to those in need, to supporting local businesses, and creating outreach programs for homeless youth.  But, it starts with getting a Geography degree, i want to go to Berkely for grad school but that doesn't seem likely now.  Perhaps with your help i can still work for National Geographic or another nature magazine that uses photography to raise awareness to help indigenous communities after getting a BA in Geography.  Anything helps, thank you!
<div>
Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the awareness of my situation to any and all people that are humanitarians, that care about permaculture, Noam Chomsky, Howard Zinn, Zeitgiest, sustainability, Education, hip hop with a message, and anyone who may be able to connect the 6 degrees of separation between myself and a source of funding to help me help make this world an even more wonderful place to live.

This is a unique inspirational trip for me to visit Lithuania, Belarus and Poland. It's designed for those wishing to visit their roots and travel through the exciting world of pre-war Europe. It will awaken us to the world that although physically may be gone, but is spiritually still alive and strong.

","******** Please Share With Family & Friends! ********Share with your Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn & Pinterest!

*************** About The Trip **********************This is a unique inspirational trip for me to visit Lithuania, Belarus and Poland. It's designed for those wishing to visit their roots and travel through the exciting world of pre-war Europe. It will awaken us to the world that although physically may be gone, but is spiritually still alive and strong.Here YOU have an unique opportunity to make a major impact on **MY** life FOREVER!!  From an eye-opening experience to better grasp & understand what Jewish life was before. The Mesiros Nefesh people had for Torah & Yiddishkeit, the Emunah that was instilled in them. Seeing how terrible antisemitism was, how they wanted to wipe out all the Jews out entirely & B""H 60-70 years later I'm learning in Yeshivah in Eretz Yisroel defying what they wanted to do to us! This inspiration makes living as a Jew much more personal, faithful & meaningful w/ a deeper determination to flourish which will in essence make a deeper, more meaningful, enriched commitment to Torah observance & Yiddishkeit.Thanks!Best Regards, Michoel

- Daven by the Kevarim of R Chaim Brisker, the Netziv and the Chemdas Shlomo. - R. Yitzchok Elchonon Spector, the Vilna Goan and Rav Chaim Ozer.  Continue to Radin, see the Yeshiva and daven at the Kever of the Chafetz Chaim. - Daven by the Kever of R. Chaim Volozhiner. Travel to Mir and see the Yeshiva building and daven at the Kever of Rav Yeruchum Leibowitz. Travel to Brisk and daven at the Kever of the Beis HaLevi. - Go to the Majdanek concentration camp. Daven by the kevarim of the Chozeh M'Lublin, R. Shachna and the Maharshal. - Full Shabbos schedule in the Yeshivas Chochmei Lublin. Motzei Shabbos travel to Lizhensk for special Melave Malka at the Noam Elimelech. -Daven at the kevarim of the Remah, Bach, Tosefos Yom Tov. -Visit Auschwitz – Birkenau.
If the funding goal isn't entirely or almost funded your generous donation will be donated to a Tedaka of our choice.  Thank you for your support!",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

column4: >Zelosport Introduces New Sport and Competition to the Nation Advocating the Welfare of Families and Children!!!

column1:
Spud Alford, founder and CEO of the parent company, Zelosport, stated that ""the National Finger Football League is off and running so it was just a natural progression to involve Finger Football fans nationwide.  I would guess that 95% of America’s population has at some time flicked a piece of paper or a pack of sugar across a table, whether in a lunchroom or a restaurant setting, hoping to score a touchdown by skillfully causing the object to rest with one portion of it hanging over the table’s edge. We simply took the concept to a whole new level.”

With the formation of the National Finger Football League, according to Spud, “It is the only national competition to my knowledge where a child, a parent and a grandparent in the same family and of either gender can compete together with an equal chance at winning.”

<h3><em><strong>Zelosport is a huge advocate of the family. But even more so, the company advocates the care of children with three main issues in mind: NO kid should ever leave his or her house in fear of being bullied
column2: No kid should ever go to bed hungry
column3: and EVERY kid deserves the right to be loved. The National Finger Football League will reach out to those kids across this country and identify them and make a place for them in a fun and wholesome environment. Your participation will make that a reality.

column1:
A 12 city tour is projected to begin in the Fall 2013, with a test tour already held in 2011 - 2012 to work out the bugs. The tour was sponsored by the great folks at White Castle and although White Castle will not be involved going forward, Zelosport and the NFFL are growing and establishing a player roster that will sustain the Finger Football Championship for generations to come.

With a recent study showing that one of the things young people prefer to do most is spend time with their family (including video games), Zelosport will create an environment that is wholesome and fun allowing sports enthusiasts a chance to compete with and against their own family members. Tanner Childs, a 17 year old from Columbus, Ga. who competed in and won a local Finger Football tournament held in 2006 when he was just 11 said “I made it all the way to the finals and wound up competing against my 47 year old uncle. And I beat him!” Tanner added, “It’s just a great way to spend a Saturday. Everyone was competing as though we were on national television.”
Projected Schedule - The National Finger Football League 2013
Date                               Prize: 1st place            Location

October 5, 2013                    $2500.                    Columbus, Georgia
October 12, 2013                    ""                            Atlanta, Georgia
October 19, 2013                    ""                            Birmingham, Alabama
October 26, 2013                    ""                            Huntsville, Alabama
November 2, 2013                  ""                             Louisville, Kentucky
November 9, 2013                  ""                             Columbia, SC
November 16, 2013                ""                             Charlotte, NC
November 23, 2013                ""                             Nashville, TN
November 30, 2013                ""                             Baton Rouge, LA
December 7, 2013                  ""                             Dallas, TX
December 14, 2013                ""                             Austin, TX
December 21, 2013                ""                             San Angelo, TX
January 25, 2014  Nat'l Champ'ship  $10,000    Columbus, Georgia

Throughout the entire tour, a documentary will be being filmed telling the story of the evolution of the simple but iconic paper football concept played by millions and how it has evolved into a national competition. Players and spectators will be interviewed across he country and lots of tournament footage will be filmed.

Spud, the inventor of the games, is actually a former U.S. Olympic hopeful in the 10 event decathlon. His vision was to create games that families can play together in their kitchens and living rooms while building lasting memories. Now he wants your help to create a national tour where families and friends can compete!!

A survivor of testicular cancer, Spud speaks nationally to young people about living a life of faith and with courage. 

For more information on the company and the NFFL, contact Zelosport or Spud Alford at spud@zelosport.com or by telephone at 706.888.6065.

Google Glass and I: Changing Performance for the Better

Google has an amazing idea. Why not take the technology that so often distracts us and detracts from our experiences and put it closer to our actual senses? Oddly enough, this change in proximity has a way of making experiences more human and less distracted.
So where do I come in? I've been invited to be a Google Glass Explorer! I can purchase Google Glass early because I had a use case idea Google liked. Check it out for yourself!

If you know me, you know I'm a performer. I'm a born musician, and I love poetry. I see the combination of Google Glass and performance as an unstoppable artistic vehicle. I'm also an engineer, and in my attempt to smash those two disciplines together, I want to use Google Glass! Help me make art with technology!
<div>
The Details
What I need? $1500 for the device. If I receive any more funds, they will go to my trip to LA to pick it up. Any remaining funds will go towards future engineering/art projects I develop.
<div>
Other Ways You Can Help
Know somone who works for an airline? I need a plane ticket!
Want to help me experiment with Google Glass? Have artistic or technical abilities? I'm looking for project partners!

(English, German, French, Spanish and Portuguese text below)

Nel novembre 2013 ho dato vita a un progetto di lavoro che per ora è ancora cucciolo, si chiama HIMBAROSSA.
Due anni fa ho cominciato a usare la tecnica della cera-persa per realizzare gioielli in argento e bronzo, contemporaneamente ho iniziato a lavorare l'ebano e ho creato alcuni gioielli in argento ed ebano o bronzo ed ebano. Il tutto anche grazie al sostegno di un maestro orafo che si chiama Tito Livio Negri.
A settembre del 2013 sono andata a Murano a studiare le basi della tecnica di lavoro del vetro al lume, col maestro Davide Penso, possibilità che mi è stata data grazie ad un munifico regalo di compleanno. (Per capire di che si tratta quardate questo mio video.)
Così, unendo queste conoscenze ho avviato un piccolo sogno, quello di poter creare gioielli utilizzando più tecniche e sfruttando più materiali insieme. Ma, ma... mi mancano ancora almeno due esperienze di base: la forgiatura dei metalli e la manipolazione delle resine polimeriche.

Per la forgiatura dei metalli ho scelto una artista che fa cose molto belle, lei è Italiana e si Chiama Alessia Spalma e ha un sito che si chiama Bead and Tricks. Voglio andare a Cormano (vicino Milano), a fare un corso da lei full immersion un giorno intero se non due.

Per il Polymer Clay, in Italia non abbiamo artisti di livello.
A settembre, a  Praga ci sarà un mega convegno con workshop di Melanie West (che trovo superlativa), Melanie Muir e Christine Dumont. Ecco, il mio obiettivo è fare il corso per la lavorazione del metallo a marzo-aprile e quello sul polymer clay a settembre, così da poter realizzare pezzi ancora più belli per il prossimo Natale.

E adesso un po' di biechi conti.

Per poter fare tutto questo, e acquistare alcuni strumenti del mestiere, ho calcolato che mi serviranno almeno 2000 euro.
Ora: la piattaforma  su cui si appoggia questa campagna trattiene per sé UN SACCO di soldi, soprattutto se NON raggiungo l'obiettivo! Assurdo. In una loro pagina dicono che trattengono il 4% per chi raggiunge il goal e il 9% per chi non lo raggiunge, invece a conti fatti (ti dicono la cifra finale appena stabilisci il tuo goal) trattengono il 7% non il 4%!!!
Non si sa quanto prendono a chi non lo raggiunge ma temo non sia meno del 14-15%.
Una bella invenzione 'ste piattaforme di crowdfunding eh? Non fanno niente e guadagnano come un usuraio! viva la tecnologia!
Quindi ho fissato il tetto massimo del mio budget a 2500 euro, così se proprio trovo tante persone a darmi sostegno forse a 2000 euro reali ci posso arrivare. Speriamo anche di più!
Ho dovuto fissare una scadenza alla raccolta donazioni, anche questo è un vincolo imposto dalla piattaforma. In ogni caso per Praga devo prenotare già a fine febbraio quindi il prima possibile mi serve sapere se posso andare o no. Se vi viene l'urgenza di donare (anche) dopo la data di scadenza, o brevi manu anziché usare paypal, scrivetemi in privato! :-)

Se finanzierete questo mio progetto, ne vedrete i frutti entro Natale 2014. Ovviamente, nel più puro spirito di trasparenza, rendiconterò le mie spese relative a questo progetto tenendo un diario sulla mia pagina HIMBAROSSA su facebook.

L'happy ending.

Se vi va di sostenere la mia crescita e lo sviluppo del progetto Himbarossa, versate direttamente da qui il vostro contributo. Non serve avere un conto paypal, basta una carta di credito o una postepay. Grazie!
Se avete suggerimenti, domande, curiosità, parole di incoraggiamento, proposte di collaborazione et similia, scrivetemi a himba chiocciola sbrocca punto com.

IMPORTANTISSIMO: passate parola!
Inoltre, se conoscete le basi di un'altra lingua (Francese, Spagnolo, Arabo, Chinese, Russo, ecc.) e vi va di aiutarmi a tradurre questo testo per poter diffondere la campagna in giro per il mondo vi vorrò ancora più bene!

Per vedere il video di presentazione di questa campagna e vedere chi sono
cliccate qui https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PzQts9Jd3X4.


--------------------------------------------------------------


Himbarossa wants to improve!

In November 2013 I started my own project called Himbarossa, it's something in between art and crafts and it's still almost a newborn.
Actually it all began two years ago, when I started learnig the lost-wax technique from my Master Tito Livio Negri, a well-known jewel maker of Rome. At the same time I started working ebony, a wood I just adore playing with, an soon I created jewels in Sterling Silver, Ebony and other materials, dedicated to my closest friends.

Last September, thanks to a very generous birthday gift I went to Murano (Venice) to attend a full immersion workshop held by Davide Penso on glass beads making.
It was love at first bead. To see how I make them watch this video.
Then I started experimenting, creating jewels made with glass, Silver and also ebony.
And I was extremely happy, my friends told me to take it more seriously and so I did.

Here we are... before going back to Murano to attend the intermediate-advanced course, there are two other materials I want to start working with: copper and polymer clay. This is what this campaign is about: LEARNING!
I need funds to attend classes and workshops: one in Milan, where Alessia Spalma (see her blog Beads and tricks) teaches fold-forming techniques, and the other in Prague, where there will be Melanie West (I absolutely love her work!) plus Melanie Muir and Christine Dumont.
The Prague event will be in September 2014 but I need to book at the end of February.

I've estimated I'll need approximately 2,000 euros to be able to attend these courses and maybe buy the basic tools I'll need for working.
I set my goal at 2,500 since indiegogo will take an heavy commission on my campaign if I succeed, and even heavier if I do not. Nonsense!

I hope you will sustain my project supporting me with a donation, If you also want to buy the fruit of this learning process, you are more than welcome and I will be more than happy to apply from 15 to 20% off the prices (for donations over 100 euros, a free creation of my choice for donation of 250 euros or more, a custom made creation - designed by me for the person who donated or someone he/she will give the jewel to - for donations over 500 euros or more).

Please feel free to write at himba (at) sbrocca (dot) com for any question, advice, warm encouragement, or if you want to buy and/or trade my jewels.

Please spread the word among your friends!
And if by any chance you happen to be fluent in another language (Russian, Spanish, Chinese, French, Arabic, etc.) and you are so kind to help me in translating this text for me... I will love you even more!

Himbarossa

will wachsen!

Im November 2013 begann ich ein Projekt namens Himbarossa, was irgendwo
zwischen Kunst und Handwerk angesiedelt ist. Es steckt allerdings noch
in den Kinderschuhen!
Eigentlich hat alles vor zwei Jahren begonnen, <b>als ich die Lost-wax
Technik von meinem Meister Tito Livio Negri, einer der bekanntesten
Schmuckhersteller von Rom, lernte. <b>Zur gleichen Zeit begann ich mit
Ebenholz, ein Holz, mit dem ich es Liebe zu spielen, zu arbeiten. Bald
darauf erstellte ich Schmuckstücke in Sterling Silber, Ebenholz und

anderen Materialien, welche ich meinen engsten Freunden gewidmet habe.

Im
vergangenen September ging ich dank eines sehr großzügigen
Geburtstagsgeschenks nach Murano (Venedig) für einen Workshop geführt
von Davide Penso, was mir ein vollständiges Eintauchen in das Glasperlen machen ermöglichte.
Es war Liebe auf den ersten Blick.
Daraufhin fing ich an mit der Schaffung von Schmuck aus Glas, Silber und
auch Ebenholz zu experimentieren. Ich war sehr glücklich. Meine Freunde

sagten mir, es ernst zu nehmen und so tat ich es.

Hier sind wir
nun also ... bevor ich wieder nach Murano gehe um den
intermediate-Aufbaukurs zu besuchen, gibt es zwei weitere Materialien,
die ich zu meinem Reservoir hinzufügen möchte: Kupfer- und Polymer-Ton. <b>
Und dies ist es um was es in dieser Kampagne geht: LERNEN !
Ich benötige Mittel um an Kursen und Workshops teilzunehmen: einer in
Mailand, wo Alessia Spalma (siehe ihren blog Beads und Tricks)
foldforming Techniken lehrt, und der andere in Prag, wo Melanie West (
ich ihre Arbeit lieben ! ) sowie Melanie Muir und Christine Dumont sein
werden.
Die Veranstaltung in Prag wird erst im September 2014 sein, allerdings

muss ich bereits Ende Februar buchen.

Ich habe geschätzt, dass ich
mit ca. 2,000 € in der Lage sein müsste, diese Kurse zu besuchen und
eventuell die grundlegenden Werkzeuge zu kaufen, welche ich für die
Arbeit brauche.
Allerdings setze ich mein Ziel bei 2.500 € da IndieGoGo eine grosse
Provision für meine Kampagne abziehen wird, falls es mir gelingen

sollte. Und sogar noch mehr, wenn ich keinen Erfolg habe. Unsinn!
Ich
hoffe, dass Sie mein Projekt nachhaltig mit einer Spende unterstützen,
und natürlich auch die Früchte dieses Lernprozesses zu kaufen. Ich werde
sehr glücklich sein 15 bis 20 % Rabatt auf die Preise geltend zu machen
für Spenden über 100 Euro. Für eine Spende von über 250 € werde ich
ein kostenloses Stück meiner Wahl für Sie erstellen und für Spenden von
500 € oder mehr eine maßgeschneiderte Kreation speziell für die

spendende Person gestalten.

Für Fragen bitte zögern Sie nicht
himba at sbrocca dot com zu schreiben um Beratung, Ermutigung zum
Spenden, oder Informationen zum kauf und / oder tausch meine Juwelen

erhalten möchten.

Bitte verbreiten Sie dies auch unter Ihren
Freunden !
Und wenn Sie durch Zufall Sie fließend in einer anderen Sprache (
Russisch, Chinesisch, Arabisch, etc.) sind, bin
ich im Vorraus schon sehr dankbar für die Übersetzung dieses Textes ...
En novembre 2013, j’ai créé Himbarossa, un
projet, encore tout jeune, qui oscille entre l’art et l’artisanat.
En fait, le tout a débuté il y a deux ans
lorsque je me suis familiarisée avec la technique de la cire perdue auprès de
mon mentor Tito Livio Negri, un bijoutier renommé de Rome. C’est à cette époque
que j’ai commencé à travailler l’ébène, un bois avec lequel j’adore créer. Peu
de temps après, je commençais à créer des bijoux en argent sterling et en
ébène, entre autres matériaux, bijoux que j’offrais à mes amis intimes.
En septembre dernier, grâce à un cadeau
d’anniversaire très généreux, j’ai pu aller à Murano, à Venise, afin de
participer à un atelier d’immersion sur la création en perles de verre offert
par Davide Penso.
Ce fut le coup de « perle ».
J’ai alors commencé à expérimenter en
créant des bijoux en verre, en argent et en ébène. J’étais emballée. Mes amis
m’ont suggéré de m’y consacrer sérieusement, ce que j’ai fait.
Voilà. Avant de retourner à Murano pour
suivre le cours de niveau intermédiaire-avancé, i<b>l y a deux autres matériaux
avec lesquels j’aimerais me familiariser : le cuivre et l’argile de
polymère. C’est donc l’objet de cette campagne : APPRENDRE!
J’ai besoin de financement pour assister à
des ateliers : l’un est offert à Milan par Alessia Spalma qui enseigne la
technique de fold-forming (je vous réfère à son blog Beads and tricks)
offert à Prague par Melanie West (j’adore
son travail!), Melanie Muir et Christine Dumont.
L’atelier offert à Prague aura lieu en
septembre 2014 mais je dois m’inscrire d’ici la fin février.
J’ai évalué à 2 000 € la somme qui me
permettrait d’assister à ces ateliers et me procurer les outils de base. Mon
objectif est de 2 500 € étant donné que indieggo prendra une commission
importante sur ma campagne, si elle réussit, et une commission encore plus
élevée dans le cas contraire. Absurde!
Je vous invite à parrainer mon projet en
me faisant un don. À ceux qui auront fait un don de 100 € et qui voudront
bénéficier des fruits de mon apprentissage, il me fera plaisir de vous offrir
un escompte de 15-20 % sur le prix d’origine. À ceux qui auront fait un don de
250 € et plus, j’offrirai une création de mon choix. Enfin, à ceux qui auront
fait un don de 500 € ou plus, j’offrirai une création originale, que j’aurai
dessinée pour vous ou pour la personne à laquelle vous souhaitez l’offrir.
Je vous invite à m’écrire à himba @ sbrocca dot com pour toute question, tout
commentaire, pour m’encourager ou encore si vous souhaitez acheter ou vendre
mes créations.
Passez le mot à vos amis!
Si
vous parlez couramment une autre langue (le russe, le chinois, l’arabe, etc.) et que vous pouvez m’aider à traduire ce texte, je
vous aimerai encore davantage!

¡Himbarossa quiere crecer!

En noviembre de 2013 he
puesto en marcha un proyecto laboral que de momento está en pañales, <b>se llama
HIMBRAROSSA.
Desde hace dos años he
comenzado a usar la <span>técnica
tradicional de la cera perdida para
hacer joyas de plata y bronce, al mismo tiempo he comenzado a trabajar el ébano,
he creado piezas en plata-ébano y bronce-ébano. Todo
esto graciasal apoyo deun maestroorfebre que se llama Tito Livio Negri.
En septiembre de 2013
estuve en Murano estudiando los fundamentos de la <span>técnica
artesanal para hacer cuentas de vidrio, con el maestro Davide Penso (¡gracias a un generoso

regalo de cumpleaños!). En este video les muestro cómo hago una perla.

De este modo, uniendo todos estos conocimientos he
desarrollado un pequeño sueño, el de poder crear joyas utilizando muchas
técnicas y mezclando más materiales. Aunque… me faltan aún al menos dos
técnicas básicas: la forja de metales y el trabajo de la resina polimérica.
Para la forja de metales
he elegido una artista que crea piezas muy bonitas, es italiana y se llama
Alessia Spalma, tiene un página web Bead and Tricks. Quiero ir a Cormano (cerca de Milán), para hacer un
curso intensivo de un día o dos.
Por otro lado, para
aprender la técnica de la resina polimérica, en Italia no hay artistas de
nivel. En septiembre, habrá una conferencia-taller en Praga de Melanie West (desde mi punto de vista es magnífica), Melanie Muir e
Christine Dumont.
Bueno, mi objetivo es
hacer el curso sobre el trabajo del metal en marzo-abril y el de resina
polimérica en septiembre, de este modo
podría hacer piezas hermosas para la próxima Navidad.
Para poder hacer todo
esto, y comprar algunas herramientas del oficio, he calculado que  necesitare al menos unos 2000 euros.
La plataforma sobre la
que se apoya esta campaña necesita mucho dinero, ¡sobre todo si NO consigo el
objetivo!, ridículo. <span>En su página dicen
que retienen el 4% de lo obtenido a aquellos que consiguen su
objetivo, y el 9% para los que no
lo alcanza, aunque (te diré que la
cifra final solo se establece una vez alcanzada la meta) ¡¡reteniendo el 7% y no el 4%!!
No se
sabe lo que retienen
a los que no llegan, pero me temo
que no es menos del 14-15%.
Un buen invento estas plataformas de
crowdfunding ¿eh?, ¡No hacen nada
y ganan como
un usurero!, ¡viva la tecnología!
Visto lo visto el techo
máximo de mi presupuesto lo he puesto en 2500 euros, así si encuentro mucha
gente que me apoye, entonces podría conseguir 2000 euros reales. ¡Ojala pueda
conseguir más!
Me había fijado un plazo
para recoger las aportaciones, esto también es una restricción impuesta por la
plataforma. De todos modos debería hacer la reserva para Praga a finales de
febrero, por eso necesito saber lo antes posible si puedo ir o no. Si se quiere
donar después del plazo de vencimiento, se puede usar PayPal, ¡por favor envíame
un correo electrónico privado! :-)
Si ayudas a financiar mi
proyecto, verás los resultados antes de la Navidad de 2014. Obviamente, con
toda la transparencia posible, daré cuenta de los gastos relacionados con este
proyecto con un diario en mi página de Facebook HIMBAROSSA.
¡Espero llegar a buen
puerto con todo esto!
Si quieres ayudar a mi
formación y al desarrollo del proyecto Himbarossa, puedes hacer tu aportación
directamente desde aquí. No es necesaria una cuenta PayPal, sólo una tarjeta de
crédito.
Si tienes sugerencias,
preguntas, curiosidades, palabras de ánimo, propuestas de colaboración o
similares, por favor envíame un email a himba at sbrocca .com.
IMPORTANTISIMO: ¡¡correr
la voz!!
Si conoces otras lenguas
(árabe, chino, ruso, etc.), y<span>  me quieres
ayudar puedes traducir este texto, para de este modo contribuir a la buena difusión de la campaña por el mundo. ¡Gracias!
Himbarossa quer crescer !
Em novembro de 2013 eu criei o meu
projeto chamado HIMBAROSSA .
É um projecto recém nascido que combina a arte e o artesanato.
Na verdade, tudo começou há dois anos, <b>quando eu comecei a aprender a
técnica da cera perdida com o meu Mestre ourives Tito Livio Negri, cuja
arte é bem conhecida em Roma. Ao mesmo tempo, <b>eu comecei a trabalhar com
ébano criando algumas jóias de prata e ébano ou bronze e ébano.
Em setembro passado, graças a um
presente de aniversário muito generoso fui para Murano (Veneza), para
estudar os conceitos básicos da arte de trabalhar com vidro, com o
mestre Davide Penso. Foi amor à primeira “pérola”. (Neste vídeo vou mostrar como nasce uma pérola.)
Aí
comecei a experimentar a criação de jóias feitas com vidro, prata e
também ébano.
Assim, combinando este conhecimento nasceu um pequeno sonho, <b>ser capaz de
criar jóias usando várias técnicas e explorando o uso de mais materiais
conjuntos.
Fiquei muito feliz com o resultado e os
meus amigos incentivaram-me a tornar este projeto mais real, e
assim fiz!
Falte-me no entanto realizar pelo
menos mais duas experiências básicas: o forjamento de metais e a manipulação das
resinas poliméricas.
Aqui
estamos... antes de voltar para Murano para participar no curso avançado,
existem dois outros materiais com os quais eu quero começar a trabalhar: o
cobre e a massa polímera. <b>
<b>É
este o objectivo desta Campanha : APRENDER !
Para isso preciso de fundos para assistir às aulas e também workshops:
uma em Milão com Alessia Spalma
outros
em Praga, onde estará
Melanie West
(Eu estou apaixionada pelo seu
trabalho!) além da Melanie Muir e Christine Dumont.

O evento em Praga será em setembro de 2014, mas é necessário fazer a reserva até o final de Fevereiro. Para isso, precisarei de mais o menos 2,000 €que me permitirão  de seguir os cursos e comprar as ferramentas básicas que preciso para
trabalhar.<b><span> Defini
o meu objetivo em 2.500 € visto que a
IndieGoGo, a plataforma de crowdfunding (financiamento
coletivo)<span> onde se apoia este projeto, ter
uma comissão pesada se eu conseguir o objetivo, e ainda mais pesada se não o
fizer. Um disparate!!
Preciso assim e agradeço que apoiem e incentivem  o meu projecto
através de uma doação. Se também
quiserem comprar o fruto deste processo de aprendizagem,  é com grande prazer que ofereço um desconto a partir de 15 a 20% sobre os preços, para doações
de mais de 100 euros.<span>  Para doações de
250 euros ou mais ofereço uma criação de minha eschola
mais de 500 euros ou mais ofereço uma criação desenhada por mim para a
pessoa que doou ou alguém que ele / ela vai dar a jóia.
Se tiver interesse em apoiar o meu crescimento e o desenvolvimento do
projeto Himbarossa, pode efectuar o pagamento da sua
contribuição directamente aqui.  Não precisa de ter uma conta no paypal, apenas
um cartão de crédito. Obrigada!
Sinta-se a vontade para escrever para Himba (caracol) sbrocca (ponto) com
para esclarecimentos, conselhos,
palavras de encorajamento, ou se quer comprar minhas jóias.
IMPORTANTE
: Por favor, passe a palavra entre os seus amigos !
E se por você seja fluente em um outro idioma (russo,
chinês, árabe, etc) e aceitar me ajudar a traduzir este texto... Eu vou te amar
ainda mais!

Non fanno niente e guadagnano come un usuraio! viva la tecnologia! Quindi ho fissato il tetto massimo del mio budget a 2500 euro, così se proprio trovo tante persone a darmi sostegno forse a 2000 euro reali ci posso arrivare. Speriamo anche di più! Ho dovuto fissare una scadenza alla raccolta donazioni, anche questo è un vincolo imposto dalla piattaforma. In ogni caso per Praga devo prenotare già a fine febbraio quindi il prima possibile mi serve sapere se posso andare o no. Se vi viene l'urgenza di donare (anche) dopo la data di scadenza, o brevi manu anziché usare paypal, scrivetemi in privato! :-)Se finanzierete questo mio progetto, ne vedrete i frutti entro Natale 2014. Ovviamente, nel più puro spirito di trasparenza, rendiconterò le mie spese relative a questo progetto tenendo un diario sulla mia pagina HIMBAROSSA su facebook.L'happy ending. Se vi va di sostenere la mia crescita e lo sviluppo del progetto Himbarossa, versate direttamente da qui il vostro contributo. Non serve avere un conto paypal, basta una carta di credito o una postepay. Grazie! Se avete suggerimenti, domande, curiosità, parole di incoraggiamento, proposte di collaborazione et similia, scrivetemi a himba chiocciola sbrocca punto com. IMPORTANTISSIMO: passate parola! Inoltre, se conoscete le basi di un'altra lingua (Francese, Spagnolo, Arabo, Chinese, Russo, ecc.) e vi va di aiutarmi a tradurre questo testo per poter diffondere la campagna in giro per il mondo vi vorrò ancora più bene!Per vedere il video di presentazione di questa campagna e vedere chi sonocliccate qui https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PzQts9Jd3X4. --------------------------------------------------------------Himbarossa wants to improve!In November 2013 I started my own project called Himbarossa, it's something in between art and crafts and it's still almost a newborn. Actually it all began two years ago, when I started learnig the lost-wax technique from my Master Tito Livio Negri, a well-known jewel maker of Rome. At the same time I started working ebony, a wood I just adore playing with, an soon I created jewels in Sterling Silver, Ebony and other materials, dedicated to my closest friends. Last September, thanks to a very generous birthday gift I went to Murano (Venice) to attend a full immersion workshop held by Davide Penso on glass beads making. It was love at first bead. To see how I make them watch this video. Then I started experimenting, creating jewels made with glass, Silver and also ebony. And I was extremely happy, my friends told me to take it more seriously and so I did. Here we are... before going back to Murano to attend the intermediate-advanced course, there are two other materials I want to start working with: copper and polymer clay. This is what this campaign is about: LEARNING!I need funds to attend classes and workshops: one in Milan, where Alessia Spalma (see her blog Beads and tricks) teaches fold-forming techniques, and the other in Prague, where there will be Melanie West (I absolutely love her work!) plus Melanie Muir and Christine Dumont. The Prague event will be in September 2014 but I need to book at the end of February. I've estimated I'll need approximately 2,000 euros to be able to attend these courses and maybe buy the basic tools I'll need for working. I set my goal at 2,500 since indiegogo will take an heavy commission on my campaign if I succeed, and even heavier if I do not. Nonsense! I hope you will sustain my project supporting me with a donation, If you also want to buy the fruit of this learning process, you are more than welcome and I will be more than happy to apply from 15 to 20% off the prices (for donations over 100 euros, a free creation of my choice for donation of 250 euros or more, a custom made creation - designed by me for the person who donated or someone he/she will give the jewel to - for donations over 500 euros or more). Please feel free to write at himba (at) sbrocca (dot) com for any question, advice, warm encouragement, or if you want to buy and/or trade my jewels. Please spread the word among your friends! And if by any chance you happen to be fluent in another language (Russian, Spanish, Chinese, French, Arabic, etc.) and you are so kind to help me in translating this text for me... I will love you even more! -------------------------------------------------------------Himbarossa
will wachsen!Im November 2013 begann ich ein Projekt namens Himbarossa, was irgendwo
zwischen Kunst und Handwerk angesiedelt ist. Es steckt allerdings noch
in den Kinderschuhen!
Eigentlich hat alles vor zwei Jahren begonnen, als ich die Lost-wax
Technik von meinem Meister Tito Livio Negri, einer der bekanntesten
Schmuckhersteller von Rom, lernte. Zur gleichen Zeit begann ich mit
Ebenholz, ein Holz, mit dem ich es Liebe zu spielen, zu arbeiten. Bald
darauf erstellte ich Schmuckstücke in Sterling Silber, Ebenholz und
anderen Materialien, welche  ich meinen engsten Freunden gewidmet habe.Im
vergangenen September ging ich dank eines sehr großzügigen
Geburtstagsgeschenks nach Murano (Venedig) für einen Workshop geführt
von Davide Penso, was mir ein vollständiges Eintauchen  in das Glasperlen machen ermöglichte.
Es war Liebe auf den ersten Blick.
Daraufhin fing ich an mit der Schaffung von Schmuck aus Glas, Silber und
auch Ebenholz zu experimentieren. Ich war sehr glücklich. Meine Freunde
sagten mir, es ernst zu nehmen und so tat ich es.Hier sind wir
nun also ... bevor ich wieder nach Murano gehe um den
intermediate-Aufbaukurs zu besuchen, gibt es zwei weitere Materialien,
die ich zu meinem Reservoir hinzufügen möchte: Kupfer- und Polymer-Ton.
Und dies ist es um was es in dieser Kampagne geht: LERNEN !
Ich benötige Mittel um an Kursen und Workshops teilzunehmen: einer in
Mailand, wo Alessia Spalma (siehe ihren blog Beads und Tricks)
foldforming Techniken lehrt, und der andere in Prag, wo Melanie West (
ich ihre Arbeit lieben ! ) sowie Melanie Muir und Christine Dumont sein
werden.
Die Veranstaltung in Prag wird erst im September 2014 sein, allerdings
muss ich bereits Ende Februar buchen.Ich habe geschätzt, dass ich
mit ca. 2,000 € in der Lage sein müsste, diese Kurse zu besuchen und
eventuell die grundlegenden Werkzeuge zu kaufen, welche ich für die
Arbeit brauche.
Allerdings setze ich mein Ziel bei 2.500 € da IndieGoGo eine grosse
Provision für meine Kampagne abziehen wird, falls es mir gelingen
sollte. Und sogar noch mehr, wenn ich keinen Erfolg habe. Unsinn!Ich
hoffe, dass Sie mein Projekt nachhaltig mit einer Spende unterstützen,
und natürlich auch die Früchte dieses Lernprozesses zu kaufen. Ich werde
sehr glücklich sein 15 bis 20 % Rabatt auf die Preise geltend zu machen
für Spenden über 100 Euro. Für eine Spende von über 250 € werde ich
ein kostenloses Stück meiner Wahl für Sie erstellen und für Spenden von
500 € oder mehr eine maßgeschneiderte Kreation speziell für die
spendende Person gestalten. Für Fragen bitte zögern Sie nicht
himba at sbrocca dot com zu schreiben um Beratung,  Ermutigung zum
Spenden, oder Informationen zum kauf und / oder tausch meine Juwelen
erhalten möchten.Bitte verbreiten Sie dies auch unter Ihren
Freunden !
Und wenn Sie durch Zufall Sie fließend in einer anderen Sprache (
Russisch, Chinesisch, Arabisch, etc.) sind, bin
ich im Vorraus schon sehr dankbar für die Übersetzung dieses Textes ...
En novembre 2013, j’ai créé Himbarossa, un
projet, encore tout jeune, qui oscille entre l’art et l’artisanat.
En fait, le tout a débuté il y a deux ans
lorsque je me suis familiarisée avec la technique de la cire perdue auprès de
mon mentor Tito Livio Negri, un bijoutier renommé de Rome. C’est à cette époque
que j’ai commencé à travailler l’ébène, un bois avec lequel j’adore créer. Peu
de temps après, je commençais à créer des bijoux en argent sterling et en
ébène, entre autres matériaux, bijoux que j’offrais à mes amis intimes.
En septembre dernier, grâce à un cadeau
d’anniversaire très généreux, j’ai pu aller à Murano, à Venise, afin de
participer à un atelier d’immersion sur la création en perles de verre offert
par Davide Penso.
Ce fut le coup de « perle ».
J’ai alors commencé à expérimenter en
créant des bijoux en verre, en argent et en ébène. J’étais emballée. Mes amis
m’ont suggéré de m’y consacrer sérieusement, ce que j’ai fait.
Voilà. Avant de retourner à Murano pour
suivre le cours de niveau intermédiaire-avancé, il y a deux autres matériaux
avec lesquels j’aimerais me familiariser : le cuivre et l’argile de
polymère. C’est donc l’objet de cette campagne : APPRENDRE!
J’ai besoin de financement pour assister à
des ateliers : l’un est offert à Milan par Alessia Spalma qui enseigne la
technique de fold-forming (je vous réfère à son blog Beads and tricks)
offert à Prague par Melanie West (j’adore
son travail!), Melanie Muir et Christine Dumont.
L’atelier offert à Prague aura lieu en
septembre 2014 mais je dois m’inscrire d’ici la fin février.
J’ai évalué à 2 000 € la somme qui me
permettrait d’assister à ces ateliers et me procurer les outils de base. Mon
objectif est de 2 500 € étant donné que indieggo prendra une commission
importante sur ma campagne, si elle réussit, et une commission encore plus
élevée dans le cas contraire. Absurde!
Je vous invite à parrainer mon projet en
me faisant un don. À ceux qui auront fait un don de 100 € et qui voudront
bénéficier des fruits de mon apprentissage, il me fera plaisir de vous offrir
un escompte de 15-20 % sur le prix d’origine. À ceux qui auront fait un don de
250 € et plus, j’offrirai une création de mon choix. Enfin, à ceux qui auront
fait un don de 500 € ou plus, j’offrirai une création originale, que j’aurai
dessinée pour vous ou pour la personne à laquelle vous souhaitez l’offrir.
Je vous invite à m’écrire à himba @ sbrocca dot com pour toute question, tout
commentaire, pour m’encourager ou encore si vous souhaitez acheter ou vendre
mes créations.
Passez le mot à vos amis!
Si
vous parlez couramment une autre langue (le russe, le chinois, l’arabe, etc.) et que vous pouvez m’aider à traduire ce texte, je
vous aimerai encore davantage!
______________________________________¡Himbarossa quiere crecer! En noviembre de 2013 he
puesto en marcha un proyecto laboral que de momento está en pañales, se llama
HIMBRAROSSA.
Desde hace dos años he
comenzado a usar la técnica
tradicional de la cera perdida para
hacer joyas de plata y bronce, al mismo tiempo he comenzado a trabajar el ébano,
he creado piezas en plata-ébano y bronce-ébano. Todo
esto graciasal apoyo deun maestroorfebre que se llama Tito Livio Negri.
En septiembre de 2013
estuve en Murano estudiando los fundamentos de la técnica
artesanal para    hacer cuentas de vidrio, con el maestro Davide Penso (¡gracias a un generoso
regalo de cumpleaños!). En este video les muestro cómo hago una perla.De este modo, uniendo todos estos conocimientos he
desarrollado un pequeño sueño, el de poder crear joyas utilizando muchas
técnicas y mezclando más materiales. Aunque… me faltan aún al menos dos
técnicas básicas: la forja de metales y el trabajo de la resina polimérica.
Para la forja de metales
he elegido una artista que crea piezas muy bonitas, es italiana y se llama
Alessia Spalma, tiene un página web Bead and Tricks. Quiero ir a Cormano (cerca de Milán), para hacer un
curso intensivo de un día o dos.
Por otro lado, para
aprender la técnica de la resina polimérica, en Italia no hay artistas de
nivel. En septiembre, habrá una conferencia-taller en Praga de Melanie West (desde mi punto de vista es magnífica), Melanie Muir e
Christine Dumont.
Bueno, mi objetivo es
hacer el curso sobre el trabajo del metal en marzo-abril y el de resina
polimérica en septiembre, de este modo
podría hacer piezas hermosas para la próxima Navidad.
Para poder hacer todo
esto, y comprar algunas herramientas del oficio, he calculado que  necesitare al menos unos 2000 euros.
La plataforma sobre la
que se apoya esta campaña necesita mucho dinero, ¡sobre todo si NO consigo el
objetivo!, ridículo. En su página dicen
que retienen el 4% de lo obtenido a aquellos que consiguen su
objetivo, y el 9% para los que no
lo alcanza, aunque (te diré que la
cifra final solo se establece una vez alcanzada la meta) ¡¡reteniendo el 7% y no el 4%!!
No se
sabe lo que retienen
a los que no llegan, pero me temo
que no es menos del 14-15%.
Un buen invento estas plataformas de
crowdfunding ¿eh?, ¡No hacen nada
y ganan como
un usurero!, ¡viva la tecnología!
Visto lo visto el techo
máximo de mi presupuesto lo he puesto en 2500 euros, así si encuentro mucha
gente que me apoye, entonces podría conseguir 2000 euros reales. ¡Ojala pueda
conseguir más!
Me había fijado un plazo
para recoger las aportaciones, esto también es una restricción impuesta por la
plataforma. De todos modos debería hacer la reserva para Praga a finales de
febrero, por eso necesito saber lo antes posible si puedo ir o no. Si se quiere
donar después del plazo de vencimiento, se puede usar PayPal, ¡por favor envíame
un correo electrónico privado! :-)
Si ayudas a financiar mi
proyecto, verás los resultados antes de la Navidad de 2014. Obviamente, con
toda la transparencia posible, daré cuenta de los gastos relacionados con este
proyecto con un diario en mi página de Facebook HIMBAROSSA.
¡Espero llegar a buen
puerto con todo esto!
Si quieres ayudar a mi
formación y al desarrollo del proyecto Himbarossa, puedes hacer tu aportación
directamente desde aquí. No es necesaria una cuenta PayPal, sólo una tarjeta de
crédito.
Si tienes sugerencias,
preguntas, curiosidades, palabras de ánimo, propuestas de colaboración o
similares, por favor envíame un email a himba at sbrocca .com.
IMPORTANTISIMO: ¡¡correr
la voz!!
Si conoces otras lenguas
(árabe, chino, ruso, etc.), y  me quieres
ayudar puedes traducir este texto, para de este modo contribuir a la buena difusión de la campaña por el mundo.  ¡Gracias!
Himbarossa quer crescer !
Em novembro de 2013 eu criei o meu
projeto chamado HIMBAROSSA .
É um projecto recém nascido que combina a arte e o artesanato.
Na verdade, tudo começou há dois anos, quando eu comecei a aprender a
técnica da cera perdida com o meu Mestre ourives Tito Livio Negri, cuja
arte é bem conhecida em Roma. Ao mesmo tempo, eu comecei a trabalhar com
ébano criando algumas jóias de prata e ébano ou bronze e ébano.
Em setembro passado, graças a um
presente de aniversário muito generoso fui para Murano (Veneza), para
estudar os conceitos básicos da arte de trabalhar com vidro, com o
mestre Davide Penso. Foi amor à primeira “pérola”. (Neste vídeo vou mostrar como nasce uma pérola.)
Aí
comecei a experimentar a criação de jóias feitas com vidro, prata e
também ébano.
Assim, combinando este conhecimento nasceu um pequeno sonho, ser capaz de
criar jóias usando várias técnicas e explorando o uso de mais materiais
conjuntos.
Fiquei muito feliz com o resultado e os
meus amigos incentivaram-me a tornar este projeto mais real, e
assim fiz!
Falte-me no entanto realizar pelo
menos mais duas experiências básicas: o forjamento de metais e a manipulação das
resinas poliméricas.
Aqui
estamos... antes de voltar para Murano para participar no curso avançado,
existem dois outros materiais com os quais eu quero começar a trabalhar: o
cobre e a massa polímera.
É
este o objectivo desta Campanha : APRENDER !
Para isso preciso de fundos para assistir às aulas e também workshops:
uma em Milão com Alessia Spalma
outros
em Praga, onde estará
Melanie West
(Eu estou apaixionada pelo seu
trabalho!) além da Melanie Muir e Christine Dumont.

O evento em Praga será em setembro de 2014, mas é necessário fazer a reserva até o final de Fevereiro. Para isso, precisarei de mais o menos 2,000 €que me permitirão  de seguir os cursos e comprar as ferramentas básicas que preciso para
trabalhar. Defini
o meu objetivo em 2.500 € visto que a
IndieGoGo, a plataforma de crowdfunding (financiamento
coletivo) onde se apoia este projeto, ter
uma comissão pesada se eu conseguir o objetivo, e ainda mais pesada se não o
fizer. Um disparate!!
Preciso assim e agradeço que apoiem e incentivem  o meu projecto
através de uma doação. Se também
quiserem comprar o fruto deste processo de aprendizagem,  é com grande prazer que ofereço um desconto a partir de 15 a 20% sobre os preços, para doações
de mais de 100 euros.  Para doações de
250 euros ou mais ofereço uma criação de minha eschola
mais de 500 euros ou mais ofereço uma criação desenhada por mim para a
pessoa que doou ou alguém que ele / ela vai dar a jóia.
Se tiver interesse em apoiar o meu crescimento e o desenvolvimento do
projeto Himbarossa, pode efectuar o pagamento da sua
contribuição directamente aqui.  Não precisa de ter uma conta no paypal, apenas
um cartão de crédito. Obrigada!
Sinta-se a vontade para escrever para Himba (caracol) sbrocca (ponto) com
para esclarecimentos, conselhos,
palavras de encorajamento, ou se quer comprar minhas jóias.
IMPORTANTE
: Por favor, passe a palavra entre os seus amigos !
E se por você seja fluente em um outro idioma (russo,
chinês, árabe, etc) e aceitar me ajudar a traduzir este texto... Eu vou te amar
ainda mais!",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

English Version here

Qui sommes-nous ?

Nous sommes deux étudiants de l'INSA de Lyon, préparant notre diplôme d'ingénieur. Partageant les mêmes centres d’intérêts et le goût de l'associatif au sein de notre école, nous avons décidé de nous lancer tous les deux dans l'aventure en participant au 4L Trophy 2015. Il nous tient à cœur de s'investir dans cette expérience enrichissante. C'est pour nous un défi et un projet ambitieux, aussi bien sportif qu'humanitaire.


Vous pouvez tout connaitre sur notre projet en visionnant notre dossier ici.

Le 4L trophy

         Un raid Humanitaire 

La collaboration entre le 4L Trophy et l'association Enfants du Désert permet d'oeuvrer pour la scolarité et l'accessibilité au sport des enfants des régions les plus pauvres du Maroc.

En effet, nous prévoyons d'emmener 60 kg de fournitures scolaires, sportives et médicales ainsi que 10 kg de denrée non-périssable.


         Un défi sportif

Traverser durant 10 jours les routes de France, d'Espagne et les pistes du Maroc (environ 6000 km)

S'orienter et résoudre les éventuels problèmes de mécanique

Préparer un raid en amont (trouver les fonds, le matériel, préparer la 4L pour qu'elle puisse endurer ce périple)

         Une aventure Humaine

Se confronter à des situations délicates au milieu du désert aride marocain

S'entraider dans des conditions délicates

Se dépasser dans un contexte nouveau


Bilan 4L Trophy 2014

1323 équipages se sont élancés depuis le Futuroscope et Saint-Jean-de-Luz.

L’association Enfants du désert à récolté 24 812 € et 60 tonnes de fournitures ont été récoltées.

A quoi serviront les dons?

La collecte servira à l'achat de la 4L et à sa préparation.  Celle ci étant la pièce maitresse de ce projet, votre soutien financier nous est essentiel. 

Sans oublier qu'elle acheminera l'ensemble des fournitures scolaires et alimentaires que nous aurons réunies.

A quoi serviront les dons?

-Facebook : aimez notre page : https://www.facebook.com/4Ldorado2015

-Parlez de notre projet autour de vous.

-Vous pouvez contribuer sur ce site.

/!\ PayPal est un moyen de paiement en ligne sécurisé. Vous n'avez pas besoin de compte, il vous suffit de cliquer sur ""aller sur la page PayPal"", et vous pourrez choisir votre mode de paiement.


Who are we ?

We are two students who come from Lyon, France. We are studying for the equivalent of a master of science. We are very concerned about many associations of our school, that's why we decided to participate in humanitarian and sports adventure :  The 4l Trophy. This raid is only for student and takes place in Morocco. This is a challenge for us and both sporting and humanitarian ambitious project.

The 4l Trophy

         An humanitarian rally

4L is the name of an old and reliable Renault car. Each team of two students have to drive a 4L. Collaboration between the 4L Trophy and the association ""Enfants du Désert"" (Children in the Desert)  allows to work for education and access to sport for children who live in the poorest regions of Morocco.

Actually, we will bring with us 130 pounds of school supplies ans 25 pounds of non-perishable food.
column3:
/>


https://www.facebook.com/4Ldorado2015        A sporting challenge 

For 10 days through the roads of France, Spain and the slopes of Morocco (about 3800 miles)

Orient int the desert and fix any mechanical problems

column1: Prepare the event upstream (finding funds, equipment, prepare the 4L which will endure this journey). The rally will take place in February 2015
A Human Adventure
Confront difficult situations in the middle of the barren desert of Morocco
Help each other in knotty conditions
Surpass in any contexts
Results of the 4L Trophy 2014
1323 teams began their adventure from the south of France.
The association ""Enfants du desert"" collected € 24,812 ($ 37 484.1) and 60 tons of supplies were collected.
How will we use funds we raised?
The collection will be used to purchase the 4L and its preparation. This one is the centerpiece of this project, your financial support is essential for us.
Not to mention it will carry all school supplies and food that we find.

How can you help us?

-Facebook, Like our page : https://www.facebook.com/4Ldorado2015

-Talk around you about our project
-You can contribute on this website
/!\PayPal is a safe online payment. You don't need to have an PayPal account, you just have to click on ""Go to PayPal"" and you can choose you way of payment.

Collaboration between the 4L Trophy and the association ""Enfants du Désert"" (Children in the Desert)  allows to work for education and access to sport for children who live in the poorest regions of Morocco.Actually, we will bring with us 130 pounds of school supplies ans 25 pounds of non-perishable food.https://www.facebook.com/4Ldorado2015        A sporting challenge For 10 days through the roads of France, Spain and the slopes of Morocco (about 3800 miles)Orient int the desert and fix any mechanical problems
Prepare the event upstream (finding funds, equipment, prepare the 4L which will endure this journey). The rally will take place in February 2015
A Human Adventure
Confront difficult situations in the middle of the barren desert of Morocco
Help each other in knotty conditions
Surpass in any contexts
Results of the 4L Trophy 2014
1323 teams began their adventure from the south of France.
The association ""Enfants du desert"" collected € 24,812 ($ 37 484.1) and 60 tons of supplies were collected.
How will we use funds we raised?
The collection will be used to purchase the 4L and its preparation. This one is the centerpiece of this project, your financial support is essential for us.
Not to mention it will carry all school supplies and food that we find.
How can you help us?-Facebook, Like our page : https://www.facebook.com/4Ldorado2015

-Talk around you about our project-You can contribute on this website/!\PayPal is a safe online payment. You don't need to have an PayPal account, you just have to click on ""Go to PayPal"" and you can choose you way of payment.",2.0,0,"1 Campaign

Introduction

My name is Josephine Naijeria Toweett. I am a Social Media Conversation Manager for a Kenyan project called Love Matters Kenya. 

I am seeking support to enable me attend the Soaps &
column2: Society course at RNTC in the Netherlands . My interest in taking part in the Soaps and Society course is to gain the skills to develop multimedia content for our social media channels that tackle and address Sexual &
column3:
Reproductive Health issues affecting the youth in Kenya and the region. 

Your contribution will help me gain the necessary skill to impart knowledge and pass on information to the youth through storytelling through cool short web dramas. 

What is needed

I have been offered a seat on the Soaps &
column4: Society 2014 course (8 weeks), if I can contribute US$ 2400.  RNTC &
column5: RNW will cover all other costs.

column1: • Tuition fee
<li>Accommodation &amp
• Airport pick-up
• Local transport
• Medical insurance
• Flight ticket (return)
• Visa cost

The course takes place from the 13th of October to the 5th of December 2014.           I need to raise US$ 2400 by 15th September 2014 to benefit from the scholarship and attend the course. 

What you get

For making my dreams a reality , I would love to give you the following perks as a symbol of my heartfelt appreciation.  When you donate, you have the chance to choose a donation amount and a correlating perk. (See gallery for sample pictures of the perks)
• A shout out from me and my family on Facebook, and a tweet
• Handwritten snail mail from me about my time in Hilversum
• Thank you and a Blog mention
• Hand painted “Thank you” cards from a Kenyan artist.
<li>A  pair of  Masaai Sandals
• A pair of earings
• Africa Bracelet
• A Kikoi
• Kikoi Bag
• Michael Soi Bag
• A painting from me (5 available)
• A mention as in Produced Drama Scene and first Web Drama series

About my work at Love Matters 

Love Matters is a reality check offering sexual health information with a positive take on pleasure and relationship satisfaction.

In my capacity as the Social Media Conversation Manager, I manage the social media conversations , this includes giving young people the facts that they need to have in order to enjoy safer, healthier and happier sex and responding to questions and concerns that they may have on issues of love, sex and relationships.

Our audience, youth 15 – 30 years old, access the website and social media pages namely Facebook and Twitter mainly via mobile phones. Research * indicates that 49% of Kenyans use WhatsApp  as a messaging and multimedia sharing platform.

What are Kenya youth sharing? Photos and videos : one-two minute videos are constantly shared with comedy clips and user generated content being top on the list. It is clear that a dynamic visual presence is essential for developing a successful social media campaign. Video content is consistently the most engaging content and short video “snippets” that are easy to produce and offer a little more interaction than photos alone.

Upon completing the course , I intend to develop between one - two minute videos soaps to be shared online and via mobile phones , utilizing the story rich user generated content from our social media conversations.  

Love Matters is the winner of the Award for Excellence &
column2:
Innovation in Sexuality Education for 2013 from the World Association for Sexual Health (WAS).

Gratitude 

RNTC &
column3:
RNW for the partial scholarship 

My loving family for their support 


For more info or queries 

Feel free to drop me an email  or tweet if you have a specific request or question. 

Other ways to support

You can share my campaign with your friends, family and colleagues . You can post this url : http://igg.me/at/4love4drama on Facebook , Twitter, Email and other social media channel .

Whether you can donate or not, you can help me achieve this dream by also forwarding my campaign.  Please tell everyone you know!  You can post this url: http://igg.me/at/4love4drama on Facebook, e-mail, Twitter, and Tumblr.

Thank you so much for your support.
