Short Summary
My name is Baruch Inbar. I am an artist and a filmmaker, from Los Angeles. I wanted to share with you a unique project I’ve been working on, called BLESS THE CHILDREN.

BLESS THE CHILDREN is a documentary and worldwide campaign, about educating and empowering children of the incredible health benefits of plant based foods. A significant part of this film will be dedicated to reaching out and bringing this information, along with the resources and tools to less fortunate kids such as foster kids and orphans.

The film will clearly demonstrate the health impact of plant based living foods on the well being of children and their emotional, academic, intellectual and athletic performances. It will be scientifically backed by massive research, and by a panel of world leading experts, M.D's and scientists.
Our most important goal with this film, is to inspire both adults and children about this incredible way of life, and it's positive impact on our planet and society for the long run.

I was raised as a foster child in southern Israel from the age of 10 to 19, after spending nearly two years in the streets. The pain of being a foster child is very close to my heart, and I am intimately familiar with these children’s pain.

The challenging times I went through, which included hunger and neglect, left within me deep emotional and physical wounds. From a very young age I suffered from various medical conditions including: Asthma, allergies and heartburns. I was on many medications for over 20 years. Some of these medications were severely compromising the quality of my life and my well being.

After going through my own personal healing journey in 2009, experiencing the incredible benefits of this life sustaining nutrition, I realized how critical it is for the well being of all of us, and particularely our children.

Since then, I made a commitment to use my experience and personal journey of healing, to educate and inspire children and provide them with the information and knowledge that will give them the power and access to make healthy choices and create for themselves a bright future.
What We Need &

We need $60,000 to shoot this documentary in HD for a period of 6-8 weeks working with both Jewish and Arab children, in Israel and Palestine. The budget will cover our trip expenses to Israel and Palestine, film crew and editing budget. If we get more funding, we can incorporate into the film lots of cool post-production and animated sequences.

By supporting us you will not only going to have an important role in the creation of this important project, but you will be also rewarded. Among our rewards, we are going to give away the BLESS THE CHILDREN chocolates, which are made by us, our friends, and their children.
See some yummy pics here: CHOCOLATE PICS
We will also giveaway t-shirts, signed DVD’s, VIP invite to screenings in LA and after parties and much more!
The Impact

The health statistics of children are staggering. Over 25% of kids in the US are obese and sick, and many of them are on some form of medications. Many teenagers are also on anti-depressants that severely impact their emotional and mental capacities.

So, my goal in this film is not only to address the nutritional educational campaign for foster children, but to actually to use the film as an educational model that will serve all children and adults wherever they are. The film will guide through the process and steps of implementing plant based living foods into one’s lifestyle, and will share success stories of those who went through that path.

Numerous publications, studies, books and films were published about the importance and benefits of plant based living foods into our daily lives. In fact, many well-known scientists including M.D’s, are prominent speakers of the importance of this powerful nutrition. It can literally save one’s life.

In this documentary, I intend to reach out to as many children as possible and share with them this precious information, teaching them how to make incredibly delicious foods and the principals of this wisdom that will guide them for life.
Children are our future and their most valuable asset is their health. If we invest in our children, we invest in our future.
Other Ways You Can Help
You can support us by not only Indiegogo, but also by purchasing our BLESS THE CHILDREN CHOCOLATES. You can order them here:
http://www.facebook.com/BlessTheChildrenFilm/app_138996027389

Please get the word out and share with your friends and colleagues! Don’t forget to use the Indiegogo share tools.

","IF YOU HAVE A TROUBLE VIEWING THE VIDEO ABOVE, PLEASE CLICK THIS LINK:
https://vimeo.com/39984283
Short Summary
My name is Baruch Inbar. I am an artist and a filmmaker, from Los Angeles. I wanted to share with you a unique project I’ve been working on, called BLESS THE CHILDREN.

BLESS THE CHILDREN is a documentary and worldwide campaign, about educating and empowering children of the incredible health benefits of plant based foods. A significant part of this film will be dedicated to reaching out and bringing this information, along with the resources and tools to less fortunate kids such as foster kids and orphans.

The film will clearly demonstrate the health impact of plant based living foods on the well being of children and their emotional, academic, intellectual and athletic performances. It will be scientifically backed by massive research, and by a panel of world leading experts, M.D's and scientists.
Our most important goal with this film, is to inspire both adults and children about this incredible way of life, and it's positive impact on our planet and society for the long run.

I was raised as a foster child in southern Israel from the age of 10 to 19, after spending nearly two years in the streets. The pain of being a foster child is very close to my heart, and I am intimately familiar with these children’s pain.

The challenging times I went through, which included hunger and neglect, left within me deep emotional and physical wounds. From a very young age I suffered from various medical conditions including: Asthma, allergies and heartburns. I was on many medications for over 20 years. Some of these medications were severely compromising the quality of my life and my well being.

After going through my own personal healing journey in 2009, experiencing the incredible benefits of this life sustaining nutrition, I realized how critical it is for the well being of all of us, and particularely our children.

Since then, I made a commitment to use my experience and personal journey of healing, to educate and inspire children and provide them with the information and knowledge that will give them the power and access to make healthy choices and create for themselves a bright future.
What We Need & What You Get

We need $60,000 to shoot this documentary in HD for a period of 6-8 weeks working with both Jewish and Arab children, in Israel and Palestine. The budget will cover our trip expenses to Israel and Palestine, film crew and editing budget. If we get more funding, we can incorporate into the film lots of cool post-production and animated sequences.

By supporting us you will not only going to have an important role in the creation of this important project, but you will be also rewarded. Among our rewards, we are going to give away the BLESS THE CHILDREN chocolates, which are made by us, our friends, and their children.
See some yummy pics here: CHOCOLATE PICS
We will also giveaway t-shirts, signed DVD’s, VIP invite to screenings in LA and after parties and much more!
The Impact

The health statistics of children are staggering. Over 25% of kids in the US are obese and sick, and many of them are on some form of medications. Many teenagers are also on anti-depressants that severely impact their emotional and mental capacities.

So, my goal in this film is not only to address the nutritional educational campaign for foster children, but to actually to use the film as an educational model that will serve all children and adults wherever they are. The film will guide through the process and steps of implementing plant based living foods into one’s lifestyle, and will share success stories of those who went through that path.

Numerous publications, studies, books and films were published about the importance and benefits of plant based living foods into our daily lives. In fact, many well-known scientists including M.D’s, are prominent speakers of the importance of this powerful nutrition. It can literally save one’s life.

In this documentary, I intend to reach out to as many children as possible and share with them this precious information, teaching them how to make incredibly delicious foods and the principals of this wisdom that will guide them for life.
Children are our future and their most valuable asset is their health. If we invest in our children, we invest in our future.
Other Ways You Can Help
You can support us by not only Indiegogo, but also by purchasing our BLESS THE CHILDREN CHOCOLATES. You can order them here:
http://www.facebook.com/BlessTheChildrenFilm/app_138996027389
Please get the word out and share with your friends and colleagues! Don’t forget to use the Indiegogo share tools.",0.0,0,"2 Campaigns

The Beginning...

As I sit writing this, it hits me that I am actually in South Africa and have been here for about 2 months. I am currently studying abroad for the fall semester of my senior year in Cape Town, South Africa with a program called CIEE Service-Learning. Normally you would find me studying Math at The University of Texas at Austin, but this semester I decided to branch out, study something completely different, and go a step further by incorporating that education into a life changing project. The program I am in is structured so that along with my school work I am also partnering with an organization in the community to help them in any way I see possible.
The Need

I have been spending the past 2 months with an organization called Yabonga, which is an NGO that supports women, men, and children who are infected or directly affected by HIV/Aids in Cape Town. Through this organization, every week I go out to the township of Samora Machel to love, support, and encourage about 20 wonderful youth, ages 14-18, that live in the neighborhood. As they walk into the small portable building where the youth center is locate in their school uniforms, most of which are torn from wear and tear, I cannot wait to see what they teach me that day. Their bright smiling faces, despite what they go through everyday, never cease to amaze me. The despair of gangsterism, poverty, hungry, and/or HIV/Aids has not stopped these youth from pursing their dreams, and they continue to fight.

Having seen over the past weeks while living and learning in Cape Town that many youth are not getting the education they deserve, it was impossible to ignore this and leave here in 2 months without supporting the youth that I have gotten to know and love. The standards and quality of education here are so low that it is beyond reason and once the students leave their school building, they often have no resources or support in their studies, which is basically a requirement if you even have a chance of passing for graduation.
Project Goal

Given my background in math, my goal during this time in Samora Machel and other townships is to develop a system and provide materials in the STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Math) fields for the youth there to be able to continue their education outside of school and essentially be able to teach themselves when no one else is there. Most of the youth that I have met in recent days are studying subjects that align with the STEM fields, which has been incredible to hear.

Tangibly, I am seeking to raise funds to support this project of continuing STEM Education in the townships of South Africa. With the funds I raise, I will be purchasing supplies, such as notebooks, pencils, rulers, calculators, etc. and supplying each youth center with several copies of their school textbooks and/or workbooks. In addition to giving each youth center in the townships, of which there are 10, all of the supplies they need, I hope to also purchase bookshelves for storage. These shelves will be painted with helpful math tips and charts so that when studying the youth are surrounded by resources that encourage them to continue their studies.

I can only hope that this small project will leave an impact that will make a big different in the lives of the youth here in South Africa. I see so much potential in every single one of them, if only they had the support they needed to succeed in their education then they would be able to fulfill their dreams, rise up out of poverty, and change the world for good. As I met with Desmond Tutu this past week, he continually reminded me that ""the youth are the best hope the world has for change."" I could not agree more.

Help Bring a Traveling Sports Exhibit to SciWorks

You remember SciWorks, the Science Center and Environmental Park of Forsyth County, as the place you came as a kid with the fun activities and an exciting place to learn about science. Help us to provide the same opportunities to a new generation of kids by working with us to bring the science of sports to life!  Sportsology is an exciting, interactive exhibit that allows kids to:
<ul>
• Race wheelchairs, test their grip, pitch in a pitching cage
• Discover the physics and biology of sports
• Test their athletic abilities while learning how their bodies work
You remember having a great time here as a kid ...
We need you to come back and be part of our innovative community. Help us provide that same wonderful experience to a new generation.
<div>

We need $25,000 to bring Sportsology to SciWorks. Traveling exhibits allow us to offer new and exciting experiences on top of all of the wonderful things that have always been here and that you remember so fondly.
<ul>
• Funding will go toward paying for the exhibit and marketing the exhibit.
• Take a look at our logo — we're committed to helping you explore the stars, ponder physics and learn about the natural world around us.

• If we don't reach our funding goal, all monies collected will go toward bringing Sportsology here. We are committed to bringing traveling exhibits that provide new experiences and keep SciWorks fresh and exciting.
<div>
The Impact
By helping SciWorks bring in Sportsology, you help the children of today create the kinds of memories that you have when you think of the science centers you visited as a child.

We know that coming to SciWorks is a favorite family destination. But SciWorks is more than just a fun place to visit — it provides the opportunities for children to learn the skills they need to live in an everchanging world. Children need to be creative and collaborative. They need to take risks and try things again and again. Sportsology gives them the chance to practice all four of these skills. No child is going to throw a single baseball
column2: they'll keep throwing it again and again.

column1: <div>
Other Ways You Can Help
Please spread the word about SciWorks' campaign to bring Sportsology this summer!
<ul>
• Get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
• Use the Indiegogo share tools!
• Follow on Facebook and Twitter, and check out our
column2: feature=youtu.be"" rel=""noopener nofollow"">animal videos on YouTube.

Ethics and good governance are crucial elements for ensuring proper functioning of a democracy, and are at the heart of public concerns in Canadian society.  In 1977, the new Act Respecting the Financing of Political Parties was adopted unanimously
column2: proof of the will of elected officials to equip themselves with standards that favour public integrity.  In the last years, many public scandals have been revealed, causing public opinion to react, demanding transparency, honesty and integrity from public representatives.  The recent implementation of the Municipal Ethics and Good Conduct Act, which calls on municipal governments to adopt codes of ethics, is a testament to the importance of these issues.

column1: The IGO Certifications Program is an attempt to support and develop this evolution toward equipping our public officials with the best possible tools with which to govern.  By offering a certificate for good governance practices in municipalities, we are introducing a novel idea in the spirit of the current political climate.  This is the missing link that will allow citizens and their elected officials to rekindle trust in their relationship.

This certification protocol is the fruit of many years of observation of evolution in the field of public administration.  By juxtaposing the already existing standards of large international organizations with known criteria from scientific literature, it will allow for the implementation of the most complete and avant-garde good governance program to this day.  Moreover, I’d like to mention the involvement of reputable experts in the development of this program.  I recognize the exceptional contribution of the members of our Scientific Council, who are seeking to bridge the gap between the academic world and the needs of Canadian society.
<div class=""col"">

In this spirit, a pilot project was carried out in the City of Blainville. Now that this project is completed – the City has committed to implementing nearly all of the reforms leading to certification by the end of 2012 – the IGO Certification Program is now available to all municipalities in Québec that wish to make a concrete commitment toward good governance practices.  Beyond IGO full certification, the IGO Program is now also available in “Bronze” or “Silver” level attestations, progressively leading to full IGO certification. In this way, different avenues for improvement, all signaling strong commitment in favour of good governance, are available and accessible to all municipalities in Canada.

Without further ado, I would like to invite you to take part in this movement and to contribute to rebuilding trust between elected officials and citizens, as well as to help to reestablish the true meaning of democracy.
Christian Bordeleau, PhDc., President and Founder of the IGO Good Governance Certifications Program
Prix décerné au Programme IGO pendant le projet pilote:
•Lauréat de la Fondation du Maire pour la période automne 2011
<div>•Prix KPMG en service-conseils
•Lauréat Concours Québécois en entreprenariat 2012, Montréal-Centre, catégorie « Services aux entreprises »,
•Lauréat Concours Québécois en entreprenariat 2012, Région de Montréal, catégorie « Services aux entreprises »,
•Lauréat Concours Québécois en entreprenariat 2012, Région de Montréal, « Grand Prix Druide toutes catégories »,
•Lauréat Concours Québécois en entreprenariat 2012, National, « Grand prix du public Gaz métro propulsé par Rogers»,
•Prix d’excellence du syndicat des chargés de cours de l’Université de Montréal.
<div>
Le fondateur d’Intangible Gouvernance, notamment pour le Programme de certifications IGO, est déjà récipiendaire de plusieurs reconnaissances, dont:
•Le prix d’excellence du Canadian Association of Program in Public Administration
•Le titre de Leader Éclairé de l’Institut d’Administration Publique du Canada
•Le médaillé de la 64e conférence annuelle de l’IPAC.
•Invité à titre d’expert à faire partie du bassin d’expertise de l’International Anti-Corruption Academy

About me and the Program:

I have been conducting Recreation Therapy for the past 15 years.  My passion for it resulted in a Masters Degree (2003) and a national certification (Since 1999).  The importance I have for treating challenges in childhood has resulted in 9 years of helping kids overcome problems for a succesful adulthood.
I have a lifetime of experience and involvement in theater, including a Bachlor of Fine Arts in performance degree (1996) and many other expressive related training over the years.

The program was inspired by parents trying to find a social skills program.  Using both my therapy profession and expressive/theatrical background would become the effective receipe for treating social needs of kids who have trouble reading expressions, interpreting body language, understanding social cues, managing emotions and becoming comfortable in social situations.
About the Mission

We know how central interacting is and often take the basic skills we have for it for granted. What if you couldn't socialize well? What if everything about socializing was like a foreign language to you? Consider the vitalness of communicating
column2: Employment, relationships, getting needs met.  Imagine the deteriorating effects not being able to communicate well has on a developing child and on the quality of their life in the years to come.

column1: Kids with Autistic Spectrum Disorders, such as Aspergers Syndrome Disorder, get services that address interaction behaviors.  But consider how extremely rare it is to have a program that centers itself completely on social skills development, with an instructor equipped with a lifelong experience in the theatre, and instilled with many years of therapy-related experience and education to use.
<div>
The Needs:

We are in dire need of start up costs associated with treatment service supplies, equipment, stage platform construction, puppetering materials, and all other needed materials involved in the actual service delivery.
We also need funds the cover rental space.  In the event that enough money is collected it can go to families who can not afford to place their child in the program.
<div>
The plea:

This unique opportunity is a special service that is ideal for children dealing with symptoms associated with Autism Spectrum Disorders.  This program needs to have a life in order to be available.  Please contribute what you can.  A fund large or small we need them all.  Make certain that this service is a reality for kids who wish things like having friends, not being bullied, having more confidence and knowing social language.
Thank you so much!!!  For more information please email Therapeutic Recreation Services of Idaho at trsidaho@gmail.com or call 208-863-2409.
Jodi Deerfield MS,CTRS

Short Summary

My name is William Davenport.
column2: >I have been involved in working with autism for over a decade. I am a documentary filmmaker and special education teacher. My specialty is teaching filmmaking to people on the spectrum. I have done this for years and many of my students have become close friends. In 2011 I released a feature documentary titled ""Too Sane for This World"". The film features interviews with twelve adults on the spectrum, ages 19 to 68. The film was shown at festivals around the globe. The film originated from my work with a San Francisco based organization called AASCEND
column3:
>(Autism, Aspergers Syndrome Coalition for Education Networking and Development.) 

After screening the film,
column4:
> people have remarked to me, ""I didn't even know that adults have autism"". I have been shocked at times by the lack of awareness. This is due to the fact of how the media has portrayed autism. Things have been changing, but slowly. We need to address this issue as a community. Many of my friends and associates on the spectrum are effected by the lack of awareness in their day to day lives. 

I am inspired to do this project by some words that Ari Ne'eman spoke in my film ""citizen autistic"": ""the best way for people to learn about autism is for them to meet someone on spectrum."" Awareness is done through contact and clear information.

Basically I see the project as happening in October of 2014. We would start on the East Coast and travel across the United States to the West Coast. Mainly we would be presenting at public and charter schools, but I can see also collaborating with different local organizations. 

Five adults on the spectrum, who are varied in age, ethnicity and autism traits would present a workshop of their conception, giving people real information from someone on the spectrum.
column5: >Basically we will be like a touring band coming to your town.

What You Get

The funds for the project will be going toward the following:

Renting a tour bus where we can display a banner with the heading AUTISM ON THE ROAD. 

To cover general expenses such as gas, food and lodging.

One of the participants will be coming from Europe, so we will need a plane ticket for this participant.

We will also need to create printed materials, that will be about autism awareness to give people information about autism.
column15:
>The Impact

Autism is misunderstood and what this leads to is the continued suppression of a valuable resource. Someone on the spectrum is not someone that needs to be cured. So much money is waisted on genetic research. Funding needs to go into education and vocational training. People need to know about great organizations, such as ASAN (Autistic Self Advocacy Network)
column16:
>http://autisticadvocacy.org/ and AASCEND. I also have a film titled ""citizen autistic"", which is about the autism self-advocacy movement. You can watch it online at 

https://vimeo.com/62495103


Other Ways You Can Help

Host us. If you have a large house or can help us organize a workshop please contact us. Any help is appreciated.

","Short SummaryMy name is William Davenport. I have been involved in working with autism for over a decade. I am a documentary filmmaker and special education teacher. My specialty is teaching filmmaking to people on the spectrum. I have done this for years and many of my students have become close friends. In 2011 I released a feature documentary titled ""Too Sane for This World"". The film features interviews with twelve adults on the spectrum, ages 19 to 68. The film was shown at festivals around the globe. The film originated from my work with a San Francisco based organization called AASCEND (Autism, Aspergers Syndrome Coalition for Education Networking and Development.) After screening the film, people have remarked to me, ""I didn't even know that adults have autism"". I have been shocked at times by the lack of awareness. This is due to the fact of how the media has portrayed autism. Things have been changing, but slowly. We need to address this issue as a community. Many of my friends and associates on the spectrum are effected by the lack of awareness in their day to day lives. I am inspired to do this project by some words that Ari Ne'eman spoke in my film ""citizen autistic"": ""the best way for people to learn about autism is for them to meet someone on spectrum."" Awareness is done through contact and clear information.Basically I see the project as happening in October of 2014. We would start on the East Coast and travel across the United States to the West Coast. Mainly we would be presenting at public and charter schools, but I can see also collaborating with different local organizations. Five adults on the spectrum, who are varied in age, ethnicity and autism traits would present a workshop of their conception, giving people real information from someone on the spectrum. Basically we will be like a touring band coming to your town. While we are on the road I will be filming a documentary about the experience. We would also seek donations for worthy organizations such as AASCEND and ASAN (Autistic Self Advocacy Network).  http://autisticadvocacy.org/You can find out more about my films at: http://www.talkstoryfilms.com/You can find out more about AASCEND here: http://www.aascend.org/What We Need & What You GetThe funds for the project will be going toward the following:Renting a tour bus where we can display a banner with the heading AUTISM ON THE ROAD. To cover general expenses such as gas, food and lodging.One of the participants will be coming from Europe, so we will need a plane ticket for this participant.We will also need to create printed materials, that will be about autism awareness to give people information about autism. The ImpactAutism is misunderstood and what this leads to is the continued suppression of a valuable resource. Someone on the spectrum is not someone that needs to be cured. So much money is waisted on genetic research. Funding needs to go into education and vocational training. People need to know about great organizations, such as ASAN (Autistic Self Advocacy Network)  http://autisticadvocacy.org/ and AASCEND. I also have a film titled ""citizen autistic"", which is about the autism self-advocacy movement. You can watch it online at https://vimeo.com/62495103Other Ways You Can HelpHost us. The student members of Raiders Helping Others preform multiple Community Service projects per month in the Lubbock, TX community.  Past projects have included support for the South Plains Wildlife Rehabilitation Center, Animal Haven, Carrillon House, Ronald McDonald House, Lubbock MHMR, the Childrens Home of Lubbock, and many others.
During Spring Break 2013, the organization will sponsor several trip teams that will spend their break volunteering.

Team 1: Give Kids The World (GKTW) is a non-for-profit resort in central Florida that focuses on fulfilling wishes for children with life-threatening illnesses.  Duirng their time in FL, this team will work on projects such as physical resort improvements, serving meals to families, staffing various components of the GKTW village, and providing nightly entertainment.

Team 2: Carlsbad National Park, home of the world famous Carlsbad Caverns, is a park in southeastern New Mexico.  This trip team will spend the week working alongside the National Parks Service to restore various parts of the park, and will focus on sustainability and environmental restoration.
Funding raised through this campaign will support the service work preformed by this organization and its members.
What We Need &
We estimate that the service trip to Florida will cost our group about $13,000 and the trip to Carlsbad will cost rougly $5000, with the largest expences being lodging and transportation.
Collectively, we anticipate the trips costing our organization $18,000.
Each member of a trip team has paid organizational dues, and will have several payment deadlines to reach before the trips.

Group members are working actively to collect funding in a variety of ways including through on-campus events, corporate donors, personal contributions, and donations. Any money not fundraised will be paid by the student members out of pocket.

All donations through this site will be applied evenly to student trip accounts in support of their service work.  In the unlikely event that funding exceeds the trip balances, excess funding will be used to support future local service projects.
We are working to secure a number of 'perks' for you.  Keep checking back as we hope to continue to offer incentives for you and your friends to donate.
If you'd like to follow along, visit the groups Facebook page at: http://www.facebook.com/TTURHO

You can also visit our Youtube account to see video reflections made during past student volunteer trips. http://www.youtube.com/user/TTUHousing

column4:
>


Here is your opportunity to help break a cycle of poverty and persecution.

My name is Michelle Suazo. I own my own graphic design firm and spent time this past summer volunteering for the Safe House of Hope in Baltimore, Maryland.  As part of our SHOH’s outreach I was introduced to a Roma family and immediately was drawn to them and their tragic circumstances trying to survive the streets of Baltimore by begging on the streets.  As I got to know them better I fell in love with these beautiful people.  Roma’s are often referred to as Gypsies and as an ethnic class have faced severe persecution in Europe and elsewhere around the world.  

This culture has been denied education and acceptance into the community throughout Romania and Europe.  Sadly, this has led to a large group of poorly educated and trained people who are forced to do desperate things to simply survive. 

This group fled severe persecution, discrimination and poverty in Romania hoping for better life in Italy.  Once there, it was only marginally better than in Romania.  They repeatedly had their temporary housing torn down. The family’s last camp was burnt down by the police with gasoline while people were still inside their homes. After losing friends in the fire the group decided to flee to America. 

My Roma friends currently live in a house together in a Baltimore neighborhood that is considered one of the most dangerous in the city.  There are 3 mothers and 7 kids that have struggled to survive by begging and doing whatever they could to raise money for the “family”.  The kids range in age from 2 to 16 years old.

Our biggest accomplishment was 2 weeks ago when the little ones started school for the first time. This was monumental especially for the 8 &
column5: 9 year olds. If these children were in still in Romania or in Europe, this opportunity would have been very difficult traveling from camp to camp. It still is very difficult culturally and economically having a stable environment to maintain a routine. Unfortunately the teenage girls don't have the luxury of school yet, because they are still responsible to raise money for food &amp
column6:
rent. 

The families are starting the asylum process with Catholic Charities. Within this group Alina Constantin and her two children, Grifina and Antonio, are furthest along. Their asylum hearing is scheduled for April 2014.  During this period of time, they are not allowed to beg on the street for money, which again is how they have survived to this point.  Once they receive asylum, they will be allowed to legally work, which will help further break the challenges and cycle of severe poverty.

Now we are at the point where the family needs to figure out how to get from today through April 2014, when we feel they will receive asylum and be able to work legally, be self sufficient and flourish with education.  Here is where you can help.  Any donations we receive will be used to pay for rent and food to get this group through April.

Thank you for any help!

The Kids

Here are my buddies who remind me to be grateful, who grab my hand to pray over a slice of pizza, who always smile and laugh despite the fact they slept on floor boards the night before….

Alexc, age 6

Hello All,

Thank you so much for stopping by. My name is Diego Santiago and I am currently a senior studying Diversity Studies at the University of West Florida in Pensacola, FL. During my time in college, I have discovered my passion of aiding in the development of college students through providing high impact experiences. I want to continue my work in serving others and helping to create the leaders of tomorrow by pursuing my Master's degree in Higher Education Administration.

Currently, I am working four jobs to put myself through college and to pay my current bills. I am also engaged to my supportive and loving fiancé. Atop of the stresses of being a senior, having four jobs, and trying to pay for a wedding, I am finding that also having funds for applying for graduate school is non-existent. I am applying to six different graduate schools and the applications fees are very costly. Additionally, once accepted to programs, I will need to travel to the universities in order to interview with them to be fully accepted.
Contributions
Your contributions will help me pay for my applications as well as for travel to the universities. I cannot express how much this would help me out in achieving my dreams and goals.
Expenses:
Graduate Application Fees: $200+
University of Connecticut, University of Pennsylvania, Penn State University, Vanderbilt University, Florida State University, University of Central Florida
Additional Fees (Transcript requests): $80+
GRE Testing: $98
Travel, lodging, food, interview attire, time away from work: $2000+
My Portfolio:

You can access my LinkedIn account to look at all of my accomplishments while I've been at college in order to give you a better understanding of my candidacy for graduate school. I will be graduating with honors, Magna Cum Laude (3.70-3.90 GPA) on May 3rd, 2014.
Thank you,
Diego

Short Summary

Captain Cooper Elementary School in Big Sur is fundraising to sustain its beautiful school garden and continue its garden class. Every one of the wonderful pre-school through fifth-grade students receives a unique learning experience through the talented garden teacher and the garden's diverse plants, vegetables and fruit

What We Need &
column2:
What You Get

Here's why we're fundraising:

column1:
• We need to raise $12,000 to fund our garden teacher's position.
  • If we do not raise these funds, students will most likely not have garden next year.

• With each $25 you donate to our school, you will enter one ticket into an opportunity drawing to win a dinner for four catered by Big Sur's celebrity chef Paul Corsentino (you do not need to purchase a ticket to enter the drawing).  Be sure to donate using your first and last name, or e-mail captaincoopergarden@gmail.com to let us know the person behind the username.
• The more you donate the more opportunities there are for you to win! A donation of $100 will enter five tickets in the opportunity drawing.
•  Any donation helps!

The Impact

Our fundraising campaign is to ensure our kids in Big Sur have the best elementary school experience possible. Your contribution will make huge difference because you contribution will directly fund a teaching position:

• This fundraising project is valuable to you the contributor and to the world because Captain Cooper Elementary School and our garden is shaping students and the leaders of tomorrow. 
  • Classrooms have used Donorschoose.org before and raised over $10,000 and in less the time we have allocated for this opportunity drawing.
Risks &
column2:
Challenges

Our challenge with this fundraiser is to fund this position prior to the start of school.

column1:
• Teachers and parents are working together to promote our opportunity drawing. 
  • We will be promoting the opportunity drawing at local farmers markets.

Other Ways You Can Help

Volunteer in our school garden! If you or someone you love lives in the Big Sur community, contact us at captaincoopergarden@gmail.com. We would love to have you work in our garden.

Short Summary

My name is Elizabeth Khosravi, and I’m currently a sophomore in high school. 
This year I took a challenge and decided to study abroad in Mussoorie, Uttarakhand, India.  In addition to my studies in India, I have been volunteering by teaching English in Kaplani and St John’s School which are located in the same town. The families in these Indian communities live in extreme poverty. Most of the children where I teach share their shoes for generations and need to wear the same clothes every day. Besides this, many students’ families have recently lost everything from their houses to their farms due to the strong monsoon flooding last summer. Now they are left with absolutely nothing and need to rely on the help of others. It has been life changing to see that these people find the strength to live without knowing what tomorrow will bring. 

I have also realized that kids everywhere are the same. They love to sing, dance, play, and are eager to learn no matter what their economic situation is. Every time I entered the school, the kids were eagerly waiting for me and were happy to see that someone from a different background would want to spend time with them and teach them a new language. I came there to give them my knowledge, but I did not expect to receive anything. However, they made me realize that our inner strength is the most important thing for every human being. They made me to realize how fortunate I am and how little it takes to make a huge difference. 

My respect for the families have grown tremendously because after being affected by the monsoon floods their priority has still been making sure that kids are going to school “with the smoke on their face,” hope for a better life. That made me to want to do something for them.

What We Need &
As a result of my life-changing experience with these families, I would like to help these people and I know that together we can make a difference in their lives.
column2: >My hope is that if we could share a couple of dollars with those less fortunate, we could together impact their lives and give them a hope and a chance to start again. I had a vision that by collecting monetary donations, I would be able to bring them to India when I return for my second semester.

column1: Your donation would provide mainly food for the families.  Even though India is really far and not everybody can go there to help.  I would be honored to be a bridge between your generosity and people in need.
<div>
The Impact
As little as $5 could provide food for family of 4 for couple of days and give them strength to continue dealing with their situation.

column2: >If you can’t contribute, don’t worry. Please, spread the word, tell a friend, family member, or even stranger on the street. Anything helps!

column1: Thank you so much for your time and support.
Elizabeth

That made me to want to do something for them.What We Need & What You Get

As a result of my life-changing experience with these families, I would like to help these people and I know that together we can make a difference in their lives.  My hope is that if we could share a couple of dollars with those less fortunate, we could together impact their lives and give them a hope and a chance to start again. I had a vision that by collecting monetary donations, I would be able to bring them to India when I return for my second semester.

Your donation would provide mainly food for the families.  Even though India is really far and not everybody can go there to help.  I would be honored to be a bridge between your generosity and people in need.

As little as $5 could provide food for family of 4 for couple of days and give them strength to continue dealing with their situation.
If you can’t contribute, don’t worry. Please, spread the word, tell a friend, family member, or even stranger on the street. Anything helps!
Thank you so much for your time and support.

Help non-profits that bring music education to students

We would like to bring to your attention The Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum, one such organization which has and continues to expand the reach of their community services. This non-profit enhances children's education through music while at the same time presents a replicable model of free educational support through the generosity of public and private donations. It brings invaluable extracurricular opportunities to students who otherwise wouldn't have the means to. The Museum’s Youth fund has been established to continue the expansion of the Taylor Swift Music Education Center. Taylor's amazing gift made the construction of the center possible and now the museum continues to pull it's various resources to support K-12 classroom learning and promote the development of communication, critical thinking, and teamwork skills.  More than 17,000 students and teachers participate each year.  The Museum launched distance learning programming in 2010, sharing their unique content and the Nashville creative community with classrooms across North America.


Music education-The Impact

Why music education? Time and time again we hear of new scientific evidence which points to music education as a powerful brain building tool. For example, a recent study from the University of California found that music trains the brain for higher thinking. Second graders who were given music lessons scored 27% higher on proportional math and fractions tests than children who recieved no special instruction.  Musical training permanently wires a young mind for enhanced performance. The possibilities and academic opportunities of more american students would flourish if models such as  Nashville's Museum of Country Music continue to count on the public's support and active participation.

Please listen to this interview with renowned best-selling author and professor of Neurology at the NYU School of Medicine, Dr. Oliver Sacks, for a brief corroboration on the known benefits of early musical training.

check this out!:

Dr. Oliver Sacks on early music education

Your support

Your generous donations, great or small, will go towards a wide range of needed resources for the music center such as: musical equipment, instruments, educational materials, and instructor compensation, among others. Our set goal is to raise 9,000 which will go to the Museum's  Youth Education Fund and will directly support expenses related to music education programming. These annual program expenses include the production of teacher training and classroom materials, program supplies, event production, purchase of technology, and facilitator honoraria.  The funds will enable Museum educators to pilot new programs, and ensure free access for precious audiences. 

And, we're so excited because, even though there are many great educational programs out there, you are here, right now, and as Teddy Roosevelt once said:

We hope that you choose to support the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum's Youth Education Fund and non-profit which is changing the status quo as we speak. But just to make it irresistible, we have come up with some really great perks, we would dare say, you would be hard pressed to find perks as unique and considerable as ours. No virtual high fives or thank you's, we know every buck you made cost you time and effort, so we want to reciprocrate. Please take a look at them, get excited as we are, and hit the donate button!

This non-profit enhances children's education through music while at the same time presents a replicable model of free educational support through the generosity of public and private donations. It brings invaluable extracurricular opportunities to students who otherwise wouldn't have the means to. The Museum’s Youth fund has been established to continue the expansion of the Taylor Swift Music Education Center. Taylor's amazing gift made the construction of the center possible and now the museum continues to pull it's various resources to support K-12 classroom learning and promote the development of communication, critical thinking, and teamwork skills.  More than 17,000 students and teachers participate each year.  The Museum launched distance learning programming in 2010, sharing their unique content and the Nashville creative community with classrooms across North America. Introducing... Number Rumbler!
Number Rumbler is a brain-fizzing, fun
game for families - anyone from 6 to adult can join in. When you play it you'll be having fun, practising your times tables, and developing number sense - all at the same time.
Number Rumbler was developed by
family maths charity Maths on Toast. We're really proud of Number Rumbler
and we want to get more people playing it! Thing is, to charge anything like a
reasonable price, we need to print thousands of packs. By buying a pack in advance, you'll not only get your own copy, you'll help us get Number

Rumbler to everyone!

What's Number Sense and how does Number Rumbler help?

Number sense is what it sounds like: a sense for numbers. Learning
multiplication tables is all about number facts: 2 x 5 is 10, for example.
Number sense is deeper, more fun and more valuable. It's about understanding

how numbers relate to each other more broadly.

Number Rumbler consists of a pack of cards with numbers written - and drawn - in different ways. For example, 12 could be 4+4+4 or 3x4 or drawn out as twelve dots. By playing with the cards, you'll get a better sense of how the numbers relate to one another - and because of that understanding, you'll be more flexible with numbers and more fluent when you're calculating and estimating.


How to Play
You can play noisy or quiet games

with Number Rumbler - it's up to you. A great way to start is simply to sort the cards into families - all the 12s, all the 10s, and so on. You might also want to take out some of the cards if you're playing with younger children - the blue division cards, and the green cards with words on.

Then you can get on to more advanced Number Rumbler games!
What people say
[Number Rumbler] was really fun"" -

child's comment

""I enjoyed it"" - child's comment

Where can I buy this game?"" - parent's comment

""This
is a fun game for all the family which can be used in a number of
different ways ... The cards show quantities as
calculations as well as dot arrays and this helps children to see
relationships between the different representations
and thus improve their number sense. A very simple but effective idea!"" Margaret Haseler, Primary Lead Consultant, National Numeracy
""At last a number game for children to play
with friends and family that really supports them to develop their number
sense - and practice some important number facts along the way.. There’s
no better way to learn and practice those times tables!""
Dr Alison Clark-Wilson, Research Fellow, UCL Institute of Education, and Trustee, Maths on Toast
“Making maths fun for children........that certainly happened at
The Winch during this project! It is a fantastic idea and has opened the door
to children who, not only like maths, but also those who find it challenging.
Maths on Toast has been a great organisation to partner with, if you’re interested
in making maths fun for children, please support their crowdfunding campaign!” Kim Mabbutt, Play Development Officer, The Winch
""In these troubled times what
the world needs is more numbers. And it
seems to me that multiplication is the best way to get them."" Dr
Paul Wilmott, Financial Mathematician, Lecturer, and Founding Trustee, Maths on
Toast
<h3>What We Need &amp
We need £7000. That's based on a print run, a trademark, and
the postage to get all those cards to you. You have a choice of many rewards!  For increasing amounts, you can have a
pack of Number Rumbler, a badge to wear when you win, a meetup with Alison Clark-Wilson to learn about Number Sense ... all the way to your own personalised
pack or dinner and a game with celebrated mathematician Hannah Fry. Feeling political? We'll send
some cards to the Education Select Committee for you. Or maybe you're feeling
philanthropic! If so you can send a set of cards to a local school.
The Impact
There are two
reasons this game is important. First of all, it makes playing with numbers
into a fun family game, with obvious educational benefits.
It's also important for our organisation, Maths on Toast. We are a tiny
charity, started very recently, that's here to make maths family fun. All
profits from the cards go back into helping us make more fun family maths
resources. So even beyond our target, the more you pledge, the more we'll be

able to do to make maths family and community fun. In fact, we believe that if we can get this initial funding, then we'll be able to sell many more packs of Number Rumbler  - and it will generate income that makes our organisation sustainable long-term. That means more fun, family maths activities for everyone.
Some More Backstory
We developed this game by working with real children and
parents in the London Borough of Camden. Thanks to their input, this game is
much better than it would have been otherwise. So thanks are due to the team at
the Winch and at Pancras Square Library - and also to John Lyon's Charity for
funding the early development of the game.
Risks &
The design may improve as a result of feedback during the
campaign. There's a small chance the name may change. If we are massively
successful, we may get overwhelmed and fail to meet our deadline. But that
would be a nice problem to have.
Other Ways You Can Help
The maths of crowdfunding is crazy. One in twenty people who
see this page will pledge - though the average is apparently a generous £50.
That means we need to reach over 3000 people to achieve our goal. We're small and
new and we don't have that many friends yet. Please share! The best way to do
that is to post a link on Facebook, or send an email with a link to a couple of
friends you think might be interested. Thank you :)
If you'd like to do some more systematic sharing, you can join our bevy of 'microvolunteers' through this link.
And if you're interested in selling or distributing the game once we've reached our target, please get in touch.

Who Am I?
<h3><span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
column8: >My name is Justin Burns and I'm a strength and conditioning coach in Toronto, Ontario Canada. I am also a serious strength athlete. For years I stuck to the same cookie cutter programs that could be found on the internet and always got the same results.

column1: I needed to find a new way of structuring training in order to maximize the return on my training. I have come up with a proven strength system that is guaranteed to add strength as functionality to yourself or your athletes.

This book not only gives you the tools to become stronger than ever imagined, it also includes an entire section on functional strength as well as a full section on making your own strength equipment at the fraction of the cost of buying it from the local fitness store, with out any lose in quality or integrity.

This project has been years in the making and is extremely important to me because I see to many athletes and coaches using the same old programs that sure give some results but not the drastic changes that a solid program should provide!

What We Need &
<h3><span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
column8: >In order to finish what we have done we will need $1000 in order to get the book to look and be perfect. The money not only goes toward to completion of the book (editing, graphics, formatting, publishing) but will also come right back to you in the form of perks.

column1: <div><span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
column8: >It is also important to know that even if the goal is not met that those that have contributed will still get the perks listed below and this book will become a reality!

column3: >Depending on the level of funding you will receive
column4: > the book when it is completed, Untamed Strength t-shirts, Online Coaching with Justin Burns Himself, or a combination of all three.

column1:
The Impact

Any funding will help make this book a reality. It has been a passion of mine creating it and now I want more than anything for it to become something more than some data in a word document!

No contribution is to small and this book will be created no matter what and every single dollar given will go towards creating a book that will help both athletes and coaches realize their own goals of success on the field!
Risks &
column2:
Challenges

No project comes without its challenges and I am a true believer that anything that takes hardwork and dedication is always going to be worth it in the end. Getting this book to be what I imagine is going to take time as well as take effort from people other than myself and that's where you guys come in. Be the first to help get this book on the market so you can reap the rewards that lie within!

column1: If you can't contribute in money that's OK. What I ask of you is to spread the word about this campaign and get the word out. Don't forget to use Indiegogo's sharing tools and lets get this book in the hands of athletes and coaches around the world!
","Who Am I?

My name is Justin Burns and I'm a strength and conditioning coach in Toronto, Ontario Canada. I am also a serious strength athlete. For years I stuck to the same cookie cutter programs that could be found on the internet and always got the same results.

I needed to find a new way of structuring training in order to maximize the return on my training. I have come up with a proven strength system that is guaranteed to add strength as functionality to yourself or your athletes.

This book not only gives you the tools to become stronger than ever imagined, it also includes an entire section on functional strength as well as a full section on making your own strength equipment at the fraction of the cost of buying it from the local fitness store, with out any lose in quality or integrity.

This project has been years in the making and is extremely important to me because I see to many athletes and coaches using the same old programs that sure give some results but not the drastic changes that a solid program should provide!   What We Need & What You Get

In order to finish what we have done we will need $1000 in order to get the book to look and be perfect. The money not only goes toward to completion of the book (editing, graphics, formatting, publishing) but will also come right back to you in the form of perks.
It is also important to know that even if the goal is not met that those that have contributed will still get the perks listed below and this book will become a reality!
Depending on the level of funding you will receive the book when it is completed, Untamed Strength t-shirts, Online Coaching with Justin Burns Himself, or a combination of all three.

The Impact Any funding will help make this book a reality. It has been a passion of mine creating it and now I want more than anything for it to become something more than some data in a word document!

No contribution is to small and this book will be created no matter what and every single dollar given will go towards creating a book that will help both athletes and coaches realize their own goals of success on the field!

Risks & Challenges No project comes without its challenges and I am a true believer that anything that takes hardwork and dedication is always going to be worth it in the end. Getting this book to be what I imagine is going to take time as well as take effort from people other than myself and that's where you guys come in. Be the first to help get this book on the market so you can reap the rewards that lie within!
Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute in money that's OK. What I ask of you is to spread the word about this campaign and get the word out. Don't forget to use Indiegogo's sharing tools and lets get this book in the hands of athletes and coaches around the world!",0.0,0,"2 Campaigns
